Comments: RP states big bear has gotten into "bear proof" dumpster 6x this summer.  Bear comes around 10-11 pm. Has broken hinge on dumpster. WL499 will do site inspection and give suggestions.

No further response as of now.

WL541 received a report from the RP that a large dark brown colored bear with a green ear tag in the left ear was in Tucker Gulch around 7:00pm.  It matched the description of the bear that had been hanging around Tucker Gulch and hitting trash cans within the neighborhood since last week.   
WL545, WL546 and WL541 responded to try to haze the bear.   

The bear was trees in this vicinity but ran off before it could be hazed. The bear was followed around Golden and hazed with noise and lights until it crossed over Highway 58 and was lost in the vegetation surrounding Clear Creek.

Bear ripped screen on kitchen door, fortunately did not enter. Site inspection discuss open windows, attractants. Recommend bars on windows electric fencing. Provide bottle of Counterassault with verbal instructions on use/safety.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Pyrotechnics
Comments: RP sent Krall a video of a small brown/cinnamon bear on the upper deck of the house leaning on the glass door.  RP said there are two bears about the same size, one darker brown.  He said they are hanging around the house pretty regular and do not show much fear.  RP suspects the people he had been renting the house to had been feeding them.  Krall has tried repeatedly to contact the renters and will continue to track them down.  Krall issued the RP rubber slugs, set a spray barrel and bear mat, and used Wildlife Services hounds to try and haze the bears.

Type of Property Damage: Trash , Vehicles , Outside Food Source , Other

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting

Comments: WL 261 got a call from Chaffee County dispatch at 3:30am the night of the incident stating that a bear was getting into the RP’s trash, but was not attempting to get into the house. WL 261 called the RP and she stated the bear had left but that it had gotten close to her house since she puts the trash close to her house. She also stated she had the window open and was scared for her and her child. WL 261 recommended a few ways she could make her trash more bear resistant and informed her how she could haze the bear with noise if it ever returned. She asked if we would trap the bear and WL 261 stated at this time that CPW would not but asked if she would be ok with placing a pepper barrel on her property for a few nights to try and haze the bear if it came back. She stated that she would very much like that. WL 261 called the RP on 07/08/2020 to set up a time to place the pepper barrel on the property, but has not yet received a call back.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials
Comments: Bear went in back yard and killed free range chickens, got into trash etc.  Set a pepper spray barrel.  Performed a site inspection and recommended securing chickens and ducks in enclosed pen at night and electrifying the pen, clean up feed bags and place them in locked container, secure trash cans, remove other attractants from their yard.  House is located in quality bear habitat so future conflicts are imminent if they continue to leave food and trash out.  Gave them a Living with Bears pamphlet for further bear aware recommendations.  I’ll return to pick up spray barrel in 3-4 days.  Asked RP to call if they have any further conflicts.  Made sure to warn the RP of the importance of keeping her children and pets away from the spray barrel. Wore mask during entire contact and maintained social distancing where possible.

Black colored 2-3 year old bear entered RP’s yard from an irrigation canal trail. Bear moved south. Parks Officer Kathleen Fisher and I watched the bear swim across Corn Lake, cross 32 Road, and move into the Colorado River riparian zone east of 32 Road. The bear was not seen after that.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments: Bear was getting feed putout for birds. Entered garage and pulled out several bags of feed. Bear came back 5 nights in row and entered garage. 327 set trap and caught bear on third night set. This may have been the bear that enter a house a few night before being trapped.

Bear came in and got into the dumpster and pulled trash out.  Rp feeds 4 cats on the porch.  Cat food cans were in the trash dumpster.  Hummingbird feeders were also hanging outside.  WL 264 recommended not putting out the hummingbird feeders.  Recommended cleaning up immediately after the cats were fed and bringing food bowls inside so there were no outside attractants on the deck.  Helped RP put ratchet straps over the lids of the dumpster.  Gave her 3 rounds of rubber buck and did a release form.  Gave her my card and asked her to call if she had anymore conflicts with the bear.
Bear killed 1 ewe and 2 lambs

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments:
RP reported that this morning he discovered a bear had killed approximately 12 chickens overnight and two of his goats were missing. WL521 responded and observed bear scat and 8 chicken carcasses inside of a coup. WL521 set a bear trap adjacent to the coup. No blood,  drag marks or other sign of a dead or injured goat was located. RP agreed that the goats had probably run off while the bear was attacking the chickens. Goats had been in a fenced pen. WL521 advised RP that electric fencing would be the long term solution but RP stated,  "the last guy said that but it's too expensive." WL521 confirmed with both WL525 and WL524 that they had contacted the RP in the past and advised him that electric fencing would remedy the bear conflict occurring at the property.

Nicholson drove to property on 7/31 to remove trap. Upon 10:00am arrival, trap door was shut and Nicholson found an adult dark brown bear inside trap. RP had never called to advise Bear was in trap. Bear matches description of bear depredating and causing problems at neighboring  homes. RP said he believed it was same bear that depredated his livestock. RP said a smaller cinnamon colored bear is still hanging around and asked what Nicholson would do with it. Nicholson told RP he was not removing another bear from property and RP needed to construct an electric fence as he had been told in past by wildlife officers.  Nicholson gave RP handouts with  material lists and directions for building a proper electric fence to keep bears away from his livestock. RP said he would do so. 

Nicholson euthanized bear at CPW property. Bear was adult male, dark chocolate brown, about 200 lbs, had bird seed in stomach, had numerous size 7.5 and size 2 shot pellets in fat throughout body. Bear was skinned and seal #33685 affixed. Entered by Nicholson on 7/31/2020.

Info only, no response needed. Call came into San Miguel Sheriff of bear attempting entry if house. RP and children barricaded in master bedroom. SMSO deputy unable to respond. WL382 responded knowing bear would be gone before arrival. RP stated that large bear pawed at locked french door windows. No potential for entry. Bear received no reward.

Trap set at 5:00 PM.    Caught at 7:00 PM,  no PIT TAG. No PIT TAG no PIT Tag.  Bar code  is not correct but app would not save without it.  Bear released at Lone Cone SWA.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Rehabilitation
Comments:
WL281 received a call around 1:11 AM that a man was attacked by a bear. Dispatch told him that the man had no contact with the bear and he was ok. They also told him that the bear was dead. 
WL 281 called the RP, Richard Gallion, and confirmed that he was ok. He stated he had no contact with the bear, but it had come close to him. He then stated that he killed the bear and a there were two cubs up the tree still. 
Upon further questioning the RP stated that he went outside to see what his dogs were barking at. He saw his dogs near a bear, that was in a tree. He was scared his dogs were going to be attacked so he went to pull them back. As he got closer he felt like his life was in danger and he shot and killed the bear. He stated that the bear came out of the tree and died a short distance from it. 
The sow was investigated by WL281 and WL287. 
Two cubs were darted and transported to a local rehaber.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: Several bear sitings over the past week and a half, including a closer encounter. Bear is not aggressive and doesn’t seem to have gotten any food rewards. Camp host is on top of trash and they do have bear proof trash containers.  Met with RP and camp host and gave them “bear warning” signs, the larger “living with wildlife in bear country” signs, and brochures. DWM Gallegos spoke to several campers as well.

Area 15 office received a call Around 1640 hours from fire dispatch that Joe Morris, East Canyon Fire incident commander reported an injured bear with burned pads crossed a meadow and headed to a pond. 326 got the message and responded along with Souva from office and officers Brown and Thorpe. Thorpe called Frisco Creek who said they were willing to accept the bear for evaluation. Brown heard from FS folks about the injured bear. Once at scene, 326 and 327 loaded darts and with Souva, found bear bedded in reeds at the edge of the pond. Thorpe arrived and with jab poles, we parted the reeds for 327 to dart the bear. The bear, a yearling male, was small and all four pads were burned and peeled. Loaded bear in trap and relayed bear to Wolf Creek at approximately 2045 hours, were it was transferred to Frisco Creek. Bear will be evaluated on June 17. No pit tag or ear tag attached at this time. UTM , Datum NAD83 for bear is approximately 12S 0748208, 4130641.
Reported bear hit on I-70 mm182 that needed put down.  Responded,  bear had wandered up hill north of interstate.   Mobile and no external injuries.  Moving slow but mobile.
RP had bear in tree at residence.
Problem bear in the area. Has opened multiple car doors. RP stated bear opened doors on two separate vehicles. No damage to vehicles. Scratches on front door to house.

There has been numerous encounters of this bear in the area documented in other apps
Roadkill sub adult blonde in color bear

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting
Comments: RP stated bear got into storage unit below deck at her house. Broke the window last year and boarded windows. Ripped boards off about a month ago and put them back up a week and half ago. Ripped boards down again and got back in on Saturday. Tired to also get into the door last week but was not successful. Got in the trash Sunday morning. It is bear proof but it pried it open. No other damage. _SC HSS wl488 Spoke w rp on 9/2 and confirmed bear issues. Hasn’t broken into occupied part of dwelling but numerous break ins to storage area below house. Advised unwelcome mats and less lethal but rp has no shotgun. Will try unwelcome mats. Bear last there on Sunday. Rp says bear tagged but only saw one white tag. Recently a double green ear tagged bear has been getting into trouble that is also large and black like this Rp describes. Asked rp to try and get photo and description from neighbors to confirm bear identity. Also advised basic bear aware for trash, cars etc.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
RP left a message at the Salida Service Center over the weekend regarding a bear that killed chickens and knocked over her beehives.  Received the message on 8/10/2020 when the office was open.

Contacted RP who told me a bear killed their chickens and knocked over their beehives.  RP told me it happened on Saturday, time unknown.  Conducted a site inspection, told them how to better secure their coop with electric fencing and brought them an apiary kit.

I did not feel comfortable setting a trap because of the amount of time that passed.  They are located next to a creek, are near the river, and are located in prime bear habitat.  I did not want to accidentally capture the wrong bear.  I have heard about several bears in the general area. RP was fine with me not setting a trap.

Told her to contact me immediately if it happens again.  Gave her my cell phone number.

Note-Time on the app is not correct.  We do not know at what time this happened.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
Bears were walking thru the property regularly. Neighbor behind the address has a pit for his deceased cattle that attract wildlife. They have had bear in bird feeders, which were taken down prior to my visit. Bears into neighbors trash when they go away for weekend. Bears in compost that they don’t use anymore and have stopped using for their  chickens. 
Bear came to property, got into chicken and duck enclosure, went into barn and killed a pig. RP shot at bear and missed.  The bear was not scared off., Mark reloaded his handgun then the bear dropped the 30 pound pig which was eviscerated but still alive. Mark put the pig down and bear went off into the Oak brush. The RP states they have seen 4 bears around. Including a sow with 2 cubs. Told Rp to fortify the pig shed for remaining 2 pigs and food, use electricity. Gave rubber buck to Mark. Set a trap on 6/8 with camera. Captured bear in trap on 6/11/2020.

Josiah called to report that the bear was no longer coming by his house but had moved over near the neighborhood's house.

Wildlife Officer Rocksund received a phone. All from CSP about a Sow and her two cubs inside a garage getting frozen food out of the freezer. WLO Westbrook approached the bears and activated his arch switch in his taser to haze the bears, they were weary of WLO Westbrook and left the scene. WLO Westbrook talked to the party with the open garage and they stated that they did not mean to leave their garage open on purpose and they are aware of the bears in their neighborhood and ways to haze them away.  -WLO 549

RP killed bear in chicken coop on 8/9. Seal #36382.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior

Comments:
On Saturday July 18, 2020 WLO 523 recived a four plus hour old  report that was third hand about a possible injued bear near the Ben-Tyler trail 1.2 miles in from the Rock Creek parking area.  WLO talked to the reporting party who had received a text that was a few hours old from a coworker who was side to have seen an injured bear.  WLO 523 attempted to reach the original individual involved, however they were still not in cell service.  WLO gathered what limited information was available and headed that direction.  However, before reaching the trailhead WLO 523 was called to assist Park County Sheriff's Office and CSP with a roll over accident at Terreyall Reservoir.
WLO 522 and WLO 521 where both made aware of the report. 
On Sunday the 19th an email was sent to CPW (ask a question page) from one of the hikers original involved.
On Monday the 20th this information was passed along to WLO 523.  WLO 523 then contacted the original patient and was able to follow-up on the report.

During the phone conversation WLO was informed of the following information from Samantha Condron.
On Saturday the 18th four parties parked at the Rock Creek parking  areas along USFS road 133.  From this location they could hear what they thought was an injured donkey or possibly a injured bear.  It was "roaring" (or actually likely bellowing) and although they stated they were scared they decided to hike in on the Colorado Trail to the Ben-Tyler trail in an attempt to locate and render aid to this injured animal.  The RP was very worried that some animal was very sick or injured as she explained that the trail was covered with "fresh diarrhea" and it seemed clear to her that this animal was in a great deal of pain from the sounds she heard.  They continued down the Ben-Tyler trail and about 100 yards after the hopped over a log in the trail.  It was at about this point when they contacted two other hikers who were running down the trail and who claimed that they too had heard the noise and went to investigate.  These other hikers explained that they had just seen a large black bear in the bushes and that it had run at them and they saw the teeth of the bear big.
Following this the entire group, which now include both hiking parties and now totalled 6 people, all ran the entire way back to the parking area.

WLO was able to clarify that Samantha had not personally seen, nor had anyone in her hiking party, the suspected bear i  question.  Furthermore, they only suspected it was injured or sick based solely upon the sounds they heard and the diarrhea they had seen on the trail.  And finally, that they had believed it to be the sounds of a bear (as had the other hiking party) while still in the parking lot before they had even started to hike in.  This assumption was further validated when they had come in contact with other scared hikers who were running down the trail.

WLO 523 felt rather confident that he had a good idea what had occurred, nevertheless, after talking with the RP he drove to the Rock Creek parking lot and attempted to retrace the path taken and collecte physical evidence of what had actually occurred on the 18th.

WLO 523 easily followed the Colorado Trail to the intersection with the  Ben-Tyler tail.  Along the way he to observed diarrhea in the trail, see photos.   He also passed the animals from which had been responsible for leaving this in the trail.  It should be noted that they were indeed large and black in color, see additional photos.  He continues along the trail and came to the log and crossed it and continued to approximately where the interaction occurred.  Here again there was plenty of sign left in and along  the trail.  Feeling confident in his findings and initial assessment of the situation WLO 523 returned to the parking area.  Although he had planned to post a warning sign at the trail head, alerting hikers to bear activity in the area the sign was not posted because there had not been any physical evidence to support the claim that a bear had been in the area a few days prior.  
Rather this was verly likley a case of mistaken identity.  
This would be best referred it biologist's terms as... BOVINE URSUS PRETENDUS!

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments: Bear got into trash at the RP’s residence and RP went outside to see what it was. RP approaches the bear in the dark. Bear bluff charged RP and RP fired a 9mm handgun at it. WL 222 responded and looked for an injured or dead bear.  No bear was found.

Deborah called report that a small black bear had gotten into a trash and did not easily scare way.  Deborah call Ross Bruno who came over and fired a shot into the ground in that encourage the bear to leave the area, However the bear did return the following day and at the trash can a second time.  The trash can is a bear resistant style trash can but the bear was still able to gain access into it both times.

A pepper barrel was set next to the trash cans and  Deborah was encouraged to strap these cans to a poster tree to keep them in an upright position which will further help deny access into them if and when the bear returns.

A trail camera was also set on a tree at that location to get a photo of the bear if it returns.

Pepper barrel and camera were removed on June 22nd by WLO523.  It did not appear as though the bear had returned in the meantime.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
RP reports a bear breaking into the community dumpster overnight the mornings of 9/21, 9/24, 9/25, 9/29. The dumpster is two doors down from RPs property. The bear bent the bear bars and sheared the heavy duty lock. They have tried different techniques to deter the bear. Unfortunately their trash service's head quarters is in the canyon, they are evacuated due to the fire and they are not answering their phones to help/reinforce the dumpster. 

The community volunteered to try not to dispose of their trash in the dumpster for a short period of time. This was effective until one member forgot and the bear came back. They have poured ammonia in the dumpster and soaked rags. This was also effective until the rags dried out and it returned again. 

I encouraged continuing these efforts, resoaking those rags regularly, potentially storing trash indoors until morning of pick up. I also sent educational materials. 

Bear got into trash can again on 10/5 and broke the dumpster trash lock. RP was given more deterrent advice and 186 was contacted for possible follow-up.

WL 186 had a site visit with Vanessa regarding the bear getting into the Dumpster on 10/10. He also issued Vanessa five rounds of beanbag rounds to help haze the bear. WL 186 also contacted Canyon utilities to have them replace the dumpster with a more bear proof dumpster. The new dumpster should arrive on site in the next week and a half.

On 08/25/2020 Wildlife 261 received a call from Chaffee County dispatch that a bear incident occurred in Poncha Springs. WL 261 contacted the RP and the RP stated that a few night ago a bear got into their trash. While picking up the trash that same night the bear returned and paced back and forth with its head down about 30 yards away. The trash was moved into the back enclosed porch of the house. On 08/24/2020 the bear returned and this time got into dog food which was left outside by the RP's roommate. The bear then got onto the back porch and looked through the window where the trash had been relocated too. WL 261 educated the RP and his roommate on the importance of removing all bear attractants from the outside of the house. The RP was also concerned that the bear could still smell the trash even though it was relocated in the house WL 261 suggested using rags soaked in ammonia in order to mask the smell and deter the bear. WL 261 also educated the RP on how to make unwelcome mats as a possible deterrent. During the site visit on 08/25/2020 WL 261 also gave the RP rubber slugs to have the bear if he saw it again.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Comments: Reported to USFS. RP complained that there is limited signage and enforcement of littering issues at Lost Lake. Her friend had her tent ripped into by a bear when nobody was in the tent. Bear supposedly watched the group of campers from the edge of the site before moving on to another camp. Bear reportedly received food reward at a different camp. FS and CPW posted various signs at Hessie Trailhead and other areas.

DWM Diamond set up at community dumpsters after seeing two bears in Park. Two bears arrived and checked dumpsters quickly with no opportunity to haze. Bears had already been in dumpsters prior to Diamond’s arrival. Bears proceeded to Sunspot neighborhood to the East where Gunnison PD officer attempted to haze.

On August 28th at approximately 8:00 a.m. officer Swanson received a call from Chuck Brown, who  notified him that he believed a bear had killed off the last of his chickens the prior evening or early that morning.  Mr. Brown had located the remains of five of his chickens that morning.  Mr. Brown also stated that they had a similar problem about a week prior and had lost about half a dozen birds during the evening... some of which had been eaten and others had just been injured really badly and needed to be dispatched.

WLO 523 responded and meet with R  Brown.  He was shown the checken coop.  There he was able to locate what appeared to be black colored bear hair on the entrance to the coop.  Also,the exterior fence had been forced over and muddy slide marks could be seen on the top rail and the wires where one or possibly two bears had gained access into and out of the coop/yard.

The Browns plan to build a better coop and yard here in the next few weeks before they get another batch of chickens.  WLO 523 offered to help with ideas on how to construct the coop and yard as well as offered to temporary loan them a electronical fence generator that could be used to build an additional electronic fence and unwelcome mats to help  protect the future chickens.
Also a pepper barrel was placed in the chicken yard until a later time to act as a  deterant until the new fence, yard/run, and coop cold be built.

Pepper barrel was removed by WLO523 on 11/14_20.
Improvements have been made to the chicken coop and electric fencing has been added.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Educational Materials
Comments: Eaton ranch has had a sow with two cubs coming around for several weeks. Provided rubber slugs and rubber buck. RP is concerned for cattle.
Sow and cub ripped off window screens from the RP’s bunkhouse.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments: RP said that some campers had found a dead bear near the campground.  Krall responded and found that the dead bear was the one that was hazed by hounds on the 17th  (1.5 yo male with white ear tags SE 327).  Krall necropsied the bear and could not find any obvious trauma or cause of death.  Body condition looked ok, full stomach, scat looked ok.  Bear was not in good enough condition to send to Fort Collins.

RP had bear get into unsecured trash cans multiple nights in a row. RP advised to put trash in sturdy metal building that was on the property. RP said the bear had been hanging around the area for a few weeks. RP would like some rubber buck. 326 spoke to Bob and he will stop by office to pick up some rubber buck on 7/16. Bob was trying to get a loaner bear resistant poly art from bear smart but hadn’t heard back from Bryan.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments:
WL283 responded to this location as a sighting. The bear has been getting into this dumpster on and off for months. Apparently the dumpster behind the Pizza Hut and other food places in the strip mall to the north of the drainage has been doing good until recently of keeping the dumpster closed and locked, but now the bear has been getting into it again. The bear likes to hang out in the culvert near the dumpster.

WL283 talked with workers inside the Pizza Hut and was given a memo that was sent out by the property owner (see the memo in the pictures). The property owner is aware of the bear and has advised its tenants to keep the dumpster closed. The Pizza Hut workers stated that at one point the property manager had been talking about getting a new dumpster. 

WL283 decided to make one more pass by the dumpster before he left and encountered the bear in the drainage ditch. WL283 hazed the bear with 2 rubber buckshot rounds. The bear ran up into the culvert that goes about a mile back under the street.

WL283 can follow up with the property manager tomorrow unless WL287 wants to.

Please call RP. RP says that a bear or lion killed 10 of her Nigerian dwarf goats last night that she uses for yoga. Goats were in a pen last night when they were killed. RP will keep goats in a horse trailer tonight to prevent further depredation .

RP states that a medium sized brown/cinnamon colored bear came onto her back porch and got cat food.  The bear also leaned up against a window and looked inside.  The RP is elderly.  A neighbor at 208 Paintbrush had the same bear on their deck.  Krall put a temporary electric fence around Raykop’s back porch so she could feed her cat.  Krall placed a pepper barrel and issued rubber slugs and two bear bear mats to the neighbor Caryn Montelione.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments: RP had been seeing a bear that is starting to lose its fear of people. No food sources available. we discussed negative reinforcement techniques and community efforts. 326 met with RP and issues rubber buck. Discussed unwelcome mats and other attractant management. Bear just hanging out in area, not getting into buildings or vehicles.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Pyrotechnics
Comments: RP told Krall that a sow with two cubs killed several chickens that were stored in a tote next to their house at about 9 pm.  She sent Krall a photo of the sow which was brown.  Krall gave her rubber slugs, a bear mat and set a spray barrel.  Krall encouraged her to put up electric fencing to protect her chickens and goats.

Bear was called in around midnight being lethargic in a dumpster. 

Bear was still in the dumpster around 10 AM. WL 281 responded and found the bear was lethargic and not acting right. Bear was tranquilized and assessed. 
Bear had a broken jaw, injured front left paw and was Older based on the teeth. 

Bear was euthanized. Seal #40445

Responded to set pepper barrel at RP’s house. Pastor for Idledale Community Church lives below RP, they advised bear has been trying to get trash at church. Nicholson set pepper barrel at church on same date.

Entered by Nicholson on 6/7/2020

WLO523 checked on the pepper barrel on 06-15-2020...  but it will remain at that location until WLO525 can remove it!

Nicholson removed pepper barrel on 6/16/2020. Entered by Nicholson

Bear cub hit by unknown motor vehicle, reported to JCSO. Nicholson responded and took possession of bear carcass. Hide on bear cub was tore open in accident. Mortality documented with seal #33681. 

Necropsy revealed bird seed, cut up pieces of cantaloupe, and 4 mice in stomach contents. Nicholson removed all trophy parts (claws and teeth), disposed of carcass, and cut metal seal. Entered by Nicholson on 8/10/2020.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage
Service Provided: No Action , Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments:
PCBR: bear just walked in the house and left got into dog food he is out of the house on the back deck now
Trap set 4/8 caught 4/9
Bear entered garage through open door. Tipped stuff over and knocked things around looking for food but found nothing.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: RP reported a large bear, the same bear from previous reports in the Aspen Trails neighborhood showed up at night and knocked their bear resistant trash can over and was not able to get into it.  The RP woke up when their dog started barking at the bear outside.  RP had previously been issued rubber slugs.  RP walked out on deck, shouted at the bear 30 yards away.  The bear was not scared of the loud noises or human presence.  The RP fired 2 rounds of rubber slugs at the bear, hitting it both times.  The bear did not run away, merely circled around the driveway the stayed nearby in the brush.  The RP and other neighbors are concerned about the bears behavior and lack of fear towards humans and dogs.  Another neighbor had reported that this same bear broke into another neighbors topper on his truck that same night.  There was no other information given as to who or where the break in occurred. WL324 set a trap and trail camera at the RP residence for 4 nights, and did not catch the bear.  Camera pictures showed the bear had not returned at all to the location.

A large, 400lbs, bear was seen at the RPs address with an injured left front paw. 
WL281 arrived and hazed the bear via noise and the bear was clearly afraid of people. It ran, while limping, and managed to get over a 6 ft fence without any issue. 

The bear was never aggressive and the injury appears to be low on the paw. Will monitor the situation.

RP called saying a bear was chasing his goats and running around his horse pens. Advised RP they were within their legal rights to shoot the bear if it was a threat to livestock. RP shot and killed bear in horse corral on the Triple Creek Ranch. Everything checked out on investigation the next day and carcass was removed, and samples taken. Appeared to be a 2 yo cinnamon bear.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
At around 4:45 am yesterday morning a bear entered a kitchen by tearing the screen off the window and took the cookies and corn that was sitting on the counter.

Trap was pulled on 7/17/2020 by WL290 with no bear caught.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Euthanized
Comments:
Officer Notified
RP called to report that there was a bear in a tree in her backyard. The RP came home from a hike and walked out onto her back porch and heard noise coming from a large tree behind her house. When she looked into the tree she saw a large bear in the tree. When she called NERO it was still in the tree and the RP had gone in her house and was watching the bear. I told the RP to remain in the house and bring in any pets as well. The RP's property backs up to a open space with a creek and she thinks that the bear was using that creek bed as a way of getting around the area. WO546 was contacted and given the RP's information and location of the bear. LB

Bear had been previously tagged. Had been moved out of the metro area from Bowles  And Platte Canyon back in 2017.  Bear was tranquilized out of tree and taken off site and euthanized.
JM

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
Officer Notified
RP called to report that one of her beehives and her trashcans had been knocked over last night. The RP did not see a bear but her neighbors told her they had been a bear in the area before. The RP woke up around 5:30 this morning and looked out her window and saw trash all over her yard and one of her beehives knocked over. The RP thinks that, based on the number of bees on the ground, the bear might have been stung enough to be scared off. The RP says that her hives are more of a hobby and she rarely ever sells the honey. I told the RP that since the bear was rewarded, she should take precautions such as placing her trashcans inside and setting up an electric fence. The RP says the trashcans are already in her garage and that she was interested in an electric fence. I sent her the bear brochure information by email and also suggested using rags soaked in ammonia as another barrier. I contacted WO541 who said he would call the RP but since he is unable to actually visit the RP, the on call officer, WO548, was called and left a message. LB
Contacted RP on 7/16/20 and discussed her apiary situation. There was minimal damage to the beehive, and she has eight total hives and a small commercial connection with her honey and wax business. She met the qualifications for game damage fencing, and a 20‘ x 20‘ apiary fence was delivered on July 17, 2020. The RP also took additional mitigation measures and will continue to eliminate attractants on their property. J Olson #088

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments: RP called said bear was dead in neighbors yard with trash strewn about. Bear was a yearling believed to have caused other trash related incidents in La Veta. Bear appears to have been electrocuted by utility pole.

Staff Assigned: tyler.stoltzfus@state.co.us, joseph.walter@state.co.us, mark.lamb@state.co.us, jason.clay@state.co.us, jenny.campbell@state.co.us, michael.gallegos@state.co.us

Comments:
YES, further response needed, contacted WL 523. Rick said this cabin is mainly a weekend cabin and his nephew, Zach, was visiting this weekend and when he showed up on Friday he found one door open and a mess of trash on the inside from a bear. Over the course of the weekend, he sighted the bear 4 times and then on Monday morning the bear made another attempt but was unsuccessful. Zach went and got a new lock for the door to prevent further break-in (hopefully). I went over hazing the bear with an air horn, the car alarm, bear spray, rubber buck, or a paintball gun. Also told him about making bear unwelcome mats for the windows or doors. He said he was warry about bringing the trash inside in case the bear tries to break in while someone is there and I told him if they don't, then they should put ammonia-soaked rags on the trash to help hide the smell. When I asked he said he did not have bird feeders out, but then Rick sent me a video of the bear and you could see hummingbird feeders on the porch. I emailed him back and told them to take those down too. KLeCavalier

On June 23, after attempting to contact Mr. Foster on the phone WLO523 responded to the address and arrived at the locked gate leading to the property at 4:37 pm.
On the evening on June 26th, Mr. Foster returned the phone call and spoke with WLO523 about the bear issue.
On June 27th WLO523 was able to contact family members at the cabin and set a pepper barrel at that time.  WLO523 spoke to them about the bear and how to remove other bear attractants as well as how to improve the unwelcome mat that they had constructed.  They also talked about fish improvement projects on the property and whatnot.
The pepper barrel should remain for a week or two and then be removed.
Pepper barrel was removed by WLO 523 and at that time he also met with additional members of the family who stated that the bear has not been seen on the property again in a while.

Reports that the bear returned to the property and attempted to again gain entry into the home were made.
WLO 523 again responded and meet with the new family members who were staying at the cabin at this point and replaced the pepper barrel as well as set up a trail camera.

Photos on the trail camera indicated th return of  bear on the evening of the 23rd and 26th both at about 8:30pm.  It appeared as though the bear might have been sprayed by the pepper barrel on the nightnof the 23rd.
A quick inspection of the property on the 28th indicated that it was likely a bear had gained entry into a shed near the home and had feed on both bird seed and fish pellets.
This information was then passed on to Mr. Foster.

WL128 arrived around 6pm to attempt to haze bear. Heard reports from 2 separate parties of a brown, st Bernard height bear eating trash in a bag left behind by campers at Site 3. 128 found 2 tents that had been collapsed by a bear (site 5/6). Campers returned at sundown and reported they had left their food in their tent during a day hike, bear must have come by sometime between ~10am and sundown. 128 left appx 11pm, received text from different camper the next morning at site 2 saying bear got into food cache that 128 had helped hang ~20 feet up in a tree.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Trap Set , Educational Materials

Comments: RP called and said a sow and two cubs were in his enclosed porch eating dog food and unopened extra food storage.  RP said they went through an open window.  WL521 asked RP to bang on the walls and make noise.  RP did and bears left.  WL521 set a pepper barrel and advised about keeping windows shut,  unwelcome mats and ammonia.

Sheep herder found two lamb carcasses days earlier.  Morning of June 15 found freshly killed lamb.  I inspected lamb carcass and believe a bear killed it, possible lion.  Large bite wound at base of skull, not dragged or buried. Not fed on.    Bear was seen walking down road from area of lamb kill as I was driving in.  Wildlife Services will sit on carcass night of June 15. Wildlife services did not see any predators near sheep carcass night of June 15.  June 28-30 2 ewes and one lamb killed.  June 30 herder shot bear, did not recover in brush.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials

Comments: Attempted to locate with hounds on June 9 and June 11.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
On 07/31/2020 Wildlife 261 was contacted by the RP. She stated that she works for several bed and breakfasts in Garfield and one of the ones she works for has home security cameras that video taped an injured bear the night before.  She stated that it had an injured back leg and she shared the video with WL 261.  After watching the video WL 261 believed that the injury was not life threatening to the bear. The RP told WL 261 that neighbors in the area have told her that the bear is tipping over their garbage at night, but she has not had any issues with that so far. WL 261 educated the RP on putting away bear attractants at night at all of her places of work, and offered Rubber Buckshot to haze the bear if it was seen by the RP again. The RP stated that she did not have a 12 gauge shotgun, but stated that she would ask her neighbors if they did so that WL 261 could get them some Rubber Buckshot.

The RP informed WL 261 that the bear was seen again on camera  on 08/01/2020.

On 08/05/2020 the RP (homeowner who lives out of state) text WL 261 that the bear had been back on the back porch of the residence and got into a cooler of ice that the guests of the residence have left out. WL 261 asked the RP if she informs guests of her house about bringing in food and bear attractants at night when renting the residence and she stated that she does and that it is in the rental agreement. WL 261 emailed the RP bear education fliers about bear proofing a house and living with bears to email to each renter that she has. The RP agreed to send them out. On 08/06/2020 WL 261 went to the property in an attempt to haze the bear but the bear was not seen in between the times of 1:00 AM - 1:45 AM, the time the RP stated the bear comes around.  

On 08/09/2020 the RP text WL 261 again stating that on 08/06/2020 the bear returned and was on the back porch again but the guests had removed the cooler and the bear did not get into anything. That same night the bear also dug a hole under the front porch. WL 261 will again try to haze the bear on 08/11/2020 when no guests are present in the residence so that he can be on the property for a prolonged amount of time.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Hazed
Comments:
RP reported hearing a loud noise in the kitchen at around 1:30 AM. She yelled thinking it was her kids. She then discovered the screen was ripped out of the window and clear bear paw prints in the kitchen. Bear had left out of the window before she saw it. Home was occupied by the RP and two small children at the time. 

WL 527 responded and set the culvert trap from Staunton on 7/22. Bear is small in size. Pictures of  prints are attached. WALTER

On the evening of July 25th at about 9:30 p.m. WLO523 was notified that a bear had been caught in the cage trap.
 Unfortunately upon arrival it was determined that this was not the target bear associated with entering the home but rather a large bore with two green ear tags number 1083.  It appeared to be in good health and had a black colored coat 
WLO 523 was able to determine that this bear had been captured in area 5 the year prior... also as a none target bear.  Thus, this bear was taken a short ways out of town and released and hit with pepper spray as it left the trap.
The trap was cleaned out but not reset at the above address at this time.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
Bear got into their trash last Tuesday after they put it out in the AM.

Two days ago it came back at apx. 8:30 PM and lifted the garage door, got inside and dragged out a 30 pound container of cat food. He saw it leaving and went outside and yelled at it, chasing it up a tree. He continued to yell but the bear came down the tree and came uphill towards him to retrieve the cat food. He fired a 12 ga slug into the ground near the bear and the bear finally walked off down the hill. Bear had also got into an open window on his truck to get a partial bag of sunflower seeds RP was eating, apparently before it got into the garage.

Advised to keep all vehicles clean of smells and foodstuffs and to lock. Told him to secure garage door and he found a large C-Clamp that he was going to use to secure the door from the inside. Told him about freezing meat scraps and to bleach the garbage can after emptying and after putting trash in. Told him to make up some rattle cans and to haze bear when it came back. Issued rubber buck and a rubber slug and said to shoot bear if it came in range on his property and to call if he needed more rounds.

Advised him to let me know if bear tries to get into garage again and I could set electric mat in front of door.

RP was very cooperative and said he would do everything he could to prevent further interaction. He did not want bear destroyed

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting

Comments: Bear getting into trash
A sow with two cubs was eating on a roadkill deer off HWY 67 in town and was causing a traffic hazard. WPPD hazed the bears and moved the deer into the woods.

Bear got into trash in a non-bear proof can early in the morning.  Cabin occupants left early in the A.M. and the managers of Alpine Village didn't know that the trash was in the small can outside the cabin.  According to the manager's (the R.P.) they always secure the trash in the evening in a "bear proof" dumpster.  They also educate all customers about bears, e.g. Locking cars, rolling windows up, keeping all food items stored in safe places.
Bear activity is only anticipated to increase due to a late snow and massive food failure in the Gunnison/Lake City area.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: Bear just hanging out in a tree next to the two neighborhoods who continue to leave trash out unsecured.

Received a call from CSP that a bear was near a pasture with horses and that the owner was concerned about the bear being too close to his livestock. CSP said that Josh Keating would like a call. WO 321 called Josh and discussed the available options and how to minimize the human/bear conflict in the future. Keating was thankful at the end and understood that he lived in bear habitat and that by keeping clean places would help minimize those conflicts. Keating did state that his and his neighbors trash have been getting into. He was told to keep it locked up in the future.
325 visited residence, RP had good livestock security with electric fencing for horses, goats and chickens.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Euthanized
Comments: WL 367 called out to RP address for report of an aggressive bear. Called RP on phone. RP stated the bear was acting aggressive toward black lab on high rise porch. Rp stated the bear had two yellow ear tags with the numbers 1257 on them.  Bear was attracted to bird feeders. There were eight feeders around the porch. RP stated the bear was swiping at the dog. When  WL 367 arrived, the bear was laying in a tree about 30 yards from the porch.  Upon communicating with AWM, the decision was made to euthanize the previously tagged bear. WL 367 talked thoroughly with RP on how this type of incident plays out and ends the life of bears. RP was told to take down feeders and only have them out in the day.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Type of Property Damage: Trash , Vehicles , Outside Food Source , Other
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Hazed , Euthanized
Comments: Resident bear that has been increasingly hazed, but has grown habituated to humans, this particular bear has been reported as breaking into vehicles, garages, damaging a motorcycle, bluff charging a number of individuals, and apparently crawled through a mud-room window to access dog food a year ago. It is a large brown boar. Multiple calls with the RP to ensure compliance with trash ordinances, several site visits over a two year period and hazing attempts. Trap was set 8/8. Bear caught 8/10 and euthanized. Seal # 39181

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: Yearling bear is in RP’s tree about 50 feet up.   Was concerned about his kids being out in yard.  Met with RP and discussed bear habits and how to minimize conflicts. Explained to the RP the importance of telling his sons not to run if they see the bear etc. There are chickens in his yard and I recommended electric fence around the chicken coop.  Gave the RP a “Living With Bears” pamphlet for additional information on how to minimize conflicts with bears.  Gave RP my card and asked him to call me if he has any further conflicts.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
RP contacted OGT repeatedly about suspects (“Carl and JJ”) feeding deer, them recently reported them also feeding fox and bear. RP provides video of suspects feeding deer on back of house. RP provided poor quality video of a bear behind suspect house, and advised bear was eating food that had been left for deer. RP reported numerous bear sighting on property. Officer searched assessor records and court records to identify suspects at address as Carl Short and Jeanette Wickstrom. 

On 8/30/2020, Officer Nicholson drove to suspect address. Officer Nicholson observed numerous buck deer that were highly habituated and approached him from the backyard (unfenced) area of home. Nicholson attempted contact at front door, got no answer, but observed television on inside and heard voices. Officer Nicholson walked to backdoor, where he observed another television on. Officer Nicholson knocked on that door and received no answer, however, he observed several bags of corn and other feed sitting by back door. 

Officer Nicholson observed corn and sunflower seeds scattered on ground in area deer congregated near back door. Officer Nicholson left a written notice and his business card taped to front door advising he issued a state order to immediately stop feeding and placing bear attractants. See attached photos.  Entered by Nicholson on 8/30/2020.

RP is caretaker of Four Mile Ranch. Stated that ranch owner, Joyce Farrow, informed him that a young bear with two blue eartags (unknown number) followed her dog into her open attached garage door on the evening of 8/11 and again on the morning of 8/12. 325 responded, noted that the old outside-only dog has access to outdoor dog food bowl and open dog door into unattached storage  garage with dog food inside. Appears bear did not access either yet. May be the same bear that was recently trapped/ relocated and involved in an additional incident. Advised to secure dog door and only feed indoors and to keep attached garage doors closed. Elderly owner not interested in rubber rounds, pepper spray, etc. As of 8/16, dog food/door secured and bear had not been seen again.

No further response required. RP has chickens on the property and has had issues with bears in 2019. The chickens are appropriately cared for and kept enclosed. The photograph provided the pics of small bear but may be similar to or the same one from 2019. PRP was provided rubber buckshot and will be purchasing his own in the future. The RP was also provided information about bears and deterrence.
WL548

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: A bear has been in the general area and has been focused on entering  unoccupied vehicles.  RP residence is in area of these occurrences and can observe the trap.

Yearling bear got into RP trash container.  We talked about securing the trash.  He was way ahead of me and has developed a way to bolt his can lid shut.  Offered additional bear aware recommendations and gave him a business card.  Asked him to call me directly if he had anymore visits from the bear.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
Injured bear roaming RP's property. RP stated the bear was limping towards the bike path.
463 did site visit bear was gone RP had video of bear, yearling, brown, limping on rear right leg
Bear paw prints on the doors and windows of the PR's house. Bear went through an open window of the RP's shed.  No foods source in the shed.  Officer issued five rounds of bean bags to the RP

RP left msg at 7:26 am @ CPW office.  Bear in dumpster @ 3:30 am RP called the city.  City PD shot the bear with a bean bag in the tree.  RP called again to report the bear is still in the tree at 8:35 am.  Continue to receive calls that a person is shooting the bear with a hose each time, at least two times, it comes out of the tree.  Reports of someone shooting it with a sling shot with rocks each time it moves @ 10:19 am.  CSP is receiving calls, requesting a wildlife officer.  City PD has an officer monitoring the human activities and continued harassment of the bear.

128 responded to dark brown yearling bear treed ar address. Bear had been around for about 5 days and had initially damaged bird feeders, rp then moved feeders inside. 128 hazed with 2 rubber buckshot, provided advice to rp and neighbors.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: DWM Brown was contacted by the RP who stated that her neighbor has been feeding the stray cats with both dry and wet cat food which has caused numerous visits from different black bears. The RP is concerned for her safety,  the safety of her neighbors, and others on the same street. DWM Brown visited the property and found six different dry catfood dishes and lots of empty wet catfood cans. DWM Brown explained the situation to the violator and provided them with a verbal warning. DWM Brown also told them they had 24 hours to pickup everything which is causing an attractant and food source. The homeowners agreed to pick up everything.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
Bear was trying to get into RP's chicken enclosure.  Before bear was able to kill any chickens, RP shot and killed bear with a shotgun and called CPW to report.
 RP lives within town limits of Eagle.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics , Euthanized
Comments: R/P contacted WL Officer Brown regarding a bear that knocked over his barbecue grill and attempted to break in the house through a semi-open window. The bear caused significant damage to the window and siding of the residence. The R/P entered the sunroom and discovered the bear halfway though the window causing the animal to back out and leave completely. WL Officer Brown sat a bear trap on 07/11/20. The bear returned on 07/16/20 and attempted to break in the RP's garage. WL Officer Brown moved the trap near the garage and successfully captured the bear on 07/17/20. 3.25 CC's of Nalmed was used to tranquilize the bear followed by euthanasia via a firearm. Seal no. 37939 and seizure tag no. 85185 was placed on the bear for auction at the annual fur sale.

RP was in the house upstairs when a bear with green ear tags( 902)  broke the screen off the back door and came in through the door. It started eating cat food.  RP left the house.  When WL 287 arrived on scene the bear was still in the house. Two CSPD officers arrived shortly after.  The bear was rolling around on the couch , and walking throughout the kitchen. WL 281 and 288 arrived on scene. The bear exited the home, where WL 281 was able to euthanize it.
Tesha saw brown cub in her yard, last seen moving west. Her neighbor reported that it had been seen eating his grapes along his fence. Looked for cub but UTL.

Bear was reported in Calhan, Colorado. Bear was located at the address above. Bear was darted With 1.5 cc’s by WL283 at 9:13 pm and was asleep at 9:15. Another .5 cc’s were added at 9:46. Reversal was given at 10:15 pm. 


The bear was taken to the office at 4255 Sinton road to spend the night. It will be relocated on 06/20/2020.

WL288: Bear was taken down to Pueblo and put under their pole barn for WL225

WL225: Bear was released at approximately 2100 hrs on the Huerfano State Wildlife Area.  No issues on release.

WL124: Bear entered through lower story open window and damaged two screens. RP heard a noise and went downstairs and saw the window open. When he went to go close it he saw a large bear, black with tan snout, in the attached bathroom and called the police. Bear was gone upon arrival. A bear was matching the same description just down the hill and a Larimer Co. Deputy hazed the bear with rubber buckshot.

Grand Z Casino surveillance advised a large bear entered their valet doors into shipping and receiving area of casino. This area is a network of garages with open access. Bear wandered around for a half hour, found and ate human food including chocolate.  Video of bear showed that he fled whenever he heard human voices. 

Bear left without incident, but Casino personnel were concerned about bear returning. Nicholson met with staff and inspected area. Nicholson offered to set a pepper barrel and recommended the casino have a paintball gun to haze bear if he returned. Casino will consult with management and call if they want a pepper barrel. No further response required at this time. Entered by Nicholson on 7/10/2020.
RP is watching house for neighbor while they are out of town. Bear was evidently go after grill in backyard. Bear broke several pickets on privacy fence going into and out of backyard.
0300 bear in area entered the chicken coop and destroyed  chicken house.  Total Chicken lost 3 out of 9.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear broke into cabin two weeks ago by tearing out a window (not reported). Came back this morning and tore plywood off the same window. Rp was in the house and yelled/clapped and scared the bear away. Trap set

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
Volunteers made first contact on 7/15 and he and I made a site visit on 7/17. She reported that a large  dark colored bear had started getting into their trash. They have lived there 6 years and never had a problem. They have no room in their shed to store the trash cans.  They are within sight of Hwy 1. They now have a secured dumpster and have taken in all feeders. Their problem appears to be solved but numerous neighbors either leave cans out or put them out the night before Friday pick-up. We did general education with her and two young children.

She was very knowledgeable and does not want bear trapped.  Advised her to contact us if they have further problems.

I will return next Thursday and talk to anyone in neighborhood with cans out.

RP saw small bear that looks scrawny and and drink acting.  RP is concerned that it might not be in good health. W328 called and left a message for RP.
7/3 bear came back, scaled a tree and knocked a bird feeder down. Doug chased bear off. W328 provided RP with rubber sluggs and bear spray.
Very large bear on trash dumpster.

Dilley did a site visit and spoke with restaurant manager Jenny.  Location is clubhouse and Peridic Table Restaurant at golf course. She told Dilley the bear had not shown aggression but did not seem to mind being around people. Dilley looked at dumpster and it is bear proof. Jenny said bear has been on top of dumpster but never gott anything from dumpster. With customers around, Diller recommended ramping up hazing with air horn.   He told her if that did not work, they could co sider rubber buck or double ball. He explained they needed  to decide if that was aloud within their policy and have someone comfortable utilizing that method and well versed in safe handling of firearms. Jenny said if they continued to have problems she would call CPW. Dilley did not see any other attractants on property.

WL521 set a pepper barrel. Provided written warning for unsecured trash. Advised that the trash needs to be in a building where the bear cannot access or they need to get heatproof trash cans AND recycling cans.

521 advised 527 that he could remove pepper barrel. 527 removed barrel on 7/23 and took it to mt Evans SWA. WALTER

WL283 responded to a call about a bear that entered a vehicle overnight. The bear was able to open an unlocked door. The bear was able to get a package of peanuts and the remnants of a protein shake. The bear then exited the vehicle. While talking to the RP’s, the neighbor came over talking about the bear tried to get into his shed where he keeps his trash. RP the. Explained that there were multiple people in the area that had reported on Nextdoor that a bear had broken into many vehicles in the same night. Most were unlocked but one vehicle’s passenger window was broken out for access. WL283 will add that into the app sheet if that RP returns a voicemail.

The target bear is a medium sized black or very dark brown bear.

WL 290 relocated a small sub adult brown colored bear on 8/3. Talking with a neighbor, he was confident the it was not the target bear and stated he had seen this bear 3 times this year.  While pulling the trap WL290 noticed the RP trash and recycling cans were unsecured and not bear resistant sitting near the curb, with no shed, garage or other structure to hold them.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
YES call RP as he would like us to set a trap for tonight on his property, he would like it caught and taken away as he is very persistent and hazing isn't working.  Called WLO 523 and left vm and texted as well.  WLO523 asked that I pass to on call which I did with vm and text 10:32a.  WLO525 will let WLO523 to do tonight.

RP stated that he has been dealing with this black sub-adult bear for several weeks and has left messages for WLO 523 (1 requesting rubber buck) and today left messages for WLO 523 and 520 to call him.  The bear killed 5 chickens late last night (not commercial operation) and broke thru the bear boards on the top of the pen.  Hutch is still intact.  He fired warning shots and the pen is not electrified.  I suggested he consider electrifying and checking for rubber buck at a farm and ranch store.  He said he didn't need a bear packet.

I did ask him what he intends to do when the bear returns this evening if we aren't able to set a trap and he said he has a 700 mag.  Also stated he is a retired sheriff deputy and knows both Mark and Dawson.  T.Wallace NERO

WLO523 responded to the property on the evening of 07/09/2020 after finishing up his mandatory training that day.  WLO523 set a trap and planned to remove the bear and do a hard release with the aid of a K9 in Area1.
The trap remained until the late afternoon on the 13th of July.  A bear that meet the discretion had been caught in a cage trap after entering an occupied house just a short distance from the RP's address.  It is likely that these are both the same bears and thus the trap was removed from 670 Lair Lane.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: Call came into Glenwood office as a bear attack. RP was transported to hospital. See 463’s ROI for more details. Unable to determine if bear actually made contact with RP or not. RP was released from hospital without any injuries.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Pyrotechnics , Euthanized
Comments:
Two yearling size bears entered electrfied bee yard multiple times.  Officer Blanck set a peper sprayer at the address and it appeared to have been successful.
7-10-2020 Chrisman euthanized one bear as it returned to the hives
Five attempted bear break ins in the last two months despite having unwelcome mats on and below all windows and no attractants.
Brown sow with one black and one chocolate cub sleeping in tree. Bear sitters deployed until bears became mobile around 6 pm.

RP stated two bears got into trash at residence. The bears attempted to get into chicken coop/run.  RP said he had a way to secure trash but was concerned about the chickens.   Dilley did site visit and explained to RP how to set up electric fence around coop. provided electric tape and the-most insulators. RP will get posts and charger and set up. Dilley recommended putting trash inside enclosed barn.

RP is the ecologist for Dinosaur National Park. She reported that their archeology crew had their truck damaged by a bear and asked for an officer to confirm it was a bear. Per NPS policy no trap was allowed to be set in the park boundaries, the rp stated the area would be closed as a precaution.
RP found tracks and scat in corn field.  On July 26, I attempted to locate bear with APHIS.  Found old tracks but dogs did not alert

Bear was on front porch, rattling screen door.  Dog scared off. Site inspection revealed numerous wild berries on hillside above house.   Landowner was unaware and has moved things to alleviate further issues and will call with updates.

RP called report that two bears (both black and similar in size) have been getting into their shed and their deep freeze the past week.
The deep freeze is now empty and cleaned out.
WL523 Responded and set a pepper barrel near the shed and also placed a camera to get a photo if the bears return.
The camera and the pepper barrel were removed on June 22 by WLO523.  The RP had not reported seeing the bears return since the barrel was set.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Watershed manager Eric called to report multiple breakins by a bear over the past week. Bear broke in through a window and got a can of soda out of the fridge. Windows were boarded up, nail boards placed, and bear repeatedly broke in through unboarded windows, no additional food reward. Trap set 8/31, moved to CU mountain campus on 9/4.

No further response as of now.

WL541 received a report from the RP that a large dark brown colored bear with a green ear tag in the left ear was in Tucker Gulch around 7:00pm.  It matched the description of the bear that had been hanging around Tucker Gulch and hitting trash cans within the neighborhood since last week.   
WL545, WL546 and WL541 responded to try to haze the bear.   The bear was followed around Golden and hazed with noise and lights until it crossed over Highway 58 and was lost in the vegetation surrounding Clear Creek.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
Contacted the RP.  The RP told me she left her car window unrolled and  told me a bear entered the car and tore up her front seats.  She said there wasn't any food in the vehicle.  She did say that she took some trash to town and some of it spilled on her seats. 
 
Went to the RP's residence and went over bear aware practices.  The RP had lots of humming bird feeders, bird seed feeders, empty bird seed bags and bird baths around her residence.  She also had a deer skull and vertebrae which she found while hiking in her backyard.  

Told the RP she needed to remove all the bird feeders and bird baths.  Also told her she needed to keep her car windows rolled up and vehicle doors locked.  Also told her to close and lock her doors when she leaves her house.  Also told her to not leave windows open and that she needed to close her doors when she leaves her residence.  I also told her she needed to close a ground level window she leaves open for ventilation (she lives in an earth ship style house).  I took the deer skeleton to aid in not attracting the bear to her residence.

She did not know the time the bear entered her car.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials , Euthanized
Comments:
Bear entered home and swapped RP, hounds were used to capture and euthanized. 
Case # 163-001-20

Resident at 1503 Hwy 34 flagged down larimer ranger Fleming about a bear in yard. 2-3 year old bear was in tree right off highway, resident had walked around his truck, saw bear and yelled at it, bear ran up tree. Resident at 1501 had 2 goats killed, suspected it was same bear. 128 did site inspection, unable to determine if bear had in fact killed goats (both had been killed about a week prior). Advised both residents to leave bear where it was, remove attractants and keep windows closed at night. No further action needed.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear did not enter the unoccupied cabin, but broke one layer of the double pane windows.  The RP cooked fish in the cabin the night of the break-in and thought that smell was the attractant.  Trap set but no bear caught and it was pulled on 6/8.  Homeowners boarded the window.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Relocated
Comments:
sow & cub have been getting into the fridge outside of the residence for a week now.  I asked if the fridge was secure, RP said no.  Please text RP, he does not get calls but does get texts.  He will call you back when he walks to the top of the hill for cell reception.
7/28 Ortega spoke to RP on phone said sow with cub has been getting into fridge on porch for over a week.  Told RP to lock fridge closed with chains and secure fridge to porch with chains.

7/31 bear trapped and relocated.
Bear was on RP back porch.  WL 265 responded and did site inspection.  Bear did not get any food and took off when the RP yelled at it.  Gave him 3 rds of Rubber Buckshot incase the bear came back.

RP called and advised that sow with two cubs had ransacked his neighbor’s camp and that one of the cubs had an arrow sticking out of it. DWM Gallegos and WT Mason responded but bears were gone. Food and trash were being stored in violation of RGNF bear order, so FS was advised and responded. FS cited one individual in the camp for the violation. A total of 5 individuals were in the two camps and all denied shooting the cub. The cub could not be located and officers will continue to search.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Pyrotechnics
Comments: RP reported a bear on their deck eating two jars of peanut butter that husband had left out on the deck after baiting mouse traps.  They are an elderly couple in their 80's.  The bear had got some bird seed and a hummingbird feeder the week before.  Krall told the Hanks to be sure not to leave any attractants outside.  The bear returned as Krall was a short distance away from the residence.  Krall returned and was able to hit the bear three times with bean bag rounds as it ran away.  Krall set a spray barrel and an electric fence at the residence.  As of 06/30 the bear has not returned.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments: on 8-23 Tammi Let me know that a sow and 2 cubs had been seen in the area and that she had multiple piles of bear scat in her back yard by her apple pile.  Upon a later visit I informed her that it would be good to remove the pile of apples as it is an attractant for the bears.  On 8-25 PM, I was able to locate the sow and 2 cubs in town.  Over the course of 3 hours I followed the sow around and hazed it 4 times using rubber buck shot and bean bag rounds, until she left with her cubs.  On 9-02  Tammi informed me that her neighbors trash was knocked down, indicating the bear might be revisiting the town once again.

Fernandez was fishing at the west end of Trinidad Lake where the Purgatoire River enters. Fernandez said a large black bear chased him to his vehicle and he was barely able to get to the vehicle. Fernandez was very emotional and called 911 who patched the call to DWM HOLDER #754. Park Ranger Wilson responded to the site as did DWM HOLDER in Riley Canyon at Trinidad Lake State Park. The incident occurred add a large mud flat where tracks were clearly visible and scenario could be developed. The bear entered the mud flat from the East going west but did not at any point turn towards, follow or chase Fernandez. Bear did stand on his hind legs to see over brush (NOT an aggressive behavior). DWM HOLDER followed Fernandez to his home and spoke with the father... Both were satisfied with response. No trap was set as this was an incidental contact not an aggressive behavior

37.13345, -104.59833
Bear supposedly stuck in culvert.  Bear ran off when officer arrived.  Spotted several more times but could not tranquilize.   80 lbs, chocolate brown.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
No further response needed. Officer Mckee had left a card at this address on September 9.  The card instructed the individuals to remove All birdfeeders.  
On September 14 Officer Mckee received a voicemail from Eric, the homeowner. He stated he had received the door hanger  and had removed all birdfeeders. He also stated he had seen a bear at the neighbors house the night before.  
Early morning on September 15 Officer McKee received a call from Eric and his wife, through CSP.  Eric stated that the bear was on their second story deck and told CSP he would shoot it.  Officer Mckee called and spoke with Eric and his wife. Eric stated he had put the feeders back out but had removed them at 7 o’clock that evening.  Officer Mckee advised him that residual seed and scent would  still bring bears in and that’s why he was instructed to remove feeders for the season.  He was instructed on how to haze the bear away and Officer McKee remained on the line until the bear was gone.
Officer McKee visited later that day and issued them a written warning for failure to remove attractants.  They stated the encounter on their porch was terrifying and understood the gravity of attractants and said they would not place feeders out again between May and November.
They were provided additional bear literature.
JM

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Relocated
Comments: RP call to report a bear that was hissing and snorting at her when she would go out her back door. There has been a brown colored bear in the area and this behavior has been going on for about a week., she not sure it's the same bear or not and has never experienced this behavior before. She is a little nervous. DWM’s Smith and Taylor tried to dart the bear, but it was in thick brush and did not present a shot. DWM McClung lived nearby, and a trap was set at his residence. Bear was caught on 7/11 and relocated. McClung scanned bear for pit tag, found none. Bear was an old research bear with a black ear tag in right ear, flap with number was gone. No pit tag was inserted since it was presumed there was still a pit tag from research crew.

Bear was under ramp that leads into house. RP was scared to go up ramp into house. I arrived, made noise, used Taser to make noise and bear runs off a short was. See bear next door and chase it away with less lethal rounds.

Bear had frequently been in town of Granby primarily getting into trash and sleeping in trees during the day in town.  Granby PD had hazed the bear multiple times.  The bear is younger and took up residence compared to other bears in the town that would only be around only at night and responded more positively to hazing.  On 9/2/20 the bear was seen several times around school bus routs and with school starting, became a risk to students waiting for bus and walking to and from school.
WL480 felt given the frequency of sightings  through out the day  and with the bear hanging out near bus stops.  Bear tranquilized by WL480 and 484.  Bear ear tagged with red 903 in both ears.  Pit Tag #985170000947284.

RP stated that his hot tub cover is ripped up.  This is not the first one that has been destroyed .  Dilley contacted RP, did site visit, issued 3 rounds double ball and one round rubber buck. RP signed pyrotechnics form and Dilley advised on safe use of rounds issued.

Service Provided: Site Inspection , Trap Set , Relocated , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
During response to an incident at neighboring San Juan Motel, manager stated that several bears were getting into a dumpster used by Blondie's produce stand, thus causing issues for him. 325 spoke with Blondie  (LouAnne), who stated that at least 4 bears have been getting into the new dumpster that she and a couple other food trucks use. One bear also gained access to the inside of her produce tent and got a watermelon. RP electrified cattle panels surrounding the tent on 8/19 and watched a brown yearling bear get shocked and run. A large black bear with small blonde back stripe is persistent and unphased by hazing. Also a black cub and sow. New dumpster is bear resistant but chains not installed. 325 called Elite Trash Service, who stated they would install chains on 8/21. Blondie was issued bear spray and trap set on 8/20.
Sub-adult black colored bear trapped on 8/21. Large black bear with blonde back stripe also hazed away from property with airhorn by RP.

Bear seen in area, Would like to talk with an officer about getting rubber buckshot. W328 visited with RP's  and advised them on how to deal with the bears and what types of besr activities would be good to advise CPW about.

Service Provided: Site Inspection , Trap Set , Relocated , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
Bear came back and broke into a camper trailer and got a bottle of ketchup.  At 1200 RP were eating lunch in their house  and the bear came back to the camp trailer. Brian shot in the air and the bear ran away.  
The bear was all black with brown nose.
A trap was set.
Target bear was trapped on 7/3/2020.
The bear was move to Bull Mountain in  WL 187 district.  Location: 13T 423345/4532303
Ear tag #: Green 343

Sow with 3 cubs was reported in the dumpster at Ramon’s Mexican restaurant. DWM Gallegos responded because there usually was a crowd of people gathered anytime a bear shows up there during daylight hours. DWM Gallegos was able to haze the sow with a bean bag round. Ramon’s had chained the lids on their dumpster, but only locked it at night. They were informed that they need to lock it all the time, especially considering the conditions. No citation was written because they had made a remedial attempt to secure the trash.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: No follow up necessary. RP called about bear coming onto property nightly. Ruined his water feature. Has seen the same bear last three year. Has been up on his deck and is getting more curious. 463 did site visit and gave RP a pepper sprayer. RP was supposed to send pictures of bear if it came back.

I, DWM Clayton BonDurant, received a phone call from Shawn Scanga about a sow and 2 cubs that had been frequenting their property.  I stopped by his house and talked with his wife in more detail about the sightings.  The sow had been around for over a week, most likely living in an abandoned orchard to the North of their property.
