Comments: RP called at 0100 and said a sow had gotten through skirting of camper trailer she was living in and could hear the bear underneath the camper.  She said the bear was up on her deck and had leaned on the door.  RP said a the sow and cub had been around for about a week and had gotten into their dumpster.  She said her kids were bad about securing the bear bar.   She said the sow had never been aggressive and had always run away when yelled at.  Krall set a trap and caught the sow.  Krall darted the cub outside the trap.  Both were relocated by WL 226.  Cub was given a PIT tag #985170000953130.

WL288:

Report came in that there were 2 sows and 2 cubs getting into the trash at the complex. They stated that the bears were currently there. Me and WL282 responded to try and haze the bears. The bears were gone by the time we got there. I explained to them that they needed to get a bear-proof container. Zach told me that they were planning on getting one before winter. I told him that they needed to get one sooner than that. I explained the city ordinance and said that they needed to get the dumpsters that have the metal lids and locking bar across it. I told him that we do not trap bears for getting into trash and that they needed to mitigate the problem by being responsible with their trash. Zach said that he would relay the information to the property managers.

RP said they left for church the other morning around 8am and when they returned around 2pm they noticed that their cabin had been broken into by a bear. It had torn the screen off of windows and broke the door to get into the cabin. The RP said this bear wanders around their neighborhood all the time and she said it has black coloration and is probably 2-3yrs old. This incident at her cabin is the third time the bear has broke into a home in the past 2 weeks in that neighborhood. She said there was no food in the cabin only clothes and dishes from the previous tenant who is in the process of moving out. The bear did get into some cleaning supplies under the sink. If you cannot reach her at the number listed above her office number is 970-667-3698.

WL124 provides advice and site inspection on 6/1. WL124 provided the homeowner with less-lethal rounds for hazing and the homeowners declined a trap.

WL 265 responded to the call at 21:00 to try and locate the bear and bean bag it.  RP stated that he and his two sons were sleeping in a tent in the front yard when he heard what he thought was a gun shot.  He got his flashlight and shined it in the direction of the noise.  He and his fiancee saw a large bear walking up the hill away from the dumpster.  The bear never approached the tent or acted aggressively.  Recommended putting a ratchet strap on the dumpster.  They have a goat pen and will start putting the goats in at night.  I recommended electric fence around the chicken coop.  Gave 3 rounds of rubber buck and did a liability release form with the fiancee.  Asked them to call if they have any further conflicts.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
Officer Responded. Brad is the landowner at Lonely Canyon Ranch. This morning he woke up and found his chicken coop was torn apart and all 7 of his chickens were gone. Brad drove his ATV to another location on his property where there is a car port. Brad walked up to the carport and a medium sided (200 pound) cinnamon bear ran out from the inside carport. Bears have been getting into trash and trucks on the property for the last few weeks. Officer Doyle did a site inspection and found that no efforts were done to prevent bears from accessing chickens or any potential food source on the property. Brad wanted Officer Doyle to trap and relocate the bear. Officer Doyle told Brad he had a responsibility to clean and bear-proof his property before we attempt to trap it. Brad said he has seen 4 bears on his property so Officer Doyle decided that trapping 1 bear would not solve his issue unless he took steps to bear-proof. Officer Doyle will visit the property again to insure preventative measures are being done, and will provide Brad with some rubber-buck shot for hazing.
6/5/2020 Officer Doyle visited the residence again and saw very few improvements to preventing bears. Brad was given educational documents on living with bears and how to prevent bears from getting into trash and other property. Officer Doyle gave Brad 3 rubber buck shot to haze the bear if he saw it near his home again.

Bears have been getting through electric fence destroying bee hives over past month.  Very dark hair left on fence after Bear was in on 7/7/20.  Ortega went to apiary night of 7/7 and shot dark bear trying to get through electric fence.

On 7/12 and 7/13 another brownish red bear got through electric fence and destroyed bee boxes.

Night of 7/14 DWM Ortega arrived at the apiary and witnessed a large bear tipping bee boxes inside the electric fence.  Ortega shot and killed the bear.  The electric fence was on and putting out 6k amps.  Fence did not slow down bear.

WL124: Estes PD received a report of unsecured trash at the Rocky Mountain Hotel.  I observed two unsecured dumpsters with trash in it, as well as exposed trash bags on the ground.   No evidence of bears getting into them.  I advised the manager that bears frequent the area and it is their responsibility to mitigate and prevent conflicts with bears.

Doug called to report two yearlings and a sow were on his patio at 10:45 am. His dog alerted to the bears and the yearlings went up trees and the sow pushed on kitchen windows which are at grade. Eventually the sow moved on. No damage to the house. Loaned homeowner two unwelcome mats and advised on ways to gaze the bears if they come back. Doug does not have a 12 ga shotgun so no less lethal rounds issued. 326 picked up unwelcome mats on 8/14/20. Doug reporter no new bear issues.

Bear tried to get in to a pig pen with sows and piglets. It was spotted by passerby who ran it off and notified DWM Smith. DWM Smith responded, located property owners, and informed them of bear activity. Also issued rubber buck. Mike said they would put up electric fence the next day. Bear came back twice that night. No electric fence was put up, and Bear came back repeatedly during following day and night. Bear was hazed with rubber buck, but returned within 15 minutes. Mike shot the bear just after midnight on 5/15. Bear Smart will help with electric fencing to help with further incidents.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
WL124: RP saw the dome light on and went to go check it out.  The sow exited the vehicle, “growled” at him and began charging.  The RP stated he started to run back to the house and realized the bear was too fast and would not make it so he turned around, raised his hands and yelled.  Bear stopped and growled.  The RP then slowly moved back to the house to grab an airhorn. The sow returned to the vehicle. The RP went back to the porch and the bear came out of the vehicle again and came towards him. RP hit the airhorn and car alarm and the bears ran off.  Vehicle was left unlocked and bears received a food reward of granola bars and pistachios. Provided advice.  

Trap set on 8/22/20.

No further response as of now.

WL541 received a report from the RP that a large dark brown colored bear with a green ear tag in the left ear was in Tucker Gulch around 7:00pm.  It matched the description of the bear that had been hanging around Tucker Gulch and hitting trash cans within the neighborhood since last week.   
WL545, WL546 and WL541 responded to try to haze the bear.   The bear was followed around Golden and hazed with noise and lights until it crossed over Highway 58 and was lost in the vegetation surrounding Clear Creek.

RP states bears are coming up from the river. RP has witnessed them in her orchard. Bear has damaged some of her fruit trees. RP has seen bear on her property almost daily for 10-14 days. RP has concerns about additional property damage and worker safety.  Address given is for fruit shed. Home address is 3602 F Rd, Palisade CO 81526

445 visited site on 7-21 and saw the down trees. Scat was found in the same rows as trees. Damage is being caused by a bear. There were two trees damaged prior to 7-20 and five new trees damaged on the night of 7-20.

445 was contacted by Donovan Talbott on 7-23 saying two more trees were damaged and he found a bear track in the orchard.

445 went to the orchard on 7-24 and found additional bear tracks. One may be a cub track. 445 told Donovan to keep in contact and keep him informed of any additional sightings or damage. No new trees were damaged. 445 offered to drop damage paperwork off to start a claim. 

445 went to the orchard on 7-25 and found no new sign from the bears or new damage.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Sow with two cubs. Got into trash last night and have been sighted numerous times in this area and property.

Bear had been getting into trash in the area. Bear then went under RP’s trailer at 3am 07/08 and damaged trailer crawl space skirting. WL329 and WL330 responded and removed Bear 7/8 approximately 4:00pm. Bear tranquilized and then euthanized.

3rd in a row bear has been getting into their chicken coop.  RP had 4 chickens and all are gone. Bear got into the shed that the chickens were housed in.  I mentioned adding hot wire to the coop to prevent further damage. She was unsure how to set that up.

RP was given advice on how to fortify her chicken coop. RP did not want to file for compensation from game damage.
Bear got into car via passenger side front door. Got itself locked int

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Rehabilitation
Comments: Saguache SO called myself, DWM Clayton BonDurant, about multiple phone calls they have received about a bear cub running through the town of Moffat.  The last location was Don Burton's house south of the firehouse.  I went to the property and during the walk around located the bear.  I was unable to capture the bear at the time and shortly thereafter returned with the trap.  The bear was captured and transported to Frisco Creek.

Ranch hand found dead bear on property. 326-responded 8/14/20. Bear found bloated and on back near driveway for 1201 Celadon Drive E. Appeared to have internal trauma or pooling of blood on lower right flank. Large boar with pit tag and torn right ear suggesting it had a research tag from Durango bear study.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments: WL124: Estes PD notified me of a bear up in a tree and a crowd approaching the bear. When I arrived on scene I dispersed the crowd and the bear ran west up Davis St. It was still daylight and ran within 30 yards of a populated outdoor seating area of a bar called The Barrel where patrons observed the bear running. I saw the bear minutes later in the neighborhood and hazed it away from downtown Estes with noise (clapping/yelling/running). Bear was the same seen near downtown within the past week.  No aggressive behavior observed but showed extreme comfort around large groups of people.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: RP has had bears come through backyard (which backs up to forest) many times in last couple weeks. Has been hazing with paintballs. Has seen at least one adult and possibly two yearlings in backyard. One yearling black, and the other brown. RP does have bird feeders up which he admitted have been broken into by bears. On 6/27 while rp home, bear came into house through ground level window into kitchen. Ate some snack type food and then left when rp came upstairs. Window was cracked open when bear entered. WO 488 set trap and had out for three days. A bear returned to area but nothing other than racoon in trap. Lots of other bear issues in nearby neighborhoods at this time.
RP called to report a small black colored bear cub eating chokecherries across the road from her house on the edge of the ditch.  Subsequent report of the same on 9/6.

SC - CSP spoke with RP two reports/sightings of a bear. One was in the dumpster at Sundowner Condos the other was walking across the street near bus stop about 50 yrds on left side. Officer Kay spoke w RP (Max) who said bear was in dumpster when went to take trash out. Dumpster has external enclosure, but not bearproof and no actual locks on dumpster. Advised RP to call back in if sees more activity and Officer Kay called Blue River Property Management. Spoke with Caitlyn, who said she would contact on-property manager and remedy unsecured trash situation.
RP stated bear in dumpster. Ongoing issue and would like to be contacted by CPW. -SC HSS

Staff Assigned: ian.petkash@state.co.us, tim.woodward@state.co.us, mark.lamb@state.co.us, jason.clay@state.co.us, jenny.campbell@state.co.us, michael.gallegos@state.co.us

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
On 08/24/2020 Wildlife 261 received a message from the area office that there was a bear incident at Mesa Antero housing development. WL 261 contacted that RP and the RP stated that a bear had broken in to an unoccupied camping trailer right outside her house. WL 261 responded to the location to perform a site inspection. WL 261 learned from the RP that the bear had ripped off three window screens, and cracked a window, before entering the trailer through a window that had been left open by the RP. The RP stated that once inside the bear broke a curtain cover and broke one of the draws that it had opened. The bear did get into several different types of food once in the trailer, see pictures below. WL 261 educated the RP on the importance of locking up the camper when not in use, so the scent of food does not draw bears in. He also gave the RP several different bear educational fliers and requested that if another bear incident occurs to notify CPW immediately, since on this occasion the call did not come into CPW for 2 days. WL 261 chose not to set a trap for this incident because he did not want to capture the wrong bear, and since the information was not received by WL 261 the day it happened he felt he would not be able to do this. WL 261 called and verified this with WL 260. WL 261 also got the HOA presidents information from the RP in hopes to have them send out a mass email to the entire Mesa Antero housing development that bears are active in the area and educate them on living in bear country.

On 08/25/2020 WL 261 got in contact with the HOA president and she agreed to forward an email sent to her by WL 261 with educational messaging and various bear educational fliers.
Bear was inside substation fencing and got itself out.

Bear was described as a blonde/brown yearling. The bear was spotted on the railroad tracks and hill behind the Hotchkiss Marshal office. RP watched the bear run up and back down the hill then disappeared in the cottonwood drainage to the East.  DWM Purcell was not able to locate the bear.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear tried to open garage door to get to trash. Bear was unsuccessful but went to side of garage and pulled off side panels to try and enter from the side.
Bear climbed airport fence and gained access to trash. Bear was treed and darted

rp called state patrol in early morning of 15th to report bear had been in pig pen and killed a pig. BCSO responded and hazed with rubber buckshot. 128 visited site and provided advice about securing pig pen with enclosure and electric fencing. Rp said bear seemed to be acting in self defense when attacked by pigs. 128 provided rubber buckshot. No further action needed.

RP is owner of Bla Bla Bla Cafe. Bear has been tipping over a bear proof dumpster. WL521 responded and advised RP on hazing techniques. WL521 set a pepper barrel across the street at Granite Canyon General Store where bear has broken into a storage room.

Sow and three cub are getting int trash. They have put several straps on and chained to tree. Sow still getting in. Trash service will not provide “bear can”. DWM 327 set a pepper spray can. Sow and three cubs were trapped 1/4 mile away and relocated

On 7/22 RP heard bear in his dumpster. RP went to scare it off and accidentally shot it with buckshot, killing it. RP was not able to get ahold of anyone on 7/22 and called again on 7/23. WL 222 responded and investigated. The bear was determined to have Cubs with it, however no Cubs were around. WL 222 issued a citation. The bear meat was spoiled, however the skull was retained by CPW for education.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
RP's wife Rachel got home to the camper around 7:00 PM on 07/13/2020 and saw where something had got into their camper and got all of the food out of the fridge and swiped everything off the counters. while walking around the property, she saw a large black bear and was able to get it to walk off.  But, it just made a circle and ended up sitting uphill of her and did not show much fear or concern of her.  

WL 290 determined the bear entered through an unlocked window by ripping a screen off and climbing in. RP's were advised to remove all trash from the property (currently locked in a connex) and to take the trash out of the camper daily to keep odors down.  The owners were also supplied with 5 round of rubber buckshot and instructed to call CPW if they used any.

WL290 set a trap on the property on the dirt pad where a future home will be built. To access the property take Old Stage Road out of Colorado Springs and turn right onto Myron Road (2.8 miles). Go through the gate (chain slides over pole) and take your first left on Felicity View and follow that road all the way to top.

Trap was pulled on 7/17/2020 by WL290 with no bear caught. RP advised to notify if bear comes back.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Four lambs killed during the nights of 06/29/2020 and 07/08/2020.  Preponderance of evidence suggested bear predation.  Trap was set the same day, but no bear was trapped.  Mr. Stevens is working through a game damage claim with DWM Diamond.

Report from Craig CSP sow and two cubs in a tree. RP was worried about heavy foot traffic during the day. May call CSP for more information or Vail. CPW in Glenwood Springs was notified by me. -SC HSS

WLO523 was informed that there had been a bear that had visited the Hall Valley Campground over the weekend and had gotten into a few coolers that a camper had left out.  Then the following night the bear returned and bit a bumper of a car parked in the same area as it searched for food as had been found the night before.
WLO523 responded to the campground and contacted the host who informed him that a number of bears had been seen in the area and that he had worked hard to see to it that campers secured their food and coolers each night before they went to bed.
The host thought there might be as many as half a dozen different bears in that general area.  The host also stated that a large group of campers had left trash alongside the road when they left and that a bear had located this trash.
The host also said that all of the "problem" campers had left the area and were only there during the past weekend.
A pepper barrel was set next to the camp host's RV.
WLO523 also drove around the entire campground and spoke with the remaining campers, most of whom had not seen any bears and had clean camps.

Nicholson removed pepper barrel and bear advisory sandwich board from this location to move to another campground experience bear conflicts on 8/15/2020. Camp host told Nicholson he tells people to lock up food and trash, but has difficulty getting people to comply. Camp host advised bears tore apart coolers at a campsite recently (no specific date), and a cinnamon colored bear approached within 6 feet of a woman at a site near camp host’s camp two days ago. Nicholson advised Swanson so he could follow-up. Entered by Nicholson in 8/15/2020.

Pepper barrels and signage has been moved around the campsites for the past month and a half.  A trail camera was also placed in the area and photos of moose were seen however there were not any photos of bears take  by the trail cameras.

Also, the USFS should be installing bear resistance cooler containers this following year.

On 09/10/2020 WLO523 removed the barrels and the warning signs regarding bear activity in the area.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments:
Small black bear entered greenhouse/sunroom attached to house and ate garbage that was stored there for the night. Bear has been in the area getting into feeders, trash, and has been difficult to scare off. 
Trap was set on 8/3/2020, non-target bear was caught. Target bear was seen back at this house on the morning of 8/4/2020. Bear was hazed with rubber buckshot on morning of 8/4/2020. 
WL officers set trap evening of 8/4/2020, immediately caught target bear. Bear was euthanized.  WL486

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Comments: Spoke with a resident who said that the bear got through his window and took some trash two nights after the same thing happened to his neighbors. Bear xame back next night and got through small window above sink. They have since properly secured all windows. Bear tried to get in on 10/8 (footprints visible on wall) and ripped off screens but did not get in.

WL124: I was going campsite to campsite educating campers of an aggressive bear in the area and handing out Bear Aware brochures when I heard a woman yelling “Bear!” and “Go Away!” At a nearby trailer. I ran up to the trailer and observed two black cubs run away to a nearby campsite. I instructed all nearby campers to go into their campers. I chased the bears onto the hillside behind the bathrooms. I spoke to the woman that was yelling and said they just got home and a black cub ran onto their deck while they were opening their front door. The woman said she had hummingbird feeders out and was going to take them in. I advised her to not put the feeders back out. I then went to look on the hillside and observed a brown sow with the two black cubs approximately 50 yards away and the sow bluff charged me. I attempted to haze with noise but was ineffective. At that point I went to the nearby campsites and instructed people to return into their campers. The three bears eventually moved eastbound away from the campground.

WL124: While patrolling through Spruce RV, Campers flagged me down and said a bear just ran through their RV site as they were packing up to leave. Shortly after I observed a large bear (black) nearby. Bear was effectively hazed with one beanbag round.

WL288:

Received a call from WL281. He was contacted by one of our volunteers, Joe Kraudelt. Joe had received a call that a bear broke into a house and trashed the downstairs while the homeowner (Stacie) and her baby slept upstairs. Stacie didn't realize a bear broke in until she came down in the morning and saw everything. The house is being renovated and there is plywood covering up door and window openings. The bear tore down one of the pieces of plywood to enter the house.  Joe called Stacie multiple times while I made my way to the residence. Joe let me know that it went to voicemail every time. I arrived at the house to find nobody home. A neighbor came over and let me know that Stacie left the house and was staying with someone in the Springs. The neighbor was able to contact Stacie via cell phone. Stacie gave me permission to set the trap on the property. She also stated that she had a couple of guys that were going to stay at the house in case the bear tried to break in again. I placed the trap down below the house by the garage.  I explained to the neighbor what needs to be done if a bear is caught. I tried to call Stacie but ended up leaving a voicemail explaining the same info that I gave the neighbor.

8/26
Trap rebaited - bear still around

8/28 Bear got back into house

8/28
Box trap set, culvert pulled

8/29 
Bear still returning. APHIS called

8/30 
Hounds run bear at 4:30 AM. Bear goes up a rock cliff that the dogs can't climbs. Bear escapes. 
WL281 gets permission for snares from Teller Health Department. (snares not set due to amount of cats and skunks.)
APHIS instructed to shoot bear over bait.

Bears was shot by APHIS around 10pm on 8/31. They found a good blood trail and waited until morning to look harder. Bear was not found. 

WL 281 with his dog returned with aphis that afternoon. They blood trailed the bear for about a mile. It had rained two times the night before after being shot so the trail was hard to follow. They were unable to locate the bear at that time. 
WL 281 will return to the are and search for birds on 9/2. 

Traps pulled on 9/1.

Bear from previous call returned on back porch of RP residence at 5:30 am. RPs son hazed away with pots and pans. No attractants. 325 issued rubber buckshot and bear spray.

6/27 - Bear was around cabins and RP did not think the bear seemed to be afraid enough of people. RP said he did not think the bear would leave because an individual in the campground might have been feeding the bear. W328 visited with owner and staff and gave them more rubber sluggs, rubber 00 and bear spray. W328 advised them on how to proceed with the new RV guests that were arriving.

PCBR: bear is in the building
07:46:42 11/02/2020 - VONBEHREN,JONAT
no one in building now

RP said a blonde bear with dark legs and head had gotten into a plastic tote that she had left outside her RV.  She had left two large bags of beans and rice in the tote.  Krall set a spray barrel and gave the RP some rubber slugs.

hives are kept in an electrified yard. The bear pushes under the fece. 
Officer Blanck set a pepper sprayer. The bear continues to go through the fence. It appeared to have been peper sprayed, but still returned to the hives. Officers Blanck and Chrisman inspected the area 7-5-2020. Officer Blanck set a pepper sprayer and watched the hives until after midnight 7-5-2020, the bear had not returned at that point.

Officer Chrisman watched the hives from dark on 7-7-2020 to 3:00 am on 7-8-2020 with no sign of the bear. Officer Chrisman also reached out to the RP and left a message inquiring about any more bear activity.

Small bear with to bluish-green ear tags. Bear has been in the area for about a week. RP was putting trash out this morning at about 7:00 a.m. and scared bearr off. Later, before the trash pick up came, bear got into trash.

RP said that bear was in neighbors pasture for 3 days,near a barn under construction,  . RP was concerned bear was sick.  W328 spoke with construction workers and landowners a meadow - pasture has an electric fence around it, except for the gates. Once landowners were aware that the bear was inside the pasture they turned off the electric fence. As W328 was hazing bear, it seemed wary of the electric fence. Bear eventuality climbed a tree next to fence and jumped over the fence and ran off

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
Sow and cub came to RP's home. Sow pushed on front door of home, tried to open doors on truck and ate 4 chickens. RP does not want the bears to be hurt, but wanted them moved if possible. 
325 inspected property on 6/11. Chickens were killed when bear entered unlatched shed door where they are kept at night. Others were taken at unknown time since 6/7. RP also keeps trash in shed. RP stated a yearling bear was also spotted on the property. Bird feeders and open vegetable garden on property. 325 suggested hazing, electric fencing for chickens and garden, removing bird feeders, attaching bolt lock to shed door, and gave specs for unwelcome mat.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments:
Bear entered house by breaking through glass window. Broke window closing mechanism. Bear left before WL225 arrived. WL225 searched the area but couldn't locate the bear. WL225 returned in the afternoon to set a trap. Bear had returned once in that time frame. 
RP called at about 7 PM to say they left for about an hour for dinner and the bear had broken in again. RP called at 7:45 to say the bear was back and WL225 responded. Bear was gone again.
Bear came back multiple times on the night of 7/15/2020 and WL225 attempted to put the bear down but was unsuccessful. 
Bear went into the trap at about 1:30 am on 7/16/2020 and was euthanized later that morning.

Landowner shot and killed bear that was attacking his goats. Bear killed at approx 3am 8/5.  Bear had ear tags. 326 inspected site. One wether goat was bandaged and had puncture wounds and a very stiff neck. Was alive when 326 saw it. Advised Ryan that if the goat dies, to stop by ytt he e office to pick up a game damage packet. Disposed of bear. Ear tag was from the research study, and no pit tag was detected.

Multiple bears seen around cabin most of summer.  Bear tried getting into shed and stood on cabin door.  Educated on how to lice with bears and their responsibilities to clean up and remove humming bird feeders. Provided rubber buck shot.

Larry called WL322 to report a bear had gotten into a refrigerator placed outside of a camp trailer. 322 advised Larry that an unsecured refrigerator was not going to end well. 322 advised 326 of incident and 326 visited site on 7/27 and found fridge with ratchet straps securing it to a trailer ladder. Larry also mentioned a bear had grabbed trash earlier. Advised Larry he will likely have more visits unless everything is secured. Also advised to keep vehicle windows and doors closed and locked. Issued rubber buck.

RP stated that an eartagged bear had been roaming the neighborhood for a few days. Not causing any issues, but was seen napping under his neighbor's porch mid-day. 325 set pepper barrel at deck entrance.
Bear on the property for 2 days.  Staying at and around the house and barns. Bear unwilling to leave when hazed by the RP. Several bird feeders at the house to llamas on the property.
Dead yearling on North side of road just west of address. 326 picked up yearling. Lat Long 37.19681, -108.02777.

RP stated that bear initially hit his trash trailer.  Bear got into back yard and got a seed feeder.  Bear leaned on a window near the seed feeder.  RP attempted scare off bear with loud noises.  No effect.  Sprayed bear with can of bear mace and it left.  Bear tore down several slats in the wooden fence.
Bear killed domestic ewe

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: Rp thought that a bear got into the backyard and got on their chicken coop.  The chickens free range and go in and out of the coop.  The coop is small and not heavily built it would have been very easy for a bear to rip the coop down and eat all of the chickens.  There were small scratch marks on the side of the coop, showing 4 claws and was consistent with a smaller K-9 like a fox.  Found where it appeared a fox was going under the fence into the backyard.  Explained to the RP that he did not have a bear problem and that the animal getting into the yard was most likely a fox.  Gave the RP a Living with Bears pamphlet in case he experienced any problems with bears in the future and left him the contact information for Canon City North Game Warden Bob Carochi.

RP called Wildlife 261 on 05/28/2020 and Wildlife 261 met with him that day at his place of work. RP stated a bear had walked through his neighborhood 5 out of the last 10 days but last night the bear got into one of the RP’s trash cans. The RP stated that the bear got into the only trash can that was not bear resistant that they rarely actually put trash in. RP also stated that the previous Wildlife Officer in the district was informed of this bear last year and gave the RP non-lethal buck shot. Wildlife 261 told the RP to continue to try and use the non-lethal buck shot on the bear if it comes back and to try to avoid using that trash can that is not bear resistant. RP agreed. 

On 05/30/2020 the RP shot the bear twice with non-lethal buck shot. Bear ran away. 

On 06/02/2020 Wildlife 261 performed an on sight visit. Bear has not returned.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior

WL 222 showed up and took the bear which was later donated.
Bear opened truck door and got shut inside. Destroyed interior of truck. Believed to possibly be same bear which has been opening other vehicle doors. Bear euthanized by CPW. WL 482 and 486

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set

Boulder PD reported a bear that had broken into the residence at 624 through an open window, and removed a bag of trash. 127 will follow up with residents at the address.

128 followed up with residents and property manager on 10/9.

Last night bear went into the garage to get trash. Yelled and clapped. Threw a rock at it.
First incident week and half a  ago garbage in back of truck covered with a topper bear tried to get in. hit car horn to scare it off.

Bear has been observed on porch at RP’s house and neighbor’s house over past week. Bear has been observed approaching livestock and investigating barn. Bear does not seem to be afraid of people. 

Today bear walked on porch of RP’s home. No food or attractants are on porch. Bear walked around barn where grain is stored. Nicholson advised to put grain bin in secure area, which RP did. 

Nicholson set pepper barrel by front porch and issued rubber buckshot to help protect livestock.
