Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting
Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
Bear approached a large group of camp participants and started going through backpacks. They were able to scare it off initially then another report came in of a hiker having her pack removed by the bear on the trail.

WL 283 talked with the second RP. She stated that she was tying her child’s shoe. Another kid told her that a bear was behind her. The RP turned around seeing a bear walking towards her.  She turned around and got her kid up on a bridge and turned around to see the bear walking away with her backpack. The backpack was sitting about 2-3 feet behind her. She stated that the bear did not growl or make any aggressive movements to her.  The bear then walked about 30 yards away and went through the backpack. Once the bear finished with the backpack, it came walking back up the creek and hung around in the water and scratched itself on some trees. The Nature Center then drove by in their Jeep on the trail and the bear ran away.

WL283 walked about a half mile along the creek to try and find the bear, but did not find it. WL 283 informed the Nature Center that they needed to put signs up to warn hikers, and talked to the center about what they can do to haze and report about the bear. 

WL 283 then went with the RP back to the scene to get her backpack. WL 283 collected a hair from the bear.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: A week ago a bear got into a cooler that had fish and some bait on the deck of RP.  Bear returned 2 days ago and got into the freezer that was in a unlocked garage.  On 4/26/20 Bear returned and tore trim off to house door causing glass to fall out.  RP scarred the bear off but between then 1am and 7am the Bear returned causing damage to garage door.  RP wanted to try negative reinforcement before CPW killed the Bear so no trap was set.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials , Euthanized
Comments:
Bear had been coming onto RPs property regularly because of all the attractants. For a complete list contact WL281 as there were many to include unsecured trash outside and unplugged open refrigerator that smelled like rotting food out side as well. 

Trap was set on 8/15. 
Bear was caught on 8/16 and euthanized. 
Seal Number 32464

Owner of the property was given a written warning for luring bears. 

WL281 told her the attractants needed to be removed or more bears would come around. She had made progress on the residence by securing the two living spaces. 

Pictures and Videos were taken by WL281. Too many to upload.

442 talked with RP and advised RP to talk with complex to install bear proof dumpsters. RP is part of HOA board and will do so. 442 also talked with several other residents on scene and gave them all the same advice, all residents informed 442 that Remax was unwilling to install bear proof dumpsters.

RP stating bear has been coming around yard for a couple of days.  RP was worried since it has been seen during the day.
Gray provided rubber buckshot and site inspection.

Bear ran across golf course then treed near highway 160. 325 responded, hazed with rubber round which sent bear higher in tree. Monitored bear for awhile, will likely stay in tree until dark. 150 lbs, brown with tan muzzle
WL124: Bear got into open window and reached inside and pulled out a trashcan filled with refuse. WL124 arrived on scene and bear was UTL. Provided advice.

Bear is getting into the RPs unsecured trash can. RP does not like to keep trash in his house and stated his trash can is not secured. WL 281 told the RP that he needs to secure his trash can if he is going to be keeping it outside and that once that happens the bear will move on. Bear Aware was dispatched to for a site visit.

7/28
Bear has gotten into trash 3-4 times. They have garage but stored trash can in space between home and garage. It was perfect spot for electric mat, but because of uneven surface I decided againist it because RP and wife are in 80’s and it could be a trip hazard. Talked him into moving trash into garage, did general education, recommended bleach in can, and bleaching around doors once a week. Left number if more problems.

RP reported bear was frequenting area under the deck. Advised to place ammonia soaked rags under deck as deterent.  Dilley did a site visit on October 5th.  Suggested ammonia rags.  If unsuccessful, Dilley suggested trying an electric fence under deck (difficult due to construction and vegetation).  Dilley suggested enclosing space under deck next summer to block access.

Bear is denning under RP's deck. This is a 2nd home for the RP. I spoke with him about options. He determined that the bear can stay. I advised him to keep in contact, and let us know if he thinks it is an issue.
He will secure the opening to under the deck when the bear is thru hibernating.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
RP says the bear has been breaking into her garage for several days now, to get to trash that's kept in the garage.  RP says the bear has been there seven times in the last nine days and has been constantly breaking into her garage and her neighbors car, and her garage is broken from the bear breaking in so many times.

The RP said she has seen a smaller cinnamon colored bear and a larger dark brown colored bear. She hasn't seen the cinnamon bear in a few days.

 No bear was captured. Trap pulled 10/29/2020

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
No further response needed.
On October 21 Ken Caryl Ranger’s were patrolling near the Manor House trails and Observed trash scattered.  The garbage all lead to the dumpster at the Manor House and trash was observed all around the dumpster.  
McKee visited the Manor House on the 22nd but nobody was present.  A photo was taken of the dumpsters and the damaged lid on one of them.  McKee later spoke with CR Brinton, the Manor House Manager.  He stated they have problems with bears getting in their dumpsters every fall.  There is one in particular that visits every year.  It has been able to breech  the plastic lid on the dumpsters on several occasions.  The bear has been hitting them regularly now for the last three weeks.  The other day they had a close call when one of their staff members went to place a bag in the dumpster and the bear jumped out of it.  The employee was not injured.  McKee told them that the plastic lids were not adequate and that they needed to remedy the situation immediately.  CR stated that he is not in charge of the trash but that he did talk to his employee that is and that metal lids have been ordered and they are hoping to be in and installed within the next couple weeks.  
In order to document the contact, the Manor House was issued a written warning for trash and CR accepted the warning on behalf of the Manor House.  
They were provided bear literature with additional ideas to secure their trash.  They were also provided bear  dumpster stickers to remind employees to lock them up at night .
J McKee

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear was trapped between 8 PM on July 10th and 7 AM July 11th 2020. Bear was relocated. Bee owner is Richard McCollum. He installed his own electric enclosure. Bear was able to get inside anyway and knock a box over. Schmalz is the landowner that the bees are on. Schmalz has been the one communicating with Purcell.
The bear was shot by the landowner, (justified) while it was attacking his alpaca.  Seal # 33739

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
At 6pm the RP saw the bear attacking on of his goats he fired his .410 at the bear. He said that he did not hit the bear. WL 287 looked around for blood and only a drop was found on the fence where the bear went over it.  The goat had multiple wounds but is still alive( see photos). WL 287 set a bear trap. The bear was small, black face/ front legs with dark cinnamon sides with a darker ridge along the back. 

RP does have bird feeders out and he was reminded that the feeders are attractants for bears.
Bear killed  ducks, and went after goat.  Rp shot and killed bear with .40.  1 shot

Bear got into chicken coop.  Responded and performed a site inspection.  Brought a pepper spray barrel to set and the RP said that he did not want it set because he has dogs that he lets run free. Gave him rubber buck to haze the bear if it comes back. Gave him a living with bears pamphlet for further recommendations on how to stay bear aware.

A sow with two cubs walked into an open garage and got into trash. Homeowner opened the door to garage and saw the bears. They ran off. 
Sow is black cubs are brown and black

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear reportedly came straight for homeowner. He fired one round into driveway. Bear continued and he fired a second round and the bear left. 492 set a trap and wildlife services came on 7/6/2020 but was unsuccessful locating the bear.

Officer Callback Requested
RP called to report that he shot a problem bear twice with rubber buck shot last night. Around 10:30pm the RP's wife chased a bear out of their hog pen but it returned a few minutes later. The RP shot it with the buck shot once and it returned again about a half hour later. The RP again shot it with rubber buck and when the RP woke up this morning there was damage to the hog feeder from the bear again. The RP said that he had problems with bears in the past and wildlife officers had placed a trap on his property last year. I recommended using bear unwelcome mats but he is worried about his other livestock stepping on the mats. I also recommended using scent deterrents. The RP requested a call back from the district officer as he is getting frustrated because he is constantly having to repair the hog feeder. WO 544 was contacted and made aware of the request for a call back. LB

WL544 did a site inspection. WL544 observed the hog pin. WL544 saw that the food was in a trough in the pig enclosure. WL544 told the RP that rubber buckshot and other hazing methods would not be effective and that he should put up an electric fence if he wants to keep the bear out. WL544 gave the RP some more rubber buckshot for the time being. WL544 did stress that this would not solve his problem and he needed to either clean up the trough or install his electric fence.

Last seen Monday night. Bear comes back often. Other parties have had issues none have which have been reported (down the street from RP)  - Monday night  a little dog was killed defensively. Door handle has ripped off a vehicle.  Beanbag Shots were issued

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
Yes, Further Response Needed
RP called to report a very large black bear that has been seen in the neighborhood and the RP's property every night. Around 2am, the RP and his wife heard a bear rolling their bear proof cans around before breaking into them. The RP thinks that the bear is at least 350lbs and has broken open both the RP's and a neighbor's bear proof trash cans. The RP has hazed the bear every night for the past week by going outside and yelling at the bear. The RP says that in the past, smaller bears have run away quickly but this bear stands it's ground and last night, the bear began approaching the RP. The RP has tried covering his trash can in bleach and removed all other attractants on his property but the bear returns and is rewarded with the trash from the broken trash cans. The RP says that the bear is rewarded all over the neighborhood by neighbors with both bear proof cans and unsecured trash cans. The RP is worried that the bear is getting more aggressive and bold. I told the RP to consider speaking to neighbors about securing their trash within secure buildings to prevent the bear from being rewarded. I told the RP to try placing rags soaked in ammonia on the trash cans if he cannot place the cans within a building like a garage. I also told the RP to keep bear pepper spray handy and to try placing bear unwelcome mats around the property also. I told the RP that he can set off his car alarms and use airhorns out a window so he does not go outside because of the bear's bold nature. RP requested a call from an officer. WLO525 was made aware and given the RP's contact information. L.Berry

Officer Nicholson responded to property, RP not home. Nicholson observed bear resistant trash cans outside and a can that appears to hold food waste beside grill and below kitchen window. Nicholson called and left message for RP, suggesting paintball gun to haze, clean cans with bleach, and store all food waste inside home. Officer Nicholson left his cell number. Entered by Nicholson on 9/30/2020.

A cinnamon bear was getting in the trash at the RP’s house. Thinks it may have been coming for the last couple of days but only for sure saw it today. WL283 did a site visit but the bear was not there when he arrived. WL283 gave a lot of info about trash and being bear aware. I told them to let us know if they see that bear again.

This house is a possible good spot for a bear trap if needed.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments:
RP concerned about bear hanging around neighborhood, getting trash and chickens. Went to 491, 490, 494, and 472 Rhyolite with her. Did education. 
Learned that bear comes around on morning of trash day and is seen during the day hanging around houses and looking for trash. This is the third call I’ve had on this street and I’m concerned that this bear is getting used to being around people.  I will stop by on Trash day(Mon.) and try to haze the bear.
Attempted to remove bear with APHIS hounds after recent sweet corn damage found.  Unsuccessful as of July 15.

RP put trash out for trash day. Bear knocked over trash and got in trash can. Same beat that has got trash and bird feeders at other homes in neighborhood.

Nicholson set pepper barrel at end of drive where trash cans are located. Nicholson gave flier and verbally advised to secure food trash and remove all bird feeders. Nicholson put flier advising same at every house on Granzella Rd and Rockridge Rd.

Nicholson received message at 1:00pm advising RP watched bear get sprayed by pepper barrel and flee area. Nicholson is leaving pepper barrel set.

Entered by Nicholson on 5/29/2020.

Pepper barrel removed on 6/2/2020 by Nicholson.

Sow and two cubs were eating on a roadkill deer carcass off of HWY 67 in Woodland Park. Since the bears were near the road it was casing some traffic issues. Bear aware removed the deer carcass after hazing the bears away.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
RP partially latched garage door. Within an hour RP noticed door had been pulled open and top latch had been popped off. Trash was dug out and spread around. W328 set trap. RP alternate number - 970-385-4868.
W329 picked up trap on 6/29 no sign of bear coming back. 7/6 bear came back and damaged garage wall. 327 set trap. On 7/10 WL 329 picked up trap. Rp hasn’t seen it and didn’t try to get bait in trap.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized , Rehabilitation
Comments: Diane called to report a bear had killed her 8 chickens earlier (~3am) that morning. The property has growing sweet and field corn on there sides. Neighbors had previously seen a blonde sow with two darker cubs in the area. Cage trap set at approximately 5:30pm. Diane called back shortly after 10pm to report that the sow had been trapped, and that the two Cubs were in a nearby tree. 127 and 124 responded and caught the cubs, and transported all 3 bears to Lon Hagler for the night. On 7/29 the sow was euthanized by 120, and 128 transported cubs to Frisco Creek rehabilitation site. -127

A young bear was seen by the RP on her property. She stated that  the bear seemed confused and was walking around their property.  It was trash day, but the trash had already come. The bear did not seem afraid of their large dog that was going crazy over the bear. The RP went outside and yelled at the bear. It did not seem afraid of them either. They fired a shot into the ground since the they were out of rubber rounds. The bear ran off.

Bear aware report: 
Contacted RP after request from WL281. She wanted rubber buck but has 20 ga. She did find some on line.  She has not had problems with bear other than it travels thru her property and she has to pick up neighbors trash. Advised her to call me if trash problem persists. Went to 81 Aspen Ln. next and realized John and I had been there last year.( RP- female was very uncooperative and husband had to come out and calm her down, and talk to us.) Same female answered the door and I introduced myself and asked her name, she did not tell me but said ‘I remember you’. I asked if they were still having bear problems and she said yes. I asked if they needed more rubber buck and she said yes and took it from my hand. I told her that I remembered talking to them about keeping their trash in the garage and that it was still outside. She said she keeps it out all day and brings it in at night because she doesn’t want her classic cars to stink. I tried to tell her about bleaching can and freezing meat scraps but she cut me off and said” I’m going to keep doing just what I have been, leaving trash out during day with a nail board, and bring ing it in at night.” They had a nail board with some spikes in it near the can. She then walked back into the home.

TWO PROBLEMS to address: There is a large brown female bear that has been a problem in this neighborhood for years. I have been on numerous calls here the last few years.

Second the folks at 81 Aspen Lane are part of the problem and have been advised to keep garbage secured twice. She is hostile and may require further LE action. ( tried to get names on county site but it was not working)

I also visited folks at 35 Aspen Ln. who have seen the bear and watched it get into their trash can last Thursday after they had put it out for pick-up. Did education and issued rubber buck and told to call if further problems.

Bear was inspecting empty trash cans.  Hotchkiss Marshal watched the bear disappear into a drainage. Unable to locate upon arrival. Second sighting of this same bear in three days. No property has been destroyed or damaged.

No Further Response Needed. 

CSP reported roadkill on I25 at MM 185 northbound just north of Castle Pines. Carcass was too destroyed to obtain tooth sample or accurate sex/aging information. J Olson #088

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
Here is the direct report from the YMCA concerning the Tundra Cabin:

"A bear entered the cabin through an unlocked living room window, tearing the screen off in the process. Once inside the animal foraged through the refrigerator and the countertop resulting in a substantial food reward. Items taken included a bag of sugar, some salmon, cheese, avocados, milk, chips and a few other food items. Guests reported hearing something in their cabin sometime between 3:00 and 3:45 a.m. They investigated but did not actually see the animal."                   

Trap set by WL124

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Shirley Shireck called to report that a small black bear had broke into their garage at 800 Waltonia Rd.  The bear got into the freezer and got several packages of meat.  Advise given, site was inspected and the garage was secured again.  Trap set.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments:
RP reported a bear had got into there goat barn on the night of 8/9-8/10 and killed 3 goats and injured 2 more.  

WL290 did a site inspection and found three deceased goats with wounds consistent from a bear attack, scratch marks on the outside of the barn, bear hair stuck in the wood of the barn, and a large pile of bear scat just outside the barn.  the RP also stated the bear had knocked over their trash can, which was curbside for trash pick up day. A veterinarian was on scene providing care to the 2 goats that were injured. The goats are secured in the barn every night around 8:30PM. It appears the bear was able to climb up and over a wall. RP was advised to secure the barn wall all the way to ceiling and RP said they would do that today.

WL 290 set a trap by the barn and shed. The target bear will likely be a large dark brown or black colored boar, based on the pile of scat and hair found. RP was left with game damage claim paperwork.

WL 287: Bear with white ear tag trapped and euthanized.  RP said there were two bears around her barn in the AM. Another trap was set for the other bear.

WL 284: Second bear caught. Black male weighing 228 lbs. Was removed and euthanized.

RP chained dumpster shut and still having issues. Talked about possibly hazing bear. Possibly building an unwelcome Mat to deter bear. Emailed RP directions to build unwelcome Mat. -WLO544

RP stated that the bear had gotten into his garage on the 26th. The bear was rewarded with meat from the freezer. WL544 went out to possibly haze it on the 07/27/2020 with no luck. WL544 continued to warn RP about keeping his garage fully closed. RP stated that they are no longer keeping any food in his garage. 

END

Complaint Type: Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
This property and the neighbor reported a 4-5' black colored bear that was "knocking" on doors and standing up and putting weight on the doors. Also reported as trying to stick its head into the window.  
Another RP says a bear broke into an unoccupied cabin on Hill rd twice, which is less than 1 mile away. Unknown if correlated, but it is likely the same bear.  This RP is going to set a game camera to try and get photos of the bear.
Trap set at the Highway 12 address on 7/3/2020.

Bear was hit by a vehicle on HEY 24 and put down by EPSO.

Seal #: 40442
2 bears getting into RPs growing tomatoes. RP is 90+ female w/ very poor vision living alone with no neighbors close. Trap was set

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: Bear got into corn in an open shed and tipped over a beehive that was not in production.  Did a site inspection and recommended that the corn be locked in the garage.  Ratchet strap the trash.  Secure beehives with electric fence.  Herman was given 5 rds of rubber buckshot.  He lives in the edge of city limits and has a safe backstop to haze a bear.  Officer Holder contacted CCPD Sgt Leonard and asked him if it would be ok to distribute rubber buck to Kline and he said that he was fine with it due to the fact that he would be protecting his property when he hazed the bear and the city limit line was only feet from his property line.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
RP called Teller County Bear Aware team and said a cub was in her backyard in a tree. The Bear Aware team made  a site visit and found an adult bear in a tree.  RP has a bird feeder in the yard. Bear aware team gave out bear aware advice.

From Volunteers: 
Call from RP at 11:55 of a cub up a tree that kept going up higher in the tree and crows harassing it.  Arrived at 12:10.  Adult was bear up a tree in the back yard outside the fenced-in area approx 30 feet high.  Bear didn't appear to be injured but awake and alert.  No distress sounds from the bear as I approached the tree for a better look.  RP said their dog alerted them to the bear's presence by barking.  Bear Aware education to the RP and family and a quick site assessment.  Advised about garage doors, ground-level windows, bird feeders (one in the backyard), and locking automobiles.  Canvassed the area.
RP had my card from last week's canvassing hence why she called me directly.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear climbed into open window and went thru screen onto kitchen counter.  Knocked over dishes but RP didn’t think it got any food. There were 2 kids and a dog inside the home when this occurred. Dog scared bear away. The bear left muddy smudge marks on window and a torn screen. Unable to see a good track. WL 329 set trap on 7/29. WL324 picked up trap 8/2, the RP had not reported any more activity and there were no pictures of the bear on the trail camera

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials
Comments: R/P called to notify DWM Brown that a bear had broken his driver side window on his pickup. The R/P informed DWM Brown that he left pumpkin seeds on the center console which he believed the bear was after. DWM Brown set a bear trap in an attempt to catch the animal on 07/23/20.

Bear got into car two nights in a row. First night no damage. RP thought kid got into car and left door open. Last night bear got in damaged center console and left teeth marks.  Unknown time just happened overnight.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Reeves texted WL321 at 4 am saying that a bear tried breaking into their home and that they called 911. 3 Montezuma deputies responded and no bear was found. WL321 set trap on 7/17. Trap pulled 7/20

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
RP Dana contacted WO 284 and said this bear has been around almost every night. RP says the bear breaks into the shed to get the trash and take it away. The bear has also broken into a truck in the driveway multiple times and isn’t afraid of the residents when they try to scare it away.

The bear has also been hazed with beanbag rounds and rubber buckshot by the residents. Rounds given by WO 284 in 2019. Bear runs away, but cones back a few hours later.

Corbin called because a bear walked into an open garage door and helped itself to the refrigerator. Corbin found the bear in the garage and scared it out. The bear went up a nearby tree. I responded and educated Corbin about being bear aware and keeping windows doors and garage door closed and locked. 
Tyler Stoltzfus

No further response needed. Officer Mckee was advised by neighbors that Char had  a bear in  her hummingbird feeder on sept 14..  Officer McKee  spoke with char  and she stated she did have video of the bear on her porch and drinking from hummingbird feeder- eventually pulling it down.  The video she showed was consistent with the bear as shown in linneman’s report.  Large, dark brown w lighter nose.  Char  was told she could not put birdfeeders out anymore between May and November. She stated she would not. She was provided bear literature.
JM

RP had bear get into unsecured trash can several times last year  (2019). 325 verbally warned and advised to get bear resistant bin from local trash service, which they did. Called on 7/14/20, stating that bear has defeated bin several times. 325 inspected bin, seemed to work OK, but needs pushed closed to engage lock.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments: Bear got into RP's chicken coop and killed some chickens. RP is requesting a call back from an officer to get rubber buck and to discuss relocation. 463 issued rubber buckshot and did site visit, discussed other deterrents

The RP called Wildlife 261 on 06/29/2020 stating that someone in the neighborhood he lived in had accidentally left a trash container open over night about a week ago and a bear had got into the trash. Since that night the bear has returned on a few occasions. However, the night of the incident the bear got onto the RP's back deck and tried to get into the RP's , bird feeders, and a box of bird seed that was on the deck. The RP stated that the bear was unable to get any food out of any of the attractants. WL 261 informed the RP to put away all the attractants listed above at night and to clean the smoker as best he could. WL 261 also gave the RP rubber buckshot to haze the animal if it returned to the RP's house.

Sow with 2 cubs relocated. Had been causing issues (primarily trash) in area for a few weeks. Sow is green 477, PIT 982.00364298337. Black cub has white ear tag 118 (treat as a green ear tag, ran out of green tags), brown cub is green 1067. Released by WL124.
Bear was wondering through neighborhood getting into trash. It happened to be trash pick up day for the neighborhood. Bear did not seem afraid of humans.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
No officer response requested.

RP stated that last night he was returning from walking his dog and was alerted by his name that a bear was in his yard and to be careful.  He put his dog in the house and grabbed his bear spray.  Started yelling at the bear, sprayed it in the face and it went across to the street to a common area with a pond and went up a tree.  Before he used the bear spray the bear did a bluff charge.  His concern is when he was yelling the bear wasn't in any hurry to get away as it was going thru his neighbors trash.  The common area is next to a day care and that concerned him too.  He asked when we relocate bears.  I suggested that if his neighborhood would adopt a bear proof trash container policy that would mean it wouldn't get rewarded and hence eventually not return.  Also mentioned that bird feeders were big bear attractants and would need them taken down .  He is going to post some info on Next door from the emailed bear packet I sent him.  T.Wallace NERO
Officer Olson contacted the RP to further discuss the aggressive behavior and he detailed the incident basically as described above but added he feels confident the Bear was sprayed with pepper spray and showed effects from it. The bear maintained a distance of around 15-20 yards the entire time even when bluff charging and vocalizing and popping jaws during the instance. It sounds like the neighborhood has been having visits from a bear the past three nights or so. Officer Olson further discussed removing attractants and drove through the area. Also coordinated a NextDoor posting to the neighborhood regarding bear aware practices and removing attractants. J Olson #088

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials
Comments: PCBR: bear has come back 4 times, was even shot with rubber bullets, rp wants to call CPW directly, says a deputy was already there / gave her phone number for the GWS office for tomorrow

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials , Euthanized
Comments:
Part of an ongoing situation at Columbine pass regarding a bear and camper/picnickers conflict.  RP woke up when his hard sided camper trailer was rocking.  Opened the door and bear was on top of the camper.  He yelled, and bear hopped off into back of truck, then walked away.

Bear continued to harass anothergroup of campers  Thursday night south of the campground on Monitor Mesa Rd. Would not show fear and did not run away until they fired two shots. Bear described as a small brown color bear with blond streak on back, and they showed me pictures of the bear. Trap was set, signs posted in the area. Bear came back to the campground Monday night (7/20) four times, and was treed by their dogs twice on Tuesday morning. Bear charged the woman that was in the camp  twice Tuesday morning. Called APHIS and they ran hounds and euthanized the bear on 7/21/2020 (Seal 38772)

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
WL 186 received a call from Fort Collins.
RP had A bear break the window out of their summer house and get into fridges /freezers.  Bear had been in the house multiple times.  Bear also broke the window out of shop and got into fridge and freezer.  Bear broke into small shed where another fridge/ freezer was located.  Bear received multiple rewards.  

WL 186 set trap.  In the some area WL 186 has responded to calls regarding a bear Breaking into homes.

Neighbor; Phil who will be checking the trap: 970-215-6524

WL 186 pulled the trap on 8/5.  On bear trapped

Bear living under deck for 3-4 weeks. The bear has been caught on camera and video. 
Gets into trash daily and has to be cleaned up constantly. Dumpster is not bear proof.  Multiple homeowners have reached out to HOA to get trash company to get bear proof dumpster. Concerned because she has 3 children and they now feel trapped. SC HSS

RP called saying smaller black bear is getting into dumpster nearly every day. Bear has become neighborhood spectacle, and people come out to watch bear when in and around dumpster. RP concerned bear will become habituated as well as that many small kids in area and afraid will be injured. WL 488 inspected dumpster and found that there is a small gap (1-1.5 ft) between metal roof over dumpster and dumpster, allowing a determined/smaller bear to get in. Observed bear tracks on external dumpster housing as well as strewn trash. On 8/13 WL 488 spoke with Hank from Keystone Property Management (970-261-6207). Told him about reoccurring incident w bear and that needed to close off gap around top of dumpster. Advised Hank that this was a warning and that if they did not fix problem, would be intentionally luring bears and would be issued a citation. Hank was advised to fix problem w/in a week, and to call WL 488 with any questions or concerns.

RP stated that a deer was dead near his house and appeared to be fed on. 
325 responded, doe carcass had no signs of predation but had been partially fed on by bear. 325 removed carcass.

Mr. Walker called about a large bear hanging around his residence. He said he was not feeding animal but had several water buckets available. Said he would not shoot the bear with bean bag rounds because the bear knew him! Travel to site and locate large red bear with severely scarred face and missing left eye. Mr. Walker admitted feeding this bear last year when he was cited by DWM HOLDER #754. Upon arrival Mr.. Walker said that he changed his mind and would use bean bag round as the bear had started onto his porch and had to shoot with airsoft pistol in the nose and was 'nervous'. 
 DWM HOLDER #754 shot bear with bean bag as he came in again during site inspection.  5 bean bag rounds and one rubber 00 furnished

The RP called to report a bear that was not afraid of a large group of preschoolers hanging around their playground. Usually the bears run off if they see the kids however this one did not care. They had all of the kids go back inside. The bear ended up getting into the trash of the residence next door. 

WL 281 responded and gave a verbal warning to the homeowners as they had just set the trash outside while remodeling the area where they store the can. 

The bear was not afraid of them when they saw it was in the trash. They have seen the bear numerous times and have been pretty diligent about keeping their trash locked up. They noted that the bear was hitting a lot of houses and was not afraid of people. 

WL 281 tried to located the bear and was unsuccessful.

442 was informed by CSP Craig that an RP in Parachute was having issues with a bear. 442 contacted RP, Rachel, and arranged to meet her at her house where the issue was occuring. 
RP informed 442 that a younger/smaller bear was climbing on their chicken coop as well as vehicles. RP was worried bear would start to rip up their boat cover. RP stated they have been able to scare the bear away when they hear it at night. 442 supplied the RP with rubber buckshot and informed her to call 442 if the problem persists. 442 also suggested electric wire for the chicken coop
Small yearling bear tore through screen and entered home.  Did not get rewarded inside.  Trap set 5/20.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

RP said the bear had thrown their bear resistant trash can around and broke their decorative fencing. WL225 provided the RP 5 rubber slugs and 5 sock deterrent rounds.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear came to window and pulled screen off. Seemed unafraid of people.  Described as a very dark colored bear, about 5 feet in height when standing.  Trap was set on 6/11/2020.  Had conversation with homeowner about removing hummingbird feeders to prevent further issues even though this bear didn't interact with them. Bear returned twice on the night/morning of 6/13/2020 and pushed on the window and sliding door. Bear returned morning of 6/15/2020 and landowner killed it with a 12 gauge after the bear approached him and was standing on the deck.

Complaint Type: Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Comments: Previous report of destructive behavior by a bear.  RP said Bear returned around 11 on 4/30 and was scared away when it was pulling plywood off the house.  Bear returned around 12:15 and preceded to destroy trim on the garage door.  RP shot and killed the Bear.  WL483 responded, determined via investigation RP was justified to kill the bear.  Bear skinned for auction and meat donated.

Donlon went of vacation for a month and had a bear tear into his truck. There was no food in the car. Truck had a small antifreeze leak. There was also evidence of small mammals caching food under the truck hood. Bear apparently ripped wiring harness and bumper off truck. Tooth  marks on bumper and on plastic pieces.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Trap is set after the bear attacked a llama.  The llama had to be euthanized by the owner.  The bear also entered a mud room with dog food.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Euthanized
Comments:
RP came home and saw bear in trash. Bear ran up a small ~20 tree. 

WL 290 tried to haze the bear out with a rubber buck shot round. After firing the round, there was blood coming from inside back leg. WL290 decided to immobilize the bear to assess the new injury and look at an old infected injury on the back right leg of the bear. The bear appeared to be putting little to no weight on the back right leg. 

The bear was immobilized and injuries assessed. The existing infected wound was cleaned and antibiotic ointment applied. The new injury was from a rubber buckshot pellet penetrating the skin.  WL 290 removed one pellet just below the skin, cleaned the wound and applied antibiotic ointment. The body condition of the bear was poor/fair. 

Ear tags and PIT tag applied and bear reversed. Upon reversal when the bear stood, it was not putting any weight on its back right leg.

Morning of 7/30 bear assessed and determined to euthanize the bear do the it not putting any weight on the back right leg.  After skinning the bear, the right femur was broken and infected.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: RP stated bear had broken into trash receptical. Trash receptical was replaced by trash company. Bear hit on highway the next morning.

Young bear was spotted near RP’s house when fed her horses this morning. Bear was not easily scared off. It had attempted to get into chicken coop, but was unsuccessful. Gave them some rubber buckshot and advice on avoiding bear conflicts.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior

Comments: RP stated bear ran in his direction and then treed. RP was fishing on river and beat is in tree just off of core trail. RP said bear did not show any signs of agression. Dilley advised RP to move away from area near tree. RP said many people in area on trail. Dilley put up sandwich board sign on trail.

RP called back because the bear was back. Bear was under porch.I responded and got the bear to leave. It was very agitated with my presence. Bear is very large. Told RP to call again if the bear came back.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Hazed
Comments: Bear has been at camp for two weeks and hazed with rubber buckshot four times.  Has been in open garages and scratched car doors.  Camp has fifty people on premises weekly.  No trash found left out.
Sow with 2 cubs was getting into RPs trash. It was trash day.
Bear ripped half the plywood off shed door. Got into the bed of his truck and into the back of sons car last night. No damage done. Has broken into shed weekly. - SC HSS

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials , Euthanized

Comments:
Marguerite call WLO523 again on the 8th and stated that the bear had returned to the property and that it had climbed up on the building attempting to get in near the kitchen area.
WLO523 responded and replaced a pepper barrel on the property to hopefully created a negative experience if and or when the bear returns.
Also, the RP stated that she believes that there might be two bears that have come onto her property this week.

WL 523 removed pepper barrel.

WL 186 contacted camp host who had spoken  to the RP.  Camp host stated the RP did not use the bear boxes which are provided at each camp site.  The bear got into the back of the RP’s truck and opened up coolers and eat the contents in side. 

WL 186 offered the camp host a pepper cooler to haze the bear. At this time the pepper cooler is not set, but if more bear activity occurs in the camp ground the host will plan to set the cooler.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials
Comments:
Bear entered in the early morning while RP, a renter for the weekend, and his family were sleeping.  RP called 911 and Pitkin SO cleared the house and the bear was no longer in the house.  Bear entered through a screen door and left the same way.  Trap was set.  
RP provided the owner of the house's information:  Renee at Snowmass Vacations 970-923-4488.  Renee was told of the incident and that a bear trap was at the property.
Trap removed 7/14

Hazing Method: Pepper Spray , Less lethal round , Taser
Comments: WL124: Received a call from dispatch of a bear trying to get into a dumpster. Bear knocked over two dumpsters but they were locked and no food reward was received. Bear was exposed to taser and achieved full neuromuscular incapacitation for five seconds. Bear hunkered in nearby outdoor stairwell and refused to leave. After over an hour, PD officers exposed bear to pepper spray and rubber buckshot and it ran away. This is the same bear that has been hanging around near downtown Estes Park with a nose injury (Photo 2 is from a previous incident for reference).
put picture of her leaving seed out for bear in news paper.  Issued warning letter.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
RP works at the San Juan Hotel in Pagosa. Small black bear attempted to get into one of the hotel rooms last night. A few days ago sow ran through breezeway toward guests and they had to run into their room.  Bears have been RP is worried a customer will get attacked by a bear. RP would like a call back. All trash is secured.
325 responded. 4 different bears have been seen in recent weeks (black cub  and black/ cinnamon sow, young black bear, and a young light brown/ cinnamon bear). The sow showed some aggression toward RP when he tried to shoo it off, huffing and walking toward him. Got new dumpster so bears aren't getting into it anymore unless a guest leaves a trash bag out. Knows that bears are frequenting nearby dumpster used by Blondie's produce stand and heard a bear has  been in her produce tent at night also.

RP was concerned because I bear got into his mother’s trash multiple times. I performed a site inspection on 7-28-2020 and we devised a way to keep the bear out of the trash by securing it to the fence and her was going to build a locking mechanism for the lid that would allow his mom to still get in the container. He said that he thought she would have a hard time with a ratchet strap. I recommended he also leave a radio on the back porch and set it to a talk radio station so it would appear to a bear that someone was out on the porch talking. Asked him to give me a call if he has any additional problems.

RP called to report a bear that came last night the bear was standing out in the yard next to the truck as RP was working in the garage. Bear did teeth chattering and the bear did a fake bluff charge. RP's boyfriend yelled and the bear ran around the side of the house. They did not see the bear after this. Black color, tan-ish brown nose. 
The same bear, they believe, ripped off the garage door three weeks ago. Next night after they replaced it, the bear was standing on the other side of the leach field. Bear came back two nights later and lifted up the NEW garage door and was pulling trash out of the garage. 
Trash is already locked in garage. No bird feeders on property. I told RP to use bear unwelcome at the garage doors and outside the front of the garage. RP knew how to build one. I told RP to continue to yell at it and bang pots and pans, air horns and bear pepper spray if the bear comes within 30 ft. I also told RP to invest in a painball gun and freeze the paintballs. If the bear returns to shoot the bear with the frozen paintball guns. RP acknowledged receiveing a bear packet by email. -M. Gallegos

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments:
RP came back from vacation and found a dead sow and  one cub in her backyard.  

WL 288 and 287 went to the address to investigate. The sow is the injured sow with  two cubs that has been seen in the area throughout summer. WL 287 believes there in not an abandoned cub, as  a cub was found shot  in a near by neighborhood on 09/24/2020. This cub was distinct due to an ear missing.  The RP had multiple videos of the family playing in her pond. Videos show the sow with two cubs, one having a missing ear. 

 Both the sow and the cub were facing uphill and had blood coming from their noses.  They had most likely died sometime the previous day.  WL 287 and 288 looked for trauma and could not find any.  The metal detector was unable to locate  metal. 

The RP had mouse bait in 4 mouse trap containers, \.  The bears did not get into these. 

Both bears are being sent to the health lab.

Reps husband on inside of door, hit door and bear went up hill.   Bear came back down the hill but left just before Routt deputies arrived.  RP told deputies the bear was heading to neighbors house.  RP was concerned that the bear was salivating and she thought it might be sick. Deputies found bear at neighbors house and tried to run it off by yelling. Bear approached the deputy and he shot it with a bean bag. Bear ran into timber. 
Dilley called RP and arranged a sight visit the next day.  Dilley contacted RP and did site inspection. Dilley advised to remove two bird feeders and put grill in garage.  RP removed feeders.  Dilley advised that compost pile near greenhouse may be an attractant and RP said she would get rid of pile.

At approximately 1330 hours a small black in color bear entered a residence  by breaking through a screen door. Once inside the bear did some damage to the kitchen and was able to access to multiple food sources in the kitchen area.  The homeowner, who was not inside at the time, realized something was going on inside and scared the bear out of the house. At approximately an hour later a neighbor, at 5 River Street, called CSP dispatch to report that the bear was back and currently wandering around outside the house looking for food sources. The residence at 1231 CR 782 had their trash bin destroyed by a very large 400 plus pound black bear. There are multiple other bears that have come in as well. The owner will be getting a new container on 6/3/20.  He has been using ratchet straps to try and keep the bears out. The neighbor has shown me pictures of the trash strewn everywhere. 
The large black bear usually comes at 5:30 am. 
Other bears come in the evening and middle of the night. 
Bear aware is placing electric mats and bear boards at the property to help secure the trash. 
A follow up will be done and possible LE action will be taken if trash is unsecured.

Bear Cub sighting at 420 Longview Ct. It was just North of Hover and 3rd St. Cub had walked south shortly before I arrived.  I looked for it for a while, but the bushes provide great cover in that neighborhood and I was UTL.  RP Jaime called back at 2030 and the bear cub had walked back through his yard.

Calls of a single lone cub reported since about 6:30 AM. The bear was on the east side of I25 and was first seen at Uintah St and I25. The bear traveled north along the interstate. 
Wl281 spotted the bear on the east side of the interstate on a frontage road heading towards the interstate. 
WL281 stopped so he would not spook the bear towards the interstate. The bear went towards it anyways and crossed all  lanes of traffic. Officers were unable to locate it again, and did not receive any other calls of a single cub on the east side of I25 that day.
Bear entered and left occupied house through open ground level window. Tore off screens. Damage to kitchen.

RP stated that small cinnamon bear had been seen in USFS Lake Creek Campground.  He said it got into a cooler with water in it and into the bed of a truck.  A neighboring landowner had also seen the bear around their residence with no incident.  Another dispersed camper in the area had also had the bear around his camper.  On the evening of June 16 Krall enlisted the help of houndsmen Jon Evert to try and haze the bear with hounds.    Stayed out until 2200 hours but were unsuccessful in finding the bear.  On June 17 at about 0600 Evert was successfull in running the bear with hounds starting at the dumpster in Lake Creek Campground.  The bear was treed several miles east in Lake Creek on Trails End Ranch.  Krall gained permission from the landowner and used non lethal bean bag rounds on the bear.  As of 06/19 have not had any more reports of the bear.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: On 07/23/2020 WL 223 (Officer M. Brown) received a call from an anonymous resident within the San Isabel area. The anonymous RP advised Officer Brown that an individual by the name of David was feeding bears with bird seed. Officer M  Brown thanked the individual for the information and informed them that he would travel to their residence to check out the tip. Officer M. Brown traveled to the address and visited with Dave about the issue. Officer M. Brown gave Dave a verbal warning and cautioned him that if he continued to feed the bears he would be cited for feeding and attracting wildlife. Officer M. Brown instructed Dave that he needed to pick up all the bird seed immediately.

No Response Needed
RP called to report a bear that has been seen on her property many times in the past 3 weeks. Each time, the RP and her husband have used pots and pans to create noise to deter the bear. There are no attractants on the property and bird feeders are only outside in the winter. The latest sighting of the bear was last night while the RP and her husband were eating dinner. They heard a noise and looked at their front door and saw the bear through the glass. The RP said it looked like the bear was scratching the door to get in. She and her husband again yelled again to scare the bear away. Each time they have seen the bear it has had the same cinnamon coloring which makes the RP think it is the same bear each time. She is worried that it is becoming less scared of them every time they chase it away.  I recommended the use of bear unwelcome mats and ammonia soaked rags around the property. I offered education materials but she declined them so we went over other hazing techniques and she and her husband have bear spray to use as defense if the bear gets too close. 
RP Called back around 2:15pm to say the bear had returned while she and her husband were outside building unwelcome mats for their doors. The RP's husband had bear spray and sprayed the bear. The RP said it was super windy so the bear may not have been hit with much spray but it was sprayed. The bear ran up a tree and stayed there for about 15 minutes then climbed down and ran off. LB

Nicholson met with RP, inspected home, found no attractants out. RP walked Nicholson through each encounter. Unknown if same bear that entered home in nearby neighborhood, some behavior consistent. Nicholson offered to set pepper barrel, and RP accepted. Nicholson set pepper barrel near back of garage and back deck where bear conflicts have occurred.

Entered by Nicholson on 6/17/2020.

Nicholson removed pepper barrel on 6/28/2020. RP advised something got bait bag on pepper barrel and they have not observed bear since. RP thanked Nicholson for the help. Entered by Nicholson on 6/28/2020.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Hazed , Relocated
Comments:
OFFICER SAFETY CONCERNS - Firearms and signs of hard drug use on property

"Sharon" contacted Jason Clay via social media regarding a facebook post by John Paul Hargan stating a bear had just attempted to go through his screen door to gain access to his kitchen. Jason Clay made WL521 aware. No contact information was in the post. A possible location described as the third switchback on Quartzville Road was listed in a different post. 

WL521 took a trap to the area and began looking for the correct residence. After speaking with several residents in the area, it was determined that the incident had likely occurred at 1223 Quartzville Rd. Officer Petkash contacted John Hargan at the bottom of the driveway as he was leaving. J. Hagran was aggravated that the wildlife officer was present. The officer requested to put a trap on the property and J. Hagran stated the officer would have to talk to his brother. He elaborated, "He's gonna be mad. He's an asshole. He's also bi-polar" WL521 asked J. Hagran to help talk to his brother Patrick Hagran. J. Hagran called P. Hagran on the phone from the driveway. WL521 could hear P. Hagran yelling into the phone from the house up the hill. 

WL521 asked J. Hagran to go to the house with him to speak with P. Hagran. J. Hagran agreed and spoke to his brother through the front door. P. Hagran was yelling at J. Hagran about CPW being notified. WL521 asked P. Hagran to come out on his porch so they could speak. A few minutes later, P. Hagran had begun to calm down. P. Hagran initially refused to allow WL521 to set a trap. P. Hagran stated that he normally fires shots in the air from a firearm to scare the bears away. He stated one time he shot a concrete retaining wall and the concrete fragments scared that bear away. P. Hagran stated his property had been visited by 3 bears; one with 2 ear tags, one with 1 ear tag and one with no ear tags. Eventually P. Hagran gave permission for the trap to be set. WL521 set the trap at the base of the driveway. 

Note: P. Hagran had numerous sores covering both forearms indicative of methamphetamine use. Approximately a dozen Rx pill bottles were observed on a coffee table in the living room while WL521 was standing at the front door.

Comments:
RP stated a bear or multiple bears (different size scat) broke into the other chicken coup on his property and killed the remaining chickens. RP stated unwelcome mats lined the coup except at the gate. WL521 was aware that he, WL525 and WL524 have advised him that electric fencing is necessary on his property. RP stated he hasn't built electric fencing because of the cost. RP was extremely agitated during the conversation. 

RP stated the bear also tore the doors off his barn and ate livestock grain. RP stated the bear also tried to pull a screen off a window under his deck and killed a cat. RP stated that he will shoot the next bear that goes into his coup. WL521 asked the RP if he had any questions about the legal requirements for killing a bear after their last conversation. RP stated he remembered the law. 

WL521 advised WL525 who will decide how to proceed. Entered by Petkash.

Nicholson responded to  RP’s address. Nicholson found door on chicken pen bent open and feathers and chicken parts. RP arrived and showed door to his shed. Door was not tore off. Recent paint was on door and no scratches were present as would have been expected. RP showed Nicholson a broken hinge and said bear broke it. Nicholson is skeptical a bear broke hinge and suspects RP broke hinge on purpose to attempt to get justification for a trap set. RP showed Nicholson a trash bag tipped over and tore open in shed. RP said bears got trash bag and a peanut butter jar,  but did NOT touch any livestock feed/grain. RP said his cat was missing, unknown if was killed by a bear or not. RP did not see bears, but said he believed it was sow with 3 cubs that were at neighbors. 

RP is not a truthful person. He lied about cat being killed by bears, bears tearing door off shed, and bears eating livestock grain. Evidence that bears killed chickens was evident though. Nicholson set a pepper barrel between goat pen and remaining chicken pen with chickens and a turkey. Nicholson advised he was not setting a trap and RP needed to figure out a way to get electric fence, or at least a single hot wire ran around pens. Entered by Nicholson on 8/8/2020.

On 8/28/2020 WL 522 picked up the pepper barrel. Mr Burkit said the bear and 3 cubs was there the night before and broke into the chicken coop that had dead chickens in it still. Burkit said he was going to get electric fencing soon but wanted to say that the government should buy the fencing for him. Entered by Tyler Stoltzfus.

On 8/29/2020 Mr. Burkit called me vary upset about the bear coming back to his house. He said if we don't do something about the bear then he will and we will have four dead bear. Mr. Burkit shouted and cussed over phone for several minutes. He said that he has lost over 60 animals now to bears and that he cannot afford electric fence materials. He said if we don't give him the electric fence he will kill the bears. Entered by Tyler Stoltzfus

Officer Nicholson has conducted background records investigation of this subject, and verified he is restricted from possessing a firearm or other weapon. Any officer who responds to this address should request criminal record query and take appropriate action if Burkitt is found to possess or use weapons. Burkitt has previously told Officer Nicholson he is aware of his restrictions on weapon possession. Entered by Nicholson on 8/30/2020.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments: Calf killed night of 08/18. Calf eaten from the back end forward. Bear scat found around the kill site. RP has seen a large bear hanging out in the area recently. RP interested in filing a game damage claim, and would like to talk to a game warden. Wl329 visited with landowner. Landowner told officer that this was a small calf from a 1st time mother cow. The cow wasn’t overly protective of the calf and it was much smaller than the other calves. Landowner stated that coyotes and bears were in the area. Officer skinned the calf.  No puncture wounds on head, neck or throat. There was blood from the mouth of the calf. One of the ears had ragged edges that looked like it had been chewed upon.  Hind end and some viscera of calf was eaten. Small scratches on hide that did not penetrate through the hide,  were found. A small puncture mark was  found on the hide of the hind quarter where the muscle tissue had been eaten. The carcass was moved about 10 feet, as seen by a drag mark. Vultures had been on the carcass. WL 329 determined that a bear or lion did not kill the calf.  Due to puncture size, location and missing parts from hind end, coyote was determined to be culprit . Lack of puncture wounds around head/neck broken neck, crushed trachea and deep larger (more damaging )scratches ruled out bear and lion.

Bear pushed open and bent screen, entered living room and ran out through kitchen window when rp came upstairs to investigate. RP said bear had gotten into neighbors dog food that had been left out before. Officer Kay investigated damage and set trap at approximately 2000 hours. Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Rehabilitation
Comments:
RP was walking home from work around 1140pm. She turned the corner and saw a bear about 20 feet away.  She saw a cub come out from behind the bear. The bear charged her. She turned and the bear swiped at her once ripping her shirt and scratching her back. She fell to the ground and was able to get up and the bear was gone.  She reported it to Manitou PD at 9:30am on 7/10. The PD called the wildlife office. WL 287 interviewed the RP and collected the clothes she was wearing.  WL 287 then found out a coworker of the RP was walking home at 11:45pm on the same street and had a  sow with two cubs chase her around a truck twice. She was able to get away unharmed.

WL 287, 283,284 all set two traps at the following locations:

GPS coordinates: 38.85856, -104.91951

And  another at 38.85568,-104.91689

APHIS was able to locates the bear with hounds at 530am. She was euthanized and sent to the health lab. 

White 235 is the recorded pit tag number. This is one of the cubs

Unrecorded pit tag belongs to white ear tag cub 323. (Pit tag number 982.000364296201).

Both cubs were sent to Wetmore rehab.

RP called WL551 directly since she had contact info from the previous year where bears were eating grapes from the grape vines that cover a large portion of the house.  Rubber buck was issued last year which the RP still had not deployed.  This year the RP claimed they were being held "hostage" in their house.  RP wanted the bear moved.  After doing a site visit on July 18, 2020, it was determined the bear was coming around approximately once a month, although this was the first call WL551 received this year from the RP.  The sightings were as follows:
April 21, 2020 - Bear broke into outbuilding where cat sleeps and litter is stored. 
May 19, 2020 - Saw on home video bear walking around cars in driveway and around shed.
May 23, 2020 - Kay went on porch and bear was on porch.  Kay yelled and bear ran off, then stopped and looked back.  Bear left the area without aggression,
June 30, 2020 - Bear was on porch, near car, and knocked empty trash can over.
July 12, 2020 - Bear was on porch.
As a note, this property is covered with plum trees, chokecherry, oak brush, as well as the grape vines covering the front of the house.  WL551 explained to the RP that sightings will always occur in this area as a result of the excellent bear habitat.  WL551 explained that sightings in bear country are expected, however, they need to haze the bear to make it uncomfortable around humans and uncomfortable in our immediate space, such as the porch.  WL551 discussed the removal of attractants, including the grapevines.  Kay said she will not be removing the grapevines as it took them many years to grow them. 

Aside from the many natural attractants (and grapevines), the property appears to be fairly clean.  WL551 discussed paintball, airhorns, pots and pans, etc.  The RP's son, grandson, and two neighbors were also there for the in-person meeting.  Neighbor Michele Miller said she would help distribute Bear Aware info to the neighborhood (WL551 emailed her 7/19/20).  The RP's son and grandson were going to look into purchasing a paintball gun.  WL551 offered to haze the bear personally if the RP could pattern the bear based on her home videos and WL551 would wait for them to provide this info.  WL551 is also going to put together a press release for Miller to post on social media for the neighborhood.
07/19/2020 WL551

WL124: Non-target bear entered trap. Bear was 300-350lbs, solid black with tan snout. Bear was released onsite and exposed to one probe of taser (without neuromuscular incapacitation) and two rounds of rubber buckshot.

RP 's horse was found injured on May 19th, 2020 with wounds that look like it was caught in barbed wire fence. RP's daughter, who lives on  the property, saw a black bear with two cubs within that week. RP believes the bear forces the horse into the fence and is in the process of filing a game damage claim for his horse. - KD

WL526 was notified of a roadkill bear at Windy Point. Officer responded.  Trooper that arrived 10 minutes before the WL Officer notified dispatch that the head of the bear had been removed.  Officer took photos and DNA samples from the bear and loaded bear.

Bear got into trashcan on back porch and trash in the back of a pickup.  Performed a site inspection and showed the homeowners how to secure the trash with a ratchet strap.  Asked them to remove the trash in the back of the truck.  Asked them to keep their doors and windows shut and latched etc.

Comments:
No further response as of now.

WL541 received a report from the RP that a large dark brown colored bear with a green ear tag in the left ear was in Tucker Gulch around 7:00pm.  It matched the description of the bear that had been hanging around Tucker Gulch and hitting trash cans within the neighborhood since last week.   
WL545, WL546 and WL541 responded to try to haze the bear.   

The bear was hazed by an member of the public at this address as the bear came out of the dumpster.  It promptly ran off.  The bear was followed around Golden and hazed with noise and lights until it crossed over Highway 58 and was lost in the vegetation surrounding Clear Creek.

Breckenridge PD reported a bear stuck in a dumpster at above address. Tried to get them to open the door on dumpster as a cub was stuck inside.   I fired rubber buckshot at sow to scare her away from the dumpster. Neighbor came over and assisted me in opening the door while I stood with shotgun for cover. Cub exited  dumster and I left dumpster door open and left. No further action required. WL 482

WL124: Report of a bear going through a trash can outside of some hotel rooms. Bear was unable to locate upon arrival.  Trash can was bear resistant but wasn't latched properly.  RP saw a large adult size bear and it ran away when it saw her. Estes PD followed up with Town’s wildlife ordinance.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Educational Materials
Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
RP Rachel Zacharie was camping in site 137 of the Golden Eagle Campground. The RP heard heavy foot steps in the camp site with some huffing around 1:30 in the morning. The RP asked her boyfriend, Aaron Carpenter, if he heard the sound. The bear was heard knocking stuff off of the picnic table that was about 7-10 feet from the tent.  Then the steps got closer to the tent. The bear put its front paws on top of the tent. The tent collapsed on the RP and her boyfriend. Both struggled to get out from under the bear. All parties were startled and the bear retreated a short distance away and was huffing and popping his teeth. The RP’s boyfriend then set the panic alarm off on their vehicle and the bear was not heard from again. The RP and her boyfriend never saw the bear. The RP and her boyfriend left after that.

WL283 inspected the scene the next morning. WL283 met with the Rachel and Aaron. WL283 found that some plates were knocked off the picnic table. The plates were plastic and clean in a mesh bag. There was no food on the table or anywhere in the campsite. There was no food in the tent with Rachel and Aaron. There was a tear in the rain fly of the tent, but the bear never got in the tent and never directly contacted Rachel or Aaron directly. All contact had the tent wall between bear and humans. WL283 found bear tracks in the campsite. The tracks appeared to be made from a smaller bear. WL 283 talked with the staff from the campsite and they stated that there was a smaller brown colored bear that has been seen around the campsite for about 3 weeks. The bear has gotten into trash before at the facility.  I asked if anyone had pictures of the bear and one of the caretakers of the property sent me pictures of the bear (attached above). Rachel and Aaron never saw the bear. WL283 never found any hairs or any evidence that would contain DNA. 

Rachel stated that she had felt a scratch on her head. WL283 did not see any visual wound on Rachel’s head. Rachel stayed that it was possible that she scratched herself when she curled up to protect her head, or it could have been the tent pole, or it could have been the bear. No direct skin to bear contact was made. 

WL283 set a bear trap in the campsite 137. The bear trap will remain in the site for 3 days or until it catches a bear. The target bear would be a smaller bear, probably the brown bear. The bear will be relocated.

The trap was pulled on 5/7/2020. No bear was caught and the bear that was hanging around the campground has not been seen since the incident.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Rehabilitation
Comments:
WL281 received a call around 1:11 AM that a man was attacked by a bear. Dispatch told him that the man had no contact with the bear and he was ok. They also told him that the bear was dead. 
WL 281 called the RP, Richard Gallion, and confirmed that he was ok. He stated he had no contact with the bear, but it had come close to him. He then stated that he killed the bear and a there were two cubs up the tree still. 
Upon further questioning the RP stated that he went outside to see what his dogs were barking at. He saw his dogs near a bear, that was in a tree. He was scared his dogs were going to be attacked so he went to pull them back. As he got closer he felt like his life was in danger and he shot and killed the bear. He stated that the bear came out of the tree and died a short distance from it. 
The sow was investigated by WL281 and WL287. 
Two cubs were darted and transported to a local rehaber.

On 08/04/2020 Wildlife 261 got a message that the RP had called into the office wanting to talk to an officer about a bear incident. Late that same day WL 261 contacted the RP.  The RP stated that on the night of 08/03/2020 sometime in the middle of the night a bear leaned up against the screen of an open window in the kitchen and knocked the screen out.  The bear did not try to enter the house. The RP stated there was a nose smudge on the window and bear scat on the driveway. The RP's did not find the broken screen till the morning.  The RP also mentioned that there were bird feeders near the open window but have since been put away. WL 261 educated the RP on the importance of removing all bear attractants at night. WL 261 performed a site inspection of the property and lent out an unwelcome mat to place under the window for a short time. WL 261 gave the homeowners a copy of the "Unwelcome Mat Construction" flier.

RP is the campground host at Blue Lake.  RP reported that every night for about a week the dumpsters at the day use area, Blue Lake fishing, and the Blue Lake CG have been getting hit by a bear. RP says the latches on several dumpsters no longer work and many of the carabiners are missing.  The dumpster at the day use area doesn't have latches and only has a chain which allows the door to be opened 90 degrees.  Wildlife 225 had tried to wire the doors shut with baling wire, but someone removed it within a day. Wildlife 225 saw a bear, black in color getting into the dumpster at Blue Lake fishing area on the night of 7/5/2020. Wildlife 225 attempted to haze the bear with a rubber slug, but the bear didn't seem fazed by it and walked off into the woods. Wildlife 225 called the Forest Service manager on 7/09/2020 to alert him of the issues and the manager promised to get replacement latches and replace the dumpster at the day use area.  Wildlife 225 placed carabiners on the dumpsters on 7/10/2020.

Younger bear hanging out near horse pasture and irrigation ditch. RP just wanted to let us know, as they are just past the north boundary of town. RP called back moments later to say his neighbor was shooting a gun to scare it

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
8/22/20: Bear damaged 5-8 beehives
8/24/20: Bear damaged additional beehives (4-6 hives) Electric fencing was given to Kris a 20x20 and 40x40 apriary kits, she has a total of 50 hives
Two traps were set on 8/22/20 by WL 186.
WL 186 electric fencing was installed on 8/25. The Bear was able to get into the hives.  On 8/26 around 0500 in the morning.  The bear is a sow with two cubs.

WL186 was checking Cabins in the area for possible bear break-ins.186 came across this cabin, it had a broken window and bear tracks going in and out of the cabin. Unknown on a date and time brake in occurred.

Adult bear was able to open unlocked shed door and get into trash dumpster the night before last. RP locked shed, but bear came back last night and damaged door trying to get in. Bear was not successful in getting trash, though. DWM Gallegos advised to make “unwelcome mat” and place in front of shed doors and make temporary repairs to door. He also suggested using old towel soaked in bleach and put over dumpster to mask smells. He also gave them rubber buckshot to haze the bear.

RP called CPW Office about a bear that "broke into" her vehicle. She told me they recently moved  to the residence and explained that one night it got into a freezer full of food (located outside of the house), on another night it got into the car, and the night before her husband could hear two bears in their yard.

I went to the residence and looked at the vehicle.  When I asked the RP if the window was cracked or left open she told me the windows were rolled up.  When looking at the vehicle most of the glass was outside of the vehicle which made me think the widow was probably cracked  or partly opened .

When I looked inside the car there was a large amount of trash--pop cans, ramen noodle cups etc.  When talking to the RP she told me she even had a crock pot in the vehicle.

Advised the RP to remove all the trash and deep clean the vehicle.  Also advised her to pull the car into their garage and leave it in there until the window can be repaired.  I told the RP I did not feel comfortable setting a trap because so much time has passed.

Went over basic "bear aware" information and told her to call if she had any other issues.

Note-The back portion of the residence has a large amount of gamble oak and is one of the few places with acorns.  I have a lot of bears in this area.
Bear was returning to chicken coop where 32 chickens had been killed over several weeks.

On 10/09/2020 Wildlife 261 received a voice message from the RP stating that he had a possible bear issue that he would like to speak with an officer about. WL 261 contacted the RP and the RP stated that on 10/8/2020 he had left his garage door open while out checking cows and when he returned home he saw a cub or yearling bear run out of his garage. the beer and got into a dog food container as well as a container of apples that the RP left in the garage. The RP also stated that a few weeks back he had two chickens get killed but he thought it was coyotes, but now maybe thought that it could have been the bear. He also stated that 6 weeks prior he had a neighbor call him and tell him that they saw what they thought was a bear dragging off a calf into the woods. The RP was not looking for game damage, just wanted to inform WL 261 of the incidents. WL 261 informed the RP that if he closed his garage door when he leaves the house that should resolve the bear getting into the food within it, and discussed different types of ways to electrify the chicken coop that he has in order to keep all predators out of it including both bears and coyotes. WL 261 also informed him that he is allowed to put down any bear that he sees actively predating on his heard of cows. The RP was very grateful for the advice and said that he would implement  all the advice given to him. WL 261 is also going to get the RP rubber buckshot on a future date when the RP will be at home.

RP called stating bear came to house and got into cat food on 5/23. Bear was then seen again on 5/25 after guests on the ranch used a bbq grill. Cat food was removed after first sighting. CPW met landowner  on 5/28 and did a sight inspection and advised landowner of other food sources on the property. Landowner agreed to remove food sources. CPW also provided a box of rubber slugs for landowner. The landowner was advised to notify local DWM of further incidents.

Called in by neighbor Mack Southam who did not see the bear.  Kerr  described the bear as yearling size. Saw it on the neighbors cut grass lawn at 2:10 pm. It crossed F.5 Road and headed south into a densely vegetated wash. 
CSP called due to the adjacent Thunder Mountain elementary school.  I arrived, coordinated with school resource officer’s LEON and BIRELY, and searched the wash area for the bear. I remained at TME school until students had discharged.  Also spoke with some neighbors, but nobody else  saw the bear.

Report of an injured bear in the area. WL 281 responded and found the bear laying next to a building. WL 281 followed to bear for a while to assesses injury. The bear still has an injured left from paw. It limps and moves pretty well. The bear is not aggressive and runs from people. RP advised bear had been in his dumpster over night,  scattering trash
