Comments: RP said bear came first night and killed chickens. Chickens were protected by chicken wire and other fencing. Next night chickens were secured in a barn. Bear returned and ripped open door and killed two more chickens. Trap set on 7/27. Bear returned early morning 7/28 and entered trap. Bear was euthanized per WL 220 direction and CPW policy.

Bear was spotted near hwy heading towards the town of dolores. WL 321 went to the Kuhlman ranch. To inform them that a bear was heading towards their house. They said that its been hanging around for a few days. WL 321 and WL 327 darted the bear and relocated it

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: Bear got into garage last weekend. Bird seed left out and was not locked up. Last night Bear ripped off screen door and opened sliding door. Wood was left there as wedge since it doesnt close properly but bear was able to get in anyways.  Once RP started yelling and playing music it quickly left. No other damage  RPs phone doesn't always work can leave a text with good contact information.  WO Behncke Spoke with RP and informed her that we are actively seeking to trap a bear in her neighborhood and currently have two traps set.  RP will call WO Behncke directly with any more issues or sightings _SC HSS

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
7/17 WL 527 spoke to RP Samantha the GM for Lawson Adventure Park. She wanted to remain somewhat anonymous about the issues they were having with bears in fear of losing her job. She stated that the owner Greg wanted her to call CPW and inform them that the bears are acting aggressively towards staff and guests so CPW would destroy them. She stated  that Greg also made comments about going on a bear hunt and getting rid of the evidence if CPW didn’t do anything. She stated that Greg also wasn’t willing to pay to get bear proof trash cans and a dumpster. The Guide camp at the west end of the property is also an issue with cooking and food supplies easily accessible to the bears. 527 discussed hazing techniques as well as other deterrents. 527 told the RP that he would do a site visit later in the day to talk to Greg and also set a pepper barrel.

At approximately 16:30 WL 527 arrived at the address to inspect the property.  WL 527 spoke with female staff member who stated that the bear activity was increasing and the newer staff was not as families with bears as others and that the bears have been getting into food at the guide camp. She also stated that the bears are getting more use to the people and not easily scared but also not aggressive. WL 527 then spoke with a partial owner named Alan. 527 covered hazing techniques with Alan (Paintballs, rubberbuck, bear mats) as well as using ammonia to clean the dumpster and trash cans.  Alan stated that they were working on getting bear proof trash cans and a dumpster. 527 told Alan that it was their responsibility to remove all attractants and that if they didn’t they could be sited for attracting bears. 527 told Alan that the guide camp needed to be cleaned up and that all staff as well as guest need to be told to lock their vehicles at all times. 527 told Alan that guests need to be told to lock doors on cabins and yurts and to secure their food when the arrive for their stay. 527 provided Alan with Living With Bears pamphlets and fliers to further educate staff and guests. 527 then set blue pepper barrel #2 near the dumpster.  WALTER

RP called CSP on 7/19 to say that the bear broke into a vehicle and trash again. She said that some of the  staff was talking about hunting the bear for the damage that it caused. She wanted us to know that the owners are not planing to bear proof anything that she knows of.
WL522

WL 527 pulled blue pepper barrel #2 on 8/2. Took it to Mt Evans SWA
Bear sighting at the South Canyon Landfill.  461 responded and determined the bear was still mobile and the decision was made to leave it be for now.

An officer at the prison was approached by the bear at approximately 11:00am.  After multiple attempts to scare the bear off, the bear verbalized several times and then continued to approach.  The officer then pepper sprayed the bear at 5 feet, at which point it ran off.  Myself and Scott Young of USDA Wildlife Services attempted to locate and euthanize the bear by 12:30 PM.  However, bear was not located by 2:30 PM.  Tracking conditions were difficult with 95 degree weather.  We returned at 7:00 PM, still not finding the bear.  Advised prison staff to tell us if they see any tracks or other sign of the bear.  Prison has a compost pile that likely attracted the bear, but with no indication that the bear had been in the area very long as there was no scat anywhere to be seen. On the evening of 7-6, bear got into trash and bird feeders at two houses on G50 Road.  Bear euthanized on 7-7, seal 38634

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior
Comments:
RP reports that he was unloading his truck, and a large bear entered his garage and started to drag away his cooler. RP threw things at the bear and it did not retreat. When the RP tried to haze the bear, it came towards him. RP fired one 9mm round at the ground in front of the bear, at which point the bear walked away. RP reports a neighbor told him that someone in the neighborhood had been feeding bears.

On 10/09/2020 WL544 got a call from Douglas county at 11:45pm. Douglas County informed WL544 that residence had been calling about 7350 Fremont place because they were leaving their garage door open. Douglas county was on their way to contact the home owner about this as residence were concerned their neighbor was attracting bears by leaving his garage door open. WL544 also received an OGT report from a resident in the neighbor hood stating that 7350 Fremont place was leaving garage door open and attracting bears. 

On 10/10/2020 WL544 met the RP to talk about the incident that happened. When WL544 showed up at the residence the RP was not home. WL544 observed a cooler with blood on the top of it in the driveway. WL544 also observed at trash can that was not secure sitting next to the garage. WL544 also observed the leg of a pronghorn laying in the driveway next to the cooler. WL544 met the RP and went through the story of what happened with the bear. WL544 told the RP he needs to be better about securing attractants to make sure he is not drawing bears into his property. The RP stated that the bear was not rewarded the night it came by and had not been back to the property since but had been seen by neighbors. WL544 again told the RP to secure attractants and if the problem persisted after that to let WL544 know. 
END

Comments:
Bear tore into bottom panel of attached garage door and got to trash that was in garage on 07/05/2020. RP fixed garage with plywood and bear came back 07/06/2020 and tore second panel off garage door to get trash again. Garage door again repaired with plywood and  2x4s. Same bears were on property several days prior and got humming bird feeder.
325 set trap on evening of 7/7.
Non target bear captured on 7/10. Adult chocolate colored male Ear tagged with Blue 340 and relocated. App would not save relocation data, pit tag 985170000963581, release location 37.1089, -106.8212.
Trap pulled from property and pepper barrel set

RP’s sister sent text to Nicholson advising bear was eating dog food in back of Dena Barton’s truck and trash was scattered around front door of house. Nicholson has previously warned Barton for leaving trash and dog food out that bears were attracted to and eating. 

Nicholson and Walter responded. Nicholson observed trash and dog food as described. Nicholson observed hummingbird feeder hanging near front door. Nicholson observed observed his warning notice still posted on front of Barton’s home. 

Barton arrived at her home. Nicholson verifies her identity with WV driver license # F552625. Barton denied bears coming to her house for 2 weeks. Barton admitted she put trash outside house and dog food in back of her truck. 

Nicholson issues citation for failure to take remedial action to avoid conflict with bear. Barton said her neighbors “would regret this” and told Nicholson he would probably have to be back 10-11 times (reference to cite her for same violation). 

RP provides email voluntary statement describes bear as cinnamon color, ate in bed of truck for 45 minutes while a shined flashlight on it. 

Entered by Nicholson on 5/30/2020

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
Bob Snell called to report that a bear again broke into the Hilltop Guild building at 18720 Hwy 7.  The Hilltop Guild had a bear break in earlier in the year. The windows were boarded up at that time.  On 8/13, a bear broke in again by breaking through a boarded up window.  Windows were again secured, advise was given about future prevention and a trap was set.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: WL526 received a call from the RP. RP said that a bear broken into his garage through the door and got into his freezer. Garage is attached to the house, but there is no door that leads into the house.  Met with RP, looked at door. Not a very secure door.  WL525 set pepper barrel.

No action required. Info only. RP had bear on security camera video. Bear was walking path behind residence, crossing a small bridge, and going by guest house. RP claimed 500 lb bear. Bear on video was not that large. RP insisted that bear coming close to house was an aggressive bear and was demanding removal. RP concerned about grandchildren. Tried to explain hazing options to keep bear away from house. RP was not inclined to do any mitigation, claimed bear was aggressive and wanted removal. RP claimed electric fence or unwelcome mat would electrocute grandchildren. RP claimed neighbors wanted bear removed. RP claimed son's wife had encounter with bear. When son yelled at bear, bear ran away.  RP wanted refusal to remove bear in writing, claimed all liability would be with me.  RP stated that Utes would have killed bear, stated that in the frontier days the bear would have shot. Threatened to kill bear if not removed. Talked to neighbors indicated by RP. Closest neighbor had seen bear, but bear was just walking through, not causing issues. Second neighbor had seen bear in yard early in morning two weeks ago when putting dog out. Large bear that did not move off rapidly. Second neighbor has not seen bear since and was willing to get air horn and pepper spray.  Upon return to address, talked with son about using ammonia soaked rags along trail to deter bear.
Bear found dead in ditch. Did not see it yesterday. RP heard gun shot night prior. 326 picked up bear at 1100 hours. Skinned bear, no gunshot wounds. Bear in very poor body condition.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Pyrotechnics
Comments: Bear was in a storm drain and then neighborhood came out to see it and take photos. When I arrived a crowd of close to 50 people were standing around outside as close as 30 yards from the bear in the drain. Because if the crowd the bear stayed in the drain. When I arrived I told everyone ego go home and stay in their house. CSPD arrived a short time later and within. 5 minutes the Bear came out and I was able to get one round of rubber buckshot off and onto its rear. The bear ran through the neighborhood followed by myself and three CSPD Officers. The bear ran out of the neighborhood into the open field between Cresta, Hwy 24, and the neighborhood. Bear was hazed well and it never stopped after being hazed or chased.

W328  Received call from CSP about a female bear hit on highway 84 between 8 mile Mesa and Echo Lake. Allegedly a cub belonging to the dead bear in the vicinity.  W328 unable to łocate dead bear or cub. W328 left message with RP.

I also picked up a dead deer that was approximately 500 yards from their residence.  The bear was seen in the same area where the dead deer was located.

Told them to call my cell phone if they have any other issues.

Comments:
The homeowner, Marvin Robinowitz went out the back door at approximately 0745 hours on 10/22/20 to let his dog out.  At that time a "large, brown bear" ran at him and swiped him with her paw, hitting him in his right arm, causing several cuts.  Robinowitz separated himself from the bear and then she charged a second time but did not make contact with him.  Robinowitz was able to safely get himself and his dog inside the house then had his wife drive him to the hospital where he received a couple stiches and was released.  The bear was found in the tree outside Robinowitz's back door with two cubs.  The sow was euthanized and the two cubs were relocated to a rehab center.
For more detailed report, see "Bear Attack Edwards_Wodrich ROI".

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting
Comments: RP stated bear has been coming to house every night for the past three nights. Bear was climbing over fence and got scared. It ran through the fence door and broke it off the hinges. There are claw marks on the siding. Two nights ago it got into chicken coop and ate two chickens. Coop is secured with a lock and it ripped open the wooden door and got to chickens inside. Moved chickens to  a different location on the property which appeared to be more secure but bear came back the next night 9/9 and broke off more wood to the empty chicken coop. In the past month or so it has come to eat the chicken feed but not the chickens so RP stated they started to take the food out at night. Appears to be a large brown bear. - SC HSS

RP, Steve Curry, called CSP to report a sow and 2 cubs breaking into cars on 8/16/2020. The on-call Officer, Rocksund (542) called the RP back. Steve was worried that the 3 bears had no fear of humans and that they where out in the middle of the day. Steve told Rocksund that the neighbor had been feeding bears carrots and sugar. Rocksund asked if Steve had reported this to CPW before and he said no, it was just common knowledge that he neighborhood knew. 
Rocksund asked Steve if they have ever had issues with bears and Steve told Rocksund that last week,  Wednesday August 12th at 10AM, his wife was chased inside by the sow and the bear ran up the porch until wife slammed door.  Steve told Rocksund that his 6year old was playing outside near the driveway and had left the garage open while outside. The sow and cubs investigated the garage a few minutes after the child went inside. Steve's wife let the dog out no knowing the bears where outside and dog barked at bears. Sow chase the dog back onto the porch with the wife standing in the door. Sow slipped on the concrete and slid across porch, unable to go through door. Wife slammed the door when sow was approximately 6' away and bear went away. 
Rocksund asked Steve to report all incident of bear activity, especially when bears are being fed. Steve said he was going to report it because the bears have become no afraid of people, but saw numerous CPW trucks where the feeder lived on Friday August 14th and thought it was taken care of. It was on August 16th that Steve witness the sow and cubs going through vehicles with no fear of humans that he wanted to report the bear's activity. 
Rocksund talked to Steve on the phone and told him to remove all attractants and keep the garage door closed; even leaving it open for a few minutes could allow these bears access. Rocksund talked to a few residence and Steve about reporting all bear activity to CPW. Rocksund told them, the community, that it was on them to eliminate all attractant and haze these bears to save the bear's lives. Rocksund reinforced them that CPW does not want to kill a bear, but would be forced to if the community cannot come together and remove attractants and shut their garage doors. 
Rocksund thanked Steve and the passerby neighbors for their time and willingness to prevent future bear conflict and keeping CPW in mind when conflict does arise.

Bob was doing fire checks in the evacuation zone of the  Cameron Peak Fire.  At  the Felker residence he noticed the double doors of a detached Garage  open.  When he looked closer he noticed garbage and food containers scattered on the floor. the small fridge raider Inside the building had its  door open with food missing and food laying on the floor. A bear had pushed open the doors and had eaten food from the fridge.  The garage had been converted into a bunk house.  No  one was present at the time of brake in.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: Bears have been getting into trash dumpster every night. Met with manager and due to the expense of bear proof trash containers (provider would make them pay year round for it instead of just the season), electric fencing would be the better route. DWM Gallegos also provided specs from CPW, and will drop brochures off for handouts for their visitors.

Spoke to Aaron, gave him a verbal warning for trash as an attractants for bears, told him that if bears got into his trash again I would be issuing him a ticket.  He said his was not the only trash that bears were getting into.

Futher Reponse Necessary. 
Contacted WLO126 and forwarded email.
Received an email from the ASKCPW about a bear that has been eating RP's chickens. 
Email is as followed: "We have lived with many bears quite successfully for a long time, but this past fall a young bear discovered our chicken coop. We lost 2 of our 12 to the bear then, and now the bear is back. We lost 2 more last Saturday and 2 more this morning. No amount of reinforcing or electrifying seems to make a difference (had a 10,000 volt, three-tiered Electric Fence that the bear went straight through this morning). We tried reducing the amount of coverage (junipers/dense tree-stands) on the hillside behind the coop as well (also as mitigation for the upcoming fire season), but the bear is still coming down the same path and getting in the run at the same spot. Our hens have supplied eggs to many high-risk mountain neighbors during these COVID-19 times and we can no longer assist them as a direct result of this bear. We have always loved bears, but this one is now posing a significant risk to our own food/assets and we cannot continue in this manner. We have applied for a hunting license this fall, but would really appreciate any advice you have in the meantime. Thank you."
-M. Gallegos_NERO

Comments:
RP stated 2 bears came into their site, brushed against the tent the boys were in and scratched up their truck.

Kyle at the Vega Visitor's Center also provided Blanck with this information by email.  The email indicated the bear incident occurred the day before, and was not reported to Vlthe camp host until the evening of 7-19.  The camp host did not report it to the visitor center until approximately noon on 7-20.

After receiving the email,  Blanck left a voice message for Ranger Sprys asking about bear activities in the area. Sprys was on leave and did not return the call imediatley. Sprys later indicated he would keep Blanck informed. 

On 07-22-2020, DWM Blanck visited the location and spoke to campers amd staff at the nearby Vega Lodge.  None had observed any bear activity. The campers had not been spoken to by any park staff about increased bear activity in the area specifically. 

This appears to be an isolated incident, but worthy of extra vigilance in that area in the future.

Another resident, Paula Diehl, said another resident had the bear crawl up on their second story deck and was completely unafraid of people. This is believed to be the same bear from a week earlier that was hanging around the Pinehaven area.  Trap was set on 7/10/2020 in the evening. Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
RP called stating that this morning around 12:30am a bear with 2 cubs tore the side of the their chicken coop off and killed 3 chickens. She also stated that they have had chickens for 4 years and never had a problem.  They do not have birdfeeder, or trash out side. I advise that they need to put up electirc fenceing around coop, bear unwelcome mat around coop, to have bear pepper spray on hand as well as airhorns to haze the bear off. Husband in the back ground asked if he can shoot the bear. I replied to protect livestock or human life yes. Rp (wife) wants to speak to Officer to have trap set so this does not happen. Officer 525 was called. J.Campbell NERO

Nicholson called RP and was put in contact with her husband, Russell McCurdy. He wanted to know the law regarding protection of livestock (chickens) from depredating bears. He said a sow with 2 cubs were at his coop last night, the 2 cubs crawled over fence into pen and killed 3 chickens. He advised when he let dog out, the sow immediately ran off and the cubs were still in pen. He wanted to know if he could shoot the bears. Nicholson explained livestock exemption that allowed Russell McCurdy to shoot bears if necessary to prevent them from harming or killing livestock. Nicholson offered to meet with him and set pepper barrel. He said he would take the pepper barrel, but if bears came back he would shoot them, emphasizing he would shoot the cubs ideally since they caused the damage and the sow just watched. 

Nicholson arrived at property and met with Russell McCurdy. Nicholson walked around pen and observed scratch marks and bent wire where cubs crawled in pen. Nicholson observed scattered feathers and remains from at least 3 chickens. Nicholson set a pepper barrel and issued 3 rounds rubber buckshot to Russell McCurdy. Nicholson advised if the bears were in the chicken pen he could shoot them, but not if they were walking around the property outside the pen. Nicholson encouraged him to let the pepper barrel work and use the rubber buckshot to haze the bears. Nicholson told him to put an electric fence around pen or add hot wire to top. Russell McCurdy said he would add a hot wire. 

Russell McCurdy wanted to discuss the law allowing a person to shoot a bear in defense of people. McCurdy said the sow was on his second story deck another night. Nicholson observed two hummingbird feeders hanging from roof by deck. Nicholson advised McCurdy was required to remove all attractants after a conflict with bear, including bird feeders, trash, pet food, compost. Nicholson advised it was lawful to shoot a bear if necessary to prevent threat of injury to a person. Nicholson explained it must be abundantly clear that shooting the bear was the only option to stop the threat. Russell McCurdy advised he studied law and he would make sure his statement supported his actions (indicated that regardless of circumstances he would give a statement that justified his actions). 

In general, Russell McCurdy was argumentative and disagreeable, while making it clear he planned to kill the two bear cubs to protect his chickens. McCurdy said “any dead bears will be in the pen.” Nicholson provided his business card and instructed McCurdy to call CSP dispatch immediately to report if he shot a bear in defense of his livestock or persons. Nicholson observed McCurdy wearing a handgun and with an M14 style rifle sitting by back door. Entered by Nicholson on 8/4/2020

RP’s neighbor, Bob Burkitt, called to report a sow with three cubs that visited chicken coup. Nicholson responded and met with Trina. She observed a bear cub approach pen, pull bait bag on pepper barrel, get sprayed and then flee. All three cubs fled from area near pen and ran down draw below property with sow. Bears climbed a tree. Nicholson looked for bears and saw a cub jump out of tree and flee.  Nicholson left pepper barrel set and advised to put a hot wire on fencing around pen. Entered by Nicholson on 8/8/2020.

Pepper barrel as removed by Officer Stoltzfus on 8/28/2020. Entered by Nicholson on 8/29/2020.

On 8/8/20 at 6:30 am, 181 received a call from CSP regarding a party named Jill who reported a bear in the trap that 187 set at Glen Echo resort back on 8/6/20.  181 and 182 responded to Glen Echo resort and arrived at 9:30 and spoke with Jill who ultimately said that she wasn’t sure if this was the same bear that had entered her camper 2 night’s ago.  The officers loaded the trap / bear and drove to the Poudre River Hatchery and tranquilized the bear.  The officers placed ear tags (#649) on the adult male bear that was all black in color and estimated to be 3+ years old and weighed about 200 - 250 lbs.  Once reversal meds were administered and the bear recovered, the officers drove it to the Old Roach area west of Hohnholz Lake #3 (Northwestern Larimer County and released it at approximately 1:45 pm.  Upon release, the officers successfully applied Beanbag negative reinforcements.

Comments: R/P contacted CO State Patrol dispatch and advised that one of her goats had been attacked by what she believed to be a Mtn. Lion. On Call Wildlife Officer J. Krall passed the call onto Wildlife Officer M.Brown. Officer Brown contacted CPW's contract houndsmen (John Evert) to CV one and run the lion. Officer Brown and Evert determined that the depredating animal was a bear and not a lion. Officer Brown and Evert made an attempt to run the bear until the dogs began losing scent during the mid-day heat. Officer Brown photographed the goat carcass before burying it with leaves, grass, and twigs. Officer Brown and Evert then set a live action game camera on the carcass before returning later in the evening to run the bear again. Officer Brown and Evert ran two separate bears that originated from the kill sight. Officer Brown dispatched both bears once they were treed.
Bear Killed 3 lambs

RP told me they smoked some meat and a bear came that night, tipped over the smoker and ate the grease.  Told them to clean the smoker as best they can as they do not have a garage or storage facility to store the smoker.  Gave M-80's now that we are out of a fire ban.
Residence leave trash out where bears can actively get in. A bear got into their trash in the 20th.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
Large, black colored bear came down to shore of Bear Lake to eat dead fish. Didn't approach people or display aggressive behavior.  Bear seemed unconcerned and unafraid of people. Sighting reported to Bear Lake Campground hosts, who reported it to WL 225.
Bear returned a couple nights later on 6/26/2020 and got unsecured food in back of pickup truck and returned to the area several times during the night. Trap was set on 6/27/2020. Bear returned on 6/27/2020 and ripped open an unoccupied tent to get at essential oils left in tent.
Bear returned on night of 6/28/2020 and knocked over large metal dumpster. Also approached campers in site 14 and was unafraid of people.
Caught in trap on 6/28/2020 and was euthanized per CPW policy and WL 220 direction.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: A small black bear has broken into the house several times.  There were fresh bear tracks in the snow which confirmed the bears recent visit.  Homeowner Dorothy said that the bear had gotten into her house several times, getting into the fridge and a bbq that was inside.  Advise given and trap set.

A bear walked up onto the homeowners deck and seemed to be looking for a handout of food. The homeowner has lived in the area for 30 years and said the bear was concerning and very habituated to people.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials
Comments: Bear tried to get into house

Bear come on deck overnight, destroyed grill, several paint and stain cans, paint thinner. "swatted" furniture  on deck around. RP was concerned about it coming back. CB will do site inspection. Warn neighbors of bear activity.

Green ear tagged bear walked on to the Porch of the Mayer’s house.  The bear also walked into their detached garage through an open garage door, but did not cause any damage or get a reward.  The bear has not returned.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear break in @ guest house on Sat 10/17 and Sun 10/18. Bear pushed in broken sliding door on Saturday and got food reward from kitchen. Sliding door was fixed. Bear returned and broke out a window the following night. No description of bear provided. Call routed from Pitkin Co Animal Control. Trap set 10/19

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
RP called CSP to advise a bear broke into his chicken run/pen last night and killed several chickens. RP advised bear is in area, unknown if same bear that killed chickens. Nicholson attempted to call RP, left voice message requesting call back. Entered by Nicholson on 8/10/2020.

Nicholson and Walter responded and met with RP. Dispatcher was mistaken, Bear was not still present. RP advised 10-12 chickens were killed by Bear previous night. Nicholson inspected pen, observed where bear peeled wire roof open (wire was staples to 2”x4” frame for roof). Nicholson recommended electric fence as permanent solution and explained how to reinforce roof. RP described prior Bear encounters on property for past few years (no prior depredation though). RP said they had electric fence last year, but changed their pen setup for this year and did not use electric fence.

Nicholson provides CPW brochures describing how to build electric fence for hobby livestock. Nicholson and Walter recommended bear unwelcome mat and paintball gun. RP said they would try. Nicholson advised RP should call back if they have additional problems. RP did not request game damage claim. Entered by Nicholson on 8/10/2020.

Jake called WL 523 to inform him that a bear had been seen in the area and has apparently gotten into the neighbors open garage and gotten into the trash.  Now the bear was seen at his house and he wanted to ensure that the bear was not rewarded on his property as well.  

WL 523 set a pepper barrel at the home.  

Jake stated that is neighborhood had finally closed the garage door for the first time that he had ever know of, but the bear (or possibly a sow and cubs as another neighbor had suggested) had already been rewarded, so it would likely return.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear knocked his hive over but did not get inside or cause much damage. Bear also got inside their chicken chop and caused structural damage but did not successfully kill any chickens.
RP reported a mature black colored bear got into trash left by renters.  RP said he ordered a bear proof trash container.  Gave rubber slugs to him and two of his neighbors.

Received call of bear trapped in wooden enclosure around dumpster. Bear was agitated and couldn’t get out. SO said wooden gate was not locked but they had other calls and had to leave. When driving to site, dispatch called to say bear had gotten out. Inspected site 2 days later and found multiple dumpsters, with wooden enclosures not capable of keeping wildlife out. No obvious open dumpsters or accessible trash

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: In the evening on 07/02 a small dark colored bear opened an unlocked door into an entryway at 25 Chatham. The door closed behind the bear and it could not get out while the occupants of the house were on the other side of a second door. Trap was set on 07/03 and the bear was caught on 07/05 and relocated to the NSV. RP had discussed bear issues with 122 a couple days prior. RP told 126 that the bear causing most of the issues was a large black in color bear with green ear tags.  RP told 126 that there were several break ins in Ward by this bear.  Trap was reset at the same location.  Relocated subadult now has Green Ear Tags #496.

Sow and cub were in RP's backyard again.  RP sprayed sow with bear spray and both bears climbed his tree until approximately 4:00am.  RP reports they have been seen in the neighborhood over the past two months with sightings occurring approximately 3 times a week as bears are getting into trash around the neighborhood.  RP has his trash secured in outside shed  but was told to put out nail boards or in the garage if the bears begin to try to break in to the shed.  I told several neighbors to secure their trash  and they agreed.
Bear in tool bin as pack rat nest with dog food stash in tool bin. Knocked over marijuana plant and broke (prescription).

Home owner text WL 523 and informed him that a bear had been to her home the past night and then returned this morning and stuck its head in the window.  The bear had gotten into baby formula and she was afraid that the bear would return and she stared that he's had three small children.

WL 523 set a pepper barrel at the property and informed the homeowner of the steps that she could take to help reduce further issues.

Pepper barrel was removed on the morning of June 13th by WLO523.

On 08/03/2020 Wildlife 261 got a call that someone had called into CSP stating that there has been a bear visiting the Iron City Campground every couple night. WL 261 contacted the RP who stated that she was the camp host at a different but near by campground as was checking on the Iron City Campground every once in a while because they did not have a full time camp host for Iron City. She stated that on 07/30/2020 campers had reported seeing a large bear with ear tags (unknown color) walking threw the campground. the campers stated that the bear was not aggressive but was not bothered by humans making noise or yelling at it. The RP did not know what time the bear was seen or how often it had come back to the campground but stated that multiple campers had seen the bear.  The RP also did not know how many times the bear had gotten into campers trash at the campground but stated that there were bear boxes at the campground. The RP also stated that a new camp host would be at the campground full time starting 08/03/2020. WL 261 stated that he would mark the campground with a bear in the area sign, educated the new camp host about the bear activity, educate current campers and haze the bear if possible.  The RP stated that she had thought CPW had been informed about the incident before this, and was sorry she didn't call sooner. 

WL 261 put a bear in the area sign up in front of campground, and talked with camp host and campers. After talking to campers who were in the campground when the bear came through, they stated that the bear tried to get into the bear boxes that the campground provides to campers and was unsuccessful at getting any food and then found a cooler in an unattended campsite and got into that.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments: Large bear tried to walk into kitchen but only got 2 feet through door before RP scared it out. Bear then stood outside growling and stomping its feet. RP shot into hill to scare off bear. Bear came back later and tore open bearproof dumpster. Bear bent lids and broke carabiners. 326 set trap on road easement behind The Nugget on July 22 at 1630 hours. Kevin Wright (720) 630-1956 is property owner of the Nugget. Hugh is manager of the Backcountry Gourmet food truck where incident occurred. Bear in trap next morning and matched Hugh’s description. Bear euthanized. A pit tag was detected and the torn right ear indicates it had a black research ear tag. No remains of the tag were left. Bear skinned for auction and carcass saved for future game processing seminar.

RP reported a bear with 2 cubs broke into a shop building on the property on 08/19.  RP also reported the bears made entry into son's house nearby that same day, where they got into a fridge.
RP calls back late on night of 08/19, reporting all 3 bears made entry through a screen door of his residence at 11 pm. RP shot and killed the sow with a shotgun while it was inside the residence, near the point of entry.
Officers arrived on scene at 1 am on 8/20. They located 2 cubs in the top of a tree nearby and the dead sow outside near the residences doorway.
Officers placed deceased  bear into a live trap in hopes that the cubs would go in. 
Later that morning, RP calls McArdle stating that the cubs were on his back porch pre dawn but did not go into the trap. 
McArdle arrived back on scene later that morning and set a second live trap. McArdle did not see the cubs at that time.
Later that evening, the 2 bear cubs were live trapped. The cubs were transported to the Frisco Creek rehab facility.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
Rp called and stated that a bear tried to get into a shed where dog food was stored and was concerned that the bear would get into the kennels with top bloodline dogs.  WL 265 responded to the house on 7/3/2020 at 21:00 and spoke to the RP's daughter and the owner of the dogs.  She showed officer Holder the shed that the RP claimed the bear was trying to get into.  The door did have mark's on it but they did not appear to be scratch Mark's.  I could not see definite claw Mark's in the door that would indicate a bear was trying to get in.  The dogs the RP was worried about were very large and heavily muscled pit bulls.  These dogs were aggressive and did not appear to be afraid of anything.  The RP said the bear she saw in the trash the previous day was a small bear.  She showed me a picture and the bear is a yearling.  I would find it highly unlikely that bear would do anything in that backyard based on the size and aggressiveness of the pitbulls in the kennels.  That little bear would want nothing to do with those dogs. 
 They would almost certainly kill a bear of that size.  I gave the dog owner a Living with Bears pamphlet for further recommendations on how to minimize conflicts with bears.   I explained to her how to secure her trash with a ratchet strap and asked her to call if she had anymore problems .
Ewe killed and fed on by bear

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Sow and cub walked through pasture and Wallers called as spooked cattle. However, when arrived to set live trap (before they were destroyed!) there were no cows in pasture. When asked where they were, Gary Waller said they were in the corral but afraid bears would frighten them and hurt themselves in corral (?!). Also, extreme high dollar cows in separate pen to be shown in Kansas City.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments: USFS technician Kevin contacted DWM Mike Brown regarding a bear that broke into USFS cabin #1. DWM Brown set a bear trap and successfully captured the bear on 07/25/20. The bear was euthanized after being tranquilized with 1.75 cc's of Nal-Med.

Kathy's neighbor called to report that Kathy was startled by a bear cub while walking her dog. Same description as cub seen at Bluebell shelter on 7/29. No other bears seen in area. 128 was UTL on cub, but saw no signs of other bears.

WL124: Homeowner called Estes PD to report somebody trying to break into their garage. WL124 and a PD Officer arrived on seen and saw a large bear dark in color run away. The homeowner was advised to take down their hummingbird feeders.

2nd home owner.  Black bear broke into their house and got into the kitchen and fridge about a week ago.  They did not call us to report it.  They just cleaned everything up.  Bear broke into house again but came through a window this time.  WL 483 will plan to set a trap once he can obtain further information from home owner.  KH - HSS

WL483 responded to address inspected damage and talked to RP who was in Denver for the week.  Late report, Bear 1st broke in over a month ago the sometime in a week and 1/2 ago prior to call.  Trap set in the area no place to put a trap at RP location. -JH

CSP called DWM Gallegos and advised that RP had seen a sow with 3 cubs and it was currently at the RP's house getting into the smoker.  DWM Gallegos responded, but the bears had left.  While DWM Gallegos was there inspecting the smoker, the bears returned and started getting into the BBQ grill.  DWM Gallegos hazed the sow with two rubber slugs.  The smoker had a metal pail under that was full of grease.  The BBQ grill had not been cleaned in some time and they had 3 hummingbird feeders on the deck.  DWM Gallegos warned them that these items needed to be cleaned up or removed in order to keep from having conflicts with bears.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Rp called and ssid they had a bear inside their chicken coup.  Coup was electrofied but at a low volt. Bear killed all the chickens.  Trap set. Spoke with rp about upgraded electric fence  and upgrades for the coup.  Rp had video of medium sized black colored bear in the coup.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments: Rp texted 127 on 7/25 to report that a bear had again broken into a cabin at the Boulder Watershed work station. Break in occurred overnight, bear went through pantry window, one over from the boarded up window from last week's break in. Rp cleaned up area and locked all doors. Trap set. RP called at dark to say bear broke in again, then went into trap. Bear and trap removed, eithanized. Male, chocolate in color, estimated weight 320 lbs. Seal # 41102

Rp reported unsecured trash at 422 Fairview that had been broken into by bear. Officer kay and Davies has spoken to this residence about same issue 10/19. On arrival today, trash picked up and secured. Officer Kay spoke w Brandon who was out of town but had text string from roommates and trash company. Apparently Timberline missed pickup and sent text to customers. Roommates text thread talked about missed pickup, broken into trash, and getting a bear resistant can. Brandon said they typically put out trash night before. Brandon said the officers likely spoke with roommate named Johnny last year when same trash issue. Officer Kay explained importantance of bear resistant can, putting trash out morning of and potentially changing trash companies. Officer Kay also explained that trash company being late is not an excuse, and that next time will be a citation. Brandon texted roommates and will get a bear resistant trash can and put out morning of pick up. Conversation was recorded.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
WL 284 called to ask if bear aware volunteers could assist WPPD with a bear in an unoccupied, house being built in the Stoneridge subdivision.  When BA  arrived WPPD Officer Mike had already cleared the house and the bear(s) were gone.  The bears were reported to have moved SW along the green belt.  The sow and cubs appear to move off when hazed but stroll through the neighborhood when not confronted.

A construction dumpster in front of the house has non-construction trash in it and about half full is the attractant.  Per Terri Collins the bears have been frequenting the dumpster attracting a crowd wanting to see the bears and take pictures.  

We spoke to several residents in the area.  They confirmed the bears are frequenting the dumpster regularly. 

Terry Collins said she was going to contact the general contractor so they can request that they don't throw non-construction trash into it.  I asked the neighbor across the street, at 1314, to call if the bears showed up again.  

Drove around the subdivision and spoke to anyone with garage doors open.  Also drove around the Northwood subdivision.


Recommendation:
Speak to the construction crew about having the dumpster dumped as it is an attractant.
Canvass the subdivision to education about being bear aware
RP thought a bear on his property may have been hurt by the East Canyon Fire. 327 watched bear and noted it appeared to be fine with no signs of distress.

RP had bear break into shed to get trash in previous incident. In early morning 7/7, bear broke heavy locked  wood door and took trash bags. RP will repair door, 325 issued unwelcome mat to place in front of door and recommended ammonia soaked rags or steel drum with locking lid. RP has since got a steel drum and has not had any more issues. Unwelcome mat retrieved on 8/2.

Small bear has been getting into trash dumpster every night. RP has talked to trash service, but was told they cannot switch to metal lids. RP was asking for advice on how to keep bears out of the trash. DWM Gallegos suggested electric fencing.
Killed in domestic sheep

RP saw the bear on the side of her chicken coop.  Recommended electric fence around coop and nail boards.  Gave her a Living with Bears pamphlet for further recommendations on how to avoid conflicts.  Gave them 5 rds of rubber shot since the bear is seen regularly due to heavy woods behind their house.  Good area to haze the bear with a safe backstop.

Wildlife 261 received a call from Chaffee County Dispatch stating that the RP had a bear break into her house while the house was unoccupied, there was very little damage, and the RP did not need a response from a Wildlife Officer that night. Wildlife 261 contacted the RP and the RP stated that she had left her house around 10:30 AM that morning and left a window to the house cracked about 2-3 inches. When she returned at 8:30 PM she noticed that the screen to the window was ripped (see image above) and the window was now open about 10-12 inches.  The RP waited till her family arrived to enter the house where she found a picture had fallen off the wall, a closet door was open where they kept dog food, and a bowl of honey was sitting outside the house. The bear had eaten both the dog food and some of the honey. The rest of the honey was poured on the ground outside the home. The RP also stated that she felt safe and did not want a response from CPW that night. Wildlife 261 informed the RP to put away all attractants and to keep the windows and doors locked that night because there was a good chance the bear would be back to finish the honey. The RP stated that she understood. Wildlife 261 then told the RP that he would be setting a trap the next day to try and catch and the bear and because the bear had broken into a dwelling the bear would have to be euthanized. The RP understood and agreed to meet with Wildlife 261 on 07/15/2020 so that Wildlife 261 could set a trap. 

On 07/15/2020 Wildlife 261 received both a call and a text from the RP stating that she wanted to refuse the trap offered by Wildlife 261. She stated she did not want the trap set on her property because she felt she could leave the windows shut and did not want the bear euthanized because it was hungry and she had left the window open.  She also informed Wildlife 261 that the bear had returned that night and ate the rest of the honey, but had not tried to get in the house. Wildlife 261 stated that he highly recommended that the trap still be set because of the potential human safety issues. The RP still refused the trap. Wildlife 261 and the RP were then able to set a time so that Wildlife 261 could perform a site inspection on the property on 07/17/2020. Wildlife 261 informed Wildlife 260 of the conversation with the RP.

On 07/17/2020 Wildlife 261 and the RP met at the RP's residence for a site inspection. The RP informed Wildlife 261 that earlier on the day of the incident she had been warming honey on the stove and had all the windows open on the house, and she felt she attracted the bear to the property that way. She showed Wildlife 261 where the bear had entered and where the different food items in the house were located. Wildlife 261 then looked around the exterior of the house and pointed out any attractants he saw and make the RP aware of them. He then educated the RP again on removing attractants and let her know that the bear may come back. The RP said she had not seen the bear since and had not seen any sign of the bear on her long walks that she takes around the property. She stated that she spoke to a retired CPW staff member who also gave her the same advise Wildlife 261 had given her, but she still didn't want the bear euthanized and therefore did not want the trap.

Comments: Bear broke door off chicken coop killing 3 chickens.  RP heard dogs barking and went outside towards coop.  Saw bear in flashlight, bear came towards him stopping about 30 feet away.  RP returned to house to get gun, and let dogs out.  Dogs appeared to run bear off.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Pyrotechnics
Comments: small bear continues to get into a dumpster. Show no fear of the hkme owner, and will not leave the property, despite several hazing attempts.  Blanck will provide a peper sprayer.

WL 288:

I received a call from Clinton (719-396-4603) who stated that his sister is having an issue with a bear hanging around her house. She was hesitant to call because she did not want the bear euthanized. He stated that her neighbor was feeding the bear and that was the reason why the bear was hanging in the area.  I told Clinton that I would need his sister to call so that I can get specific information. 

Coleen called shortly after. She stated the following:

- The neighbors next door have been feeding the bear raw chicken
- That the bear will hang out on her back porch
- That the neighbors are very protective of the bear
- That the bear took a bag of trash out of the hands of the neighbor
- That she hasn't seen the feeding, but her other neighbor has
- That the apartment complex across the street is not being responsible with their trash

I told Coleen that I would do a site visit later today to assess the situation, figure out where to put a trap, collect any witness statements, and give a written warning to the neighbors who are feeding the bear.  I contacted WL283 for assistance.

at approximately 1330 hours, WL 283 and I went to the RP address. We talked with the RP. The RP then stated that she had not seen the neighbors feed the bear but heard it from one of the other tenants that live in the triplex.  We visited the other two tenants. They said that they had not visually seen the neighbors feeding the bears but overhead them talking about it. They also said that they had talked with the neighbors and the neighbors said not to call CPW on them.  I asked both individuals if they could write up voluntary statements and that I would visit with the neighbor. 

I talked with the neighbor and explained the issue at had. Both her and her husband were upset. They explained that they like seeing the bears but they would never feed them. They told us that they try to be as clean as possible and even store their trashcan in their garage. I explained that there were multiple complaints about the feeding and that they would be receiving a warning. They did not agree with it but understood where we were coming from. They said that two of the tenants (amber and her son) had left trash out on the street for a week and the bear kept getting into it every night. They sent pictures to back up their claims. WL 283 and I went back over and talked with the landlord. He confirmed that the trash had been ripped open by the bear that he had gotten several call from other neighbors. We made contact with Amber and gave her a written warning as well. Amber was physically and verbally upset. She claimed the other next door neighbor was feeding bears as well. We went and talked with that neighbor and he showed us that he has bolts in his trashcan to prevent the bear from getting into it. He told us that they had only been there a week and that he has lived in the area for 12 years and has never had a problem. 

I have made it clear to ALL parties that the trash needed to be cleaned up and stored properly. If there are any issues of trash or feeding, they need to have pictures or video in order to write a citation.

Dilley contacted RP and next door neighbor. The neighbor was in his back yard when he heard a huffin noise from under Unit 21 deck.  He walked over and looked under deck and there was a large bear. The bear was huffing and moaning. The neighbor told RP and RP reported it to Routt County SO.   Dilley contacted RP and neighbor along with Steamboat PD officer at location. Dilley approached deck and bear began huffing. The bear was an adult, black in color. It was not aggressive and would go silent when not approached. There were no kids at either residence. Dilley asked the men to stay away from area and let them know bear would move on when it got dark. Men were fine with that. Dilley placed a caution bear in are sign in front of parking ate at unit 21. Dilley returned just before dark and bear was still there. The homeless man told the RP that one of the bears he feeds was in the trap and the other may be it's sibling as it's the same size but brown. The man was gone when 325 arrived an hour later. RP just requested some rubber slugs, which were issued.  Krall recommended protecting chickens with electric fencing.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Hazed , Educational Materials
Comments:
