Bear got into chicken coop in town.  Rp did not want the bear trapped.  Rp put electric fence around the coop.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Cub entered home, mom outside.  Trap pulled 5/1

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
Officer Callback Requested
RP called to report that his pheasant enclosure had been broken into and about 40 pheasants had been killed. The RP says he is sure it is a bear since he has seen them in the area before but he did not see or hear anything last night when the pheasants were killed. The pheasants are used to train his hunting dogs and falcon. Even though he has seen bears before he has not had problems with them before. I told the RP that since the bear was rewarded, it will most likely return. I told him that he should think about reinforcing the cage and setting up an electric fence and setting out bear unwelcome mats. The RP said he is too old to do anything and he just wants the bear removed. I told the RP that he can also use rags soaked in ammonia as a deterrent and to use noise to scare the bear if he sees it again. Again he said he just wanted the bear gone and requested that an officer call him back. I offered to send him education materials but he declined.
 L. Berry

WL544 did a site visit on 07/27/2020. WL544 observes where the bear broke into the pheasant enclosure and destroyed the pheasants. WL544 then offered to set a pepper barrel with some of the pheasant carcasses. The RP thought this would be a good idea. WL544 set a pepper barrel on 07/28/2020. RP still expressed concern about the bear getting into his falcon pen. WL544 suggested using ammonia around the pen to make sure the bear is deterred from the area where falcons are kept. WL544 issued RP some rubber buckshot encase the bear is back and he can haze it away. RP was advised not to shoot bear in face or eyes and signed a release of liability form. WL544 did hand RP some education materials on how to electrify the pheasant enclosure to protect against bears. RP thanked WL544

END

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials
Comments: Bear entered open garage and ate recycle. Trap set 6/1 pulled 6/4

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: RP was very concerned about a large bear that had been on his porch and gotten into his grill. DWM Gallegos spoke to the RP on the phone for about 30 minutes, educating him on bears, and attractants. DWM Gallegos stopped by the following morning and spent nearly two hours at the residence. RP and his wife had no knowledge of bears.
Inspected one calf,  likely killed by a bear.

On 10/14/2020 Lori Embry called to tell me a lady who lives  in a camper trailer on their property  had a bear break into her car.   She told me the only thing she had in the car were bags of trash she planned to take to Salida.  

She also informed me that the lady, Amy, has seen the bear off and on throughout the summer. 

I went to Embry's house to give her husband, Stan, rubber buckshot should the bear come back.  While there they told me Amy was at her camper trailer and suggested I go talk to her.

I went to Amy's camper trailer and spoke to her.  She told me she had bags of garbage in her car and she planned to take it to Salida the following day to get rid of it.  She told me she must have left her window cracked a little bit and  the bear then got in.  

I told her I could set a trap for the bear.  She did not want me to set a trap.

I recommended that she fix the car window as soon as possible, that she lock her doors, door on her camper and keep the camper windows closed.

Because she didn't have a shotgun I told her she could use a paintball gun and shoot the bear if it came back.  I told her to call me if it had a pattern of coming back and I would try to shoot it with rubber buckshot.

WL544 stopped at Larkspur fire department to talk about a moose in the area. The fire department told WL544 about a bear they had been having issues with for the passed week. Larkspur fire does have a bear proof trash can and have tried hazing the bear. WL544 advised they could use paintballs to haze the bear away from the trash since load noise was not working.

END

At around 9:03 Pm on July 6th 2020 the bear visited the fire station again. RP stated that they fired a blank .22 starter pistol into the air when the bear put its paws on the dumpster. RP stated that the bear did take off immediately to the sound of the .22 blanks. WL544 thanked the RP for keeping him updated. 

END

Marguerite called in stated that a large bear was walking around outside the arrowhead bed and breakfast attempting to get into vehicles.  She also stated that a bear had gotten into their trash last week in the trash company refuses to change the time of pick up and encourages people to leave their trash out the night before.  She will be looking for a new trash company. 
Wildlife officer 523 repsonded and searched the property for the bear but was UTL.  WL 523 will be setting a pepper barrel on the property the following day to help address the issue if the bear returns in the near future.
Pepper barrel was placed on property on the 24th.  Property owner requested to purchase four of them so they could remain on the property.

Pepper barrels were removed from the property on the morning of June 7th.

At about 3:45 on June 7th RP called and stated that the bear had actually returned at about 3pm that afternoon after the barrels had been removed and dumped over a trash can that only held construction materials.  Bear was run off at that time.  RP has requested that the pepper barrels be returned it possible.

On june 8th WLO523 received another call from the RP and a pepper barrel and a camera were placed on the property.  Black colored barrel.

Note: officer awareness information.  RP was arrested previously on attempted murder charges.

WLO 523 Rmoved the pepper barrel.  End of report

DWM Mike Brown received a telephone call from a landowner that wished to remain annonymous regarding a neighbor that repeatedly leaves their trash outside and has been attracting bears into the area. DWM Mike Brown traveled to the violators residence on the evening of 07/31/2020 in addition to the morning of 08/01/2020 but was unable to make contact with the homeowner.  Attached are the photos of the trash that has been strung everywhere.

Bear broke into chicken coop and ripped the door off and she killed two chickens and injured a third one. Bear had two cubs in the tree in the backyard as well.

Another bear, not the sow with cubs,  showed up and showed interest in the chicken coop.  WL 287 did a site inspection, the bear was gone upon arrival.  WL 287 went over RP making an electric fence for his chicken coop.

On 08/11/2020 Wildlife 261 received a call from Chaffee County Dispatch informing him that the RP called in and stated that there was a bear cub running around and went up a tree at 705 B St. WL 261 responded to the location and found a sow with 2 cubs up a tree in the front yard of the address. WL 261 identified the sow and cubs as the same bears that were up a tree earlier in the week in town. WL 261 contacted WL 260 and informed him of the situation. WL 260 stated that WL 261 should attempt to dart the sow and relocate the bears if possible. Do to the bears location in the tree WL 261 decided to wait until the sow relocated closer to the base of the tree before attempting to dart it. The sow never made it low enough to dart. WL 261 watched the bears until crowds left the area. WL 261 had to haze the cubs using noise several times  in order to keep them trees with the sow. At 8:15 PM the cubs left the tree naturally and the sow remained in the tree until WL 261 left the scene at 9:20 PM.

RP reported that bear was getting into livestock grain the last 3 nights. RP is working on getting grain containers built. WL 527 responded and set a blue pepper barrel. 

WL521 picked up pepper barrel. No further co.flict reported.

326 responded to location and found evidence of a bear getting into a recycling dumpster. Spoke to a resident who said she puts her trash in the dumpster. Advised her to use the trash bin, not recycling dumpster. Sat for 30 minutes to see if bear returned to haze it. No bear. Nothing further.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
Bear getting into trash at KOA campground. Bear in campground at time of call. Bear chased off on 3 different occasions throughout the day on 6/19. 
Bear has been coming around for several weeks.
WL 330 and 329 set trap evening of 6/18. WL 324 picked up trap on 6/22, no activity or sightings reported by RP and nothing captured on trail camera
Bear returned 7/3 to the campground, people scared it away. 324 set trap 7/3, picked up the trap7/6, no activity on trail camera at the trap location

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
RP said a sow with cubs broke into there garage yesterday and then into their daughters apartment today. Bears got into home through doggie door, so RP thinks it was the cubs that came into the home while the sow stayed outside. Please call back
Update: trap was set, nothing caught

RP stated she had a sheep killed by something in the middle of the night. 325 responded, sheep kill consistent with bear predation. Sheep pasture was electrified. Trap set 7/31. Electric fence repaired and no further signs of bear. Trail cam at trap showed no bear activity. Trap pulled on 8/3.

Sow with three cubs (last years). Sow was sleeping up a tree and cubs were messing with a closed window. Call was that a bear was trying to break into a residence but the cubs were just testing the window. 492 Talked to several people in the area and moved educational materials to bears location.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments:
Bee hives have been destroyed, the frames were out of the box. This is the second time it has happened. The hives are about 100 yards away. No electric fence is installed yet. RP would like a call back.

DWM CREEDEN VISITED THE SITE WITH MS. JONES ON 10/20/20.  GAME DAMAGE FORMS AND A BEE FENCE REQUEST FORMS WERE DELIVERED 10/21/20.   FENCE REQUEST TRANSMITTED ELECTRONICALLY TO GAME DAMAGE ON 10/21/20.

RP states bear has been living under her driveway bridge for the last week or so. The bear is there the majority of the time and appears to be possibly digging a den. Passed the call onto WL 290.

WL 290 and 281 returned to the property and hazed the bear with rubber buckshot out from the under the bridge and placed unwelcome mats to deter the bear.  RP advises to call back if the bear is seen again this winter.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments:
WL 284 called to ask if bear aware volunteers could assist WPPD with a bear in an unoccupied, house being built in the Stoneridge subdivision.  When BA  arrived WPPD Officer Mike had already cleared the house and the bear(s) were gone.  The bears were reported to have moved SW along the green belt.  The sow and cubs appear to move off when hazed but stroll through the neighborhood when not confronted.

A construction dumpster in front of the house has non-construction trash in it and about half full is the attractant.  Per Terri Collins the bears have been frequenting the dumpster attracting a crowd wanting to see the bears and take pictures.  

We spoke to several residents in the area.  They confirmed the bears are frequenting the dumpster regularly. 

Terry Collins said she was going to contact the general contractor so they can request that they don't throw non-construction trash into it.  I asked the neighbor across the street, at 1314, to call if the bears showed up again.  

Drove around the subdivision and spoke to anyone with garage doors open.  Also drove around the Northwood subdivision.


Recommendation:
Speak to the construction crew about having the dumpster dumped as it is an attractant.
Canvass the subdivision to education about being bear aware
Sub-Adult in RP’s tree.  Not causing any damage, not being aggressive.  Gave standard bear aware information and a “Living with Bears” pamphlet.

At approximately 8:30pm on September 15th, 2020 Wildlife Officer Serena Rocksund was dispatched by CSP to the crossroads of Independence Drive and Bear Dance Drive for a cub hit by a car. The cub was still alive, but not mobile and bleeding from the face in the middle of Independence Rd. Rocksund called back RP, Ashley Snider, to confirm. Another RP, Carol Anne, called to confirm that fiends were leaving her house and hit a small bear when they swerved to avoid a much bigger bear. No party stopped  because they were scared of the sow being in the shrubs.  Rocksund told Carole Anne that officers will arrive within the hour to dispatch the bear and in the mean time nobody should approach the dying cub. Douglas County responded around 9PM and confirmed cub had succumbed to injuries and was on side of road. Cub was picked up at 9:20PM by Rocksund. Cub was approximately 65-lbs, dark brown with light muzzle, and male. Cub was assigned seal #33768. -542

Standard bear aware recommendations, gave bear aware handouts, gave resort manager rubber ball rounds to haze bear and completed liability waiver for the rounds. Asked them to keep me posted on any further conflicts.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Trap Set , Educational Materials , Euthanized

Comments:
RP called to report a bear hanging out in her pond. The RP backs up to open space. WL544 told her that it is not uncommon to have bears move through the area. RP said that the bear was there early in the morning and then left but came back at around 11am. The bear was just hanging out in her pond and got ahold of some fish food that they give to the fish in their pond. The bear did consume the fish food. RP said she was no longer at the address she was out for the day.

Then the phone call died. WL544 called back and left a message saying that if when they got home the bear was still there then he could come out. WL544 also texted the individual saying that often when bears are moving through they come in due to attractants. WL544 said that they should bring in these attractions like fish food that way the bear just continues to move on. If WL544 gets more information then it will be added to this report. 

Bear came back at around 2:30pm so WL544 said he would take a look. When WL544 and 549 did the site several bird feeders were observed. WL544 told the RP that she needed to remove the bird feeders and that would most likely solve the issue with the bear coming around so often.
END

RP called 325 and stated that a bear defeated his bear resistant trash can that night and that his son Kody Hill (who is his neighbor at 68 beucler pl) had a bear get into his unsecured trash bin. Also stated that he keeps a spare fridge and freezer on his back deck that a bear got into a couple years ago and was worried about it again. 325 suggested contacting his trash provider to replace trash bin and to make an unwelcome mat for his fridge area. 325 will also contact  Kody about unsecured trash.

Vehicle vs. bear @ I-70 mm159.1
Seal#39034.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting

Comments: WL124: Someone reported a bear in the bed of a truck in their apartment complex. WL124 responded on scene to observe a lone small bear (~40-50 lbs) getting into two trash bags in the bed of a pickup truck filled with refuse.  WL124 ran the bear off.  Attempted to contact owner of vehicle but unable to contact.

RP is 90 years old and told me a bear had been hanging around her house.  She told me she keeps food in a freezer in her garage and she was afraid the bear would break the garage door, get into the garage and into her freezer.  She told me the garage door had dirt under it and she was afraid it would dig, or pop open the door.  

She also told me other people in the neighborhood were having problems with the bear.

Went to her residence and placed bear mats where the garage door meets the ground.  She didn't have a shotgun so I told her to shoot into the ground and not at the bear if the bear came back.  Told her I could issue M-80s once the fire ban is lifted.

I did not get an exact time as to when the bear was at her residence.  She smelled the bear outside of her house and could hear it, but didn't see it.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: On 08/20/2020 Wildlife 261 received a message from Chaffee County Dispatch that a bear incident was occurring at Cascade Campground. WL 261 contacted the RP and the RP stated that she was in a tent with several children and adults and there was a bear outside the tent getting into a cooler they had left outside that contained food and beverages. The bear was between the tent and the car and the RP did not feel comfortable and wanted to get everyone into the car and asked how to scare the bear off. WL 261 informed the RP to use the panic button on her car to engage the horn and to start screaming at the bear from inside the tent to get the bear to leave. The RP did so, and the bear slowly walked off into through the campground. The RP then was able to get everyone into the car successfully. At this time the WL 261 responded to the campground and and was unable to locate the bear. WL 261 then went to the Buena Vista shop and obtained a large educational sign that warns of bears in the area and informs campers to put coolers, food and trash into locked cars. WL 261 put this sign up in the middle of the entrance and exit road to the camp ground. WL 261 then made contact with the RP and evaluated the campsite. The RP told WL 261 that the bear just got into the cooler and slowly walked off when noise was made. WL 261 educated the RP on the importance of locking up bear attractants in cars and informed her not to leave anything with a scent in their tent at night. She stated that the group was leaving that morning and would not be at the campground any longer. WL 261 then went to the camps around the area that had people outside in the early morning and informed them of the bear and gave them the same educational information that he gave the RP.  WL 261 then went to contact the camp host and found out there was no longer one at the campground. WL 262 came back to the campground later that same day and informed all campers in the campground that she could locate that there was bear activity in the area and to lock up all bear attractants when not in use.

Rp reports bear currently in her home. Boulder animal control and SO deputy arrive to find small cinnamon bear back outside home. 127 arrived and bear attempted to re-enter home. Bear moved a short distance away, and 127 darted the bear. Bear ran when dart hit, and 127 and the Boulder SO deputy searched hill behind home for over an hour before bear was found. 123 and 124 arrived as bear was found, and assisted in transporting the bear off the hill. 124 drove the bear to Fort Collins where it was handed off to Area 4 officers for release in the Laramie River Valley.

Tom with Wyndham maintenance called to inform 325 that a large bear has been seen in the last couple days around the resort and tipped a full size dumpster over the night of 5/4/20.  Likely one of the same bears that frequented the area last fall.
325 sent notice to Wyndham to secure dumpsters in April 2020. Tom and trash collection service are in the process of securing dumpsters (resort has many).

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments: Richard McCollum called to tell me bears had gotten into apiary, dug under fence and destroyed 2 bee boxes.  Did not want anything done about the bear at the time. Damage was likely fairly old.

RP stated she has been having issues for a few months. On September 20th bear got into dumpster and spread trash. Bear went under deck on October 1st but came back out. Has had to clean trash up about 5 times now. Bear was back again last night and made a large mess with trash. - SC HSS

Bear was seen by RP at edge of water and around multiple campers.   I arrived on scene and spoke to all campers who were away about bear safety.   Finally found bear leaving area on west edge of private Lake John Resort.  Followed/chased on foot, trying to get close enough to effectively use rubber buckshot.  Never got close enough but decided to try to use the sound and repercussion of rubber buckshot to discourage bear.   Placed signs around private and Lake John SWA the following day.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Relocated
Comments:
Sow w/ cub tipping over trash can. Bear broke into outdoor drink fridge that had steaks marinating in it. Bear did not eat steaks but tore into drinks. RP wanted an officer to come out and take a look. 321 was going to RP's house to speak w/ him.
321 set trap on 6/25. Sow with 3 cubs caught and relocated on 6/26 - Cub 2 of 3 Cub was not given an ear tag .

What is believed to be the same bear from several incidents the week before in the Blumenau subdivision moved several miles north into the Cristo vista subdivision.  There it went into an open garage, as well as getting a bird feeder at another residence.  Officer Krall arrived on scene as the bear was finishing off the bird feeder.  After it finished the feeder the bear approached Krall and a deputy one within 10 yards.  Krall hit the bear with several bean bag rounds and the bear did not go very far.  The bear began to approach another house so Krall treed the bear.  Krall notified WL 220 about the situation.  Based on the fact that every non lethal means was used to try and change the bear behavior with no success (spray barrel, electric fence, rubber bullets), the decision was made to euthanize the bear.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments: RP reported a blonde and brown color phase bear tore into her siding on her home, attempted to get trash out of an empty dumpster, and entered her back yard. During the site inspection DWM Brown instructed the RP to take down her hummingbird feeders and get rid of outside trash. Due to the bear coming on the deck and up to the door in addition to tearing at the siding on the home a trap was set on 06/20/2020. DWM Brown provided the RP with bear deterrant rounds in addition to instructions on how to make both an electric and non-electric unwelcome mat.

Bear got into trash and is attempting to enter home. RP's mother is only person home but is too scared to exit or haze bear.
Same bear later reported at 51691 Hwy 6 #23 in GWS getting into trash.
461 and 465 were able to tranq the bear in a backyard at 421 Cedar Crest Dr. GWS at approx 4:30 pm.  Bear was red ear tagged 8140 and relocated to Resolution Creek ,  39.489664, -106. 255558,GMU 45, 79.5 miles from capture site.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
RP called stating that they had a sow with 3 cubs come by last night 6/21. On 6/22 the had another young bear come by and get into piles of materials in their yard and open the door to a shed and went inside. WL 527 responded and observed lots of household items in pile in the yard, but did not see any evidence of food type attractants. WL 527 set blue pepper barrel #1 on the property and educated the homeowners on hazing techniques. 

6/28 WL 527 removed pepper barrel and put it at Mt Evans SWA. RP said bear was seen in the area but not at her residence. WALTER

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials
Comments: Aspen PD responded to a bear in house at ~4:45am on 5/18. Bear was still in the house while on the phone with APD. Bear supposedly came in through kitchen window. RPs locked themselves into a room upstairs. RP also stated that a sow with cubs was there last week. Only one bear present  when APD responded. Waiting for a call back from Forest with a description and a trap will be set.
Eating cat food
Inspected carcass of calf,  foot prints nearby of bear,  does want a game damage claim

Bear got into trash.  Performed a site inspection and recommended a ratchet strap on the container.  RP was also having Skunk problems and asked if they could trap them.  Advised that they could but Law required that they be euthanized or released in the same location they were trapped.  Explained that relocation was not an option.

RP stated bear is getting too comfortable with people. Worried about their safety along with their kids and pets. This bear is tagged. Reported to on call officer Jeff - SC HSS
WO 484 spoke to RP and notified WO 482.  WO 482 observed the ear tagged bear near the location.  Bear was not getting in to trouble.

WL526 received report that a bear was attacking goats at the above address.  RP said that bear was attacking goats, they attempted to scare away bear. Bear left and returned several times.  WL526 responded.  RP was renting approximately 10 goats for fire mitigation.  WL526 inspected two puncture wounds on one goat.  The goat seemed fine otherwise.  WL 526 provide information to avoid conflicts. Owner of goats came to get goats while Officer was there. Did not set pepper barrel since attractants were removed.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments: Between 6/20 and 7/1 Alexander's lost 5 lambs, likely to bear.  Wildlife services killed 2 bears from the herd.

No further response as of now.

WL541 received a report from the RP that a large dark brown colored bear with a green ear tag in the left ear was in Tucker Gulch around 7:00pm.  It matched the description of the bear that had been hanging around Tucker Gulch and hitting trash cans within the neighborhood since last week.   
WL545, WL546 and WL541 responded to try to haze the bear.

The bear was followed around Golden and hazed with noise and lights until it crossed over Highway 58 and was lost in the vegetation surrounding Clear Creek.

Bear broke two window in the Garage and ate a half a bucket of rat poison. Also opened up a refrigerator door that was in the garage.. The fridge raider was unplugged and did not have any food in it.  The bear also opened up a truck door and licked a candy bar wrapper clean.. The bear also got on top of the roof and chewed on three vents and tried digging up the earth roof trying to get into the house. The bear also pushed in a door on a Bunkhouse which did not have anything except for a bed inside.
As the bear was digging and chewing on vents and the  roof the owners were inside sleeping.

WL 186 set a trap on the morning of 7/4

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Relocated
Comments:
RP left a message reporting that he has had three or four bears on his property for the last few nights. They destroyed his chicken house, killed 5 chickens, broke some of his trees, got into the grain bucket in his tack shed, and got into his trash. The RP was notably upset in his message and stated that if we didn't do anything today, he was going to kill all of the bears himself.  RP would like to be contacted.
321 did site visit and seen damage to chicken coop and grain storage. RP said that they've seen at least 2 bears together there on their property. Set 2 traps with 327 on 6/5. Caught 1 bear and left trap set another day. No pictures on game camera other than the 1 bear we caught. Traps pulled 6/7.
RP states they found calf carcass with a bear feeding on it.  I inspected carcass and it had damage consistent with bear depredation.  APHIS will attempt removal

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: RP had a bear break thru a double pained window over their kitchen sink at 3:45 am while they were in the house asleep . He didn't fit thru the window and the RP thinks when the glass shattered it scared him because the bear left the area. They have also had their camper and their vehicle broken into at this address over the last two weeks. They would like a trap set if possible and they are willing to have it set at their property. Explained to put an unwelcome mat at the base of the kitchen window, secure the window and lock vehicle and camper. Use ammonia soaked rags around the areas the bear broke into. RP would like officer follow up.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments:
The RPs prize $15,000 llama was killed and partially eaten by a bear. Aphis was called and they used hounds to try to track the bear on the 22nd. It was too hot and windy for the dogs to catch a sent trail. Aphis stayed out all night with a remote camera in the carcass. The bear did not come back and the dog were tried again the following morning with no luck. Aphis will try again on the 26th.

Game Damage paid out at $3,500.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Trap had been set at this location about 3 weeks prior. A bear was trapped nearby and thought to be the correct bear. RP called to say the bear was still there and kept trying to break into cars. Trap was set on 7/24. Bear entered trap on night of 7/25, but latch didn't work. Different trap set on 7/27.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Comments:
RP sent a picture of her chicken coop with damage to the bottom portion of the door on 8/15/2020.  

When I called the RP she told me the bear did just as I said it would, and got into their dog food which was outside in a pole barn next to the chicken coop in a wooden container. 

Went to the residence and looked at the damage to the coop.  The bear did not break the door, but instead tore a small piece off the bottom edge of the door.

While looking at the chicken coop the RP and her son cleaned up the remaining dog food and removed it from the pole barn.  While talking to her, she told me she looked into the cost of bins to store the food and they were around $1,500.00.  I recommended she  look for barrels with rings on Craig's List.

I left and came back with bear mats, a personally owned electric fence charger and equipment to build an electric fence.  We screwed a bear mat to the door of the chicken coop, placed a bear mat in front of the door to the chicken coop and then erected a 2-strand electric fence in front of the pole barn (where the dog food was stored) and in front of the chicken coop.  The RP has serious health issues & her son had a concussion so I helped her secure the coop and erect the fence.

Checked in with the RP on 8/16/2020.  She told me she heard the bear at the coop at around 3:30 AM, and told me their dogs were barking.  When she inspected the coop she didn't find any damage.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials
Comments: RP thought that a raccoon was killing his chickens now he thinks it's a bear.  He said a near got into the trash and he saw a bear walk through his property and tipped over things in his shed.  The place is in disarray so it was difficult to tell what as out of place and what was not.  Gave rubber buckshot, set pepper barrel, gave Living with Bears pamphlet.
Bear broke passenger window out of 569 JJU CO Chevrolet 1500, bag of Milk Bone dog biscuits on floor, passenger side

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments: Believe it is the same bear as reported by Tommy Walker 8.24.2020.  Met RP at his home in Ptarmigan Meadows.  Gave advice and changing out dumpster and/or securing it.  Advised to have other residents put up bear attractants.  Gave RP some informational materials that they could put on the subdivision Facebook page and some rubber slugs.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior

Comments:
Bear entered the home at approximately 5:30 pm. RP and his daughter were inside the home at the time of break in. Bear came in through an open screen door, walked through the house, took a bag of pistachios and left through the laundry room window. The only damage done to the home was the screen on the laundry room window was destroyed.

6/25/2020 a dry sow was caught in a snare. It was not the target bear. The sow was darted, tagged, and relocated. The snares were reset, since the target bear was seen on trail cameras visiting the snare site the day before.

Target bear was not caught. Snares were pulled 6/26/2020

RP called about a bear with an injured jaw at her residence.  Went to the residence and the bear was no longer there.  They showed me pictures of the bear.  It appeared to have a large cut on it's cheek.  The picture wasn't really good so it was hard to tell if it had a broken jaw.  Told them to call if they saw it again and it looked like it was worse or couldn't forage.

RP reported that a young bear has been coming around house during the past week.  RP stated that he had bird seed feeders out during the day but has been bringing them in at night. Also has had hummingbird feeders out.  Bear showed up last week and came up to house 3-4 times during the day.  Was most recently on deck of house Friday night 7/17 and early morning 7/19. RP advised to take down all feeders.  Day phone to reach RP 970-264-6887, evening 970-264-0103.
W328 provided RP with rubber slugs.

Bear was wandering around the Texan Resort which is full of people, coolers, cabins with grills, etc.  The Texan always has had issues with customers not securing food and other attractants.  Early in the morning, a bear was walking the perimeter of the main office house where the R.P. is living.  She heard a noise in the kitchen and a bear had opened an exterior door and had gotten into the refrigerator.  The door showed no sign of forced entry, so most likely it wasn't latched.  Bear ran off when yelled at.  Report was made to S.O. and C.P.W. around 10:30 a.m.  After talking with R.P. and another staff member at the Texan, it sounds as if multiple bears are passing through the resort on a regular basis.  I instructed them to secure all attractants and really work to educate guests about what they need to do.  R.P. was not happy that I wasn't going to trap the bear that got in her kitchen.  I tried to educate her about how trapping the correct bear could be difficult due to multiple bears visiting Lake City.  Based on reports/rumor, I guess there may be upwards of 4+ different bears doing different things in town.  The staff stated they needed to get a deadbolt lock for the door the bear came through.  I also suggested the potential deployment of an electric mat to protect the door of interest  The staff of the Texan have been less than willing over the years to take minimal extra steps to "bear-proof" the business.

Bear got into RP's vehicle.  Talked to rp about breaking a window.  When I arrived the bear was out of the truck.  Bear was described as a smaller cinnamon colored bear.  We also discussed ways to strengthen the trash enclosure.  WL524.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments:
Bear went into chicken and duck coop past 3 nights and killed all ducks and chickens except for 1. RP set trailcam and saw that bear had ear tags in ears. RP is worried about his calves.
321 did site inspection and observed  chicken coop and duck pen tore into by a bear. Landowner had trail cam pictures of ear tagged bear in there and seen the bear take off with a duck. 321 set trap on 8/3. Bear caught and euthanized.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Rehabilitation
Comments:
RP was walking home from work around 1140pm. She turned the corner and saw a bear about 20 feet away.  She saw a cub come out from behind the bear. The bear charged her. She turned and the bear swiped at her once ripping her shirt and scratching her back. She fell to the ground and was able to get up and the bear was gone.  She reported it to Manitou PD at 9:30am on 7/10. The PD called the wildlife office. WL 287 interviewed the RP and collected the clothes she was wearing.  WL 287 then found out a coworker of the RP was walking home at 11:45pm on the same street and had a  sow with two cubs chase her around a truck twice. She was able to get away unharmed.

WL 287, 283,284 all set two traps at the following locations:

GPS coordinates: 38.85856, -104.91951

And  another at 38.85568,-104.91689

APHIS was able to locates the bear with hounds at 530am. She was euthanized and sent to the health lab. 

White 235 is the recorded pit tag number. This is one of the cubs

Unrecorded pit tag belongs to white ear tag cub 323. (Pit tag number 982.000364296201).

Both cubs were sent to Wetmore rehab.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Hazed , Pyrotechnics
Comments: RP contacted DWM Brown regarding a bear that had been frequenting the area. DWM Brown arrived and hazed the bear in addition to providing the RP with M-80's and bear deterrant rounds.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Pyrotechnics
Comments: RP said a bear broke the handle on his Tahoe. A couple other people reported a bear breaking into their vehicle.  WL225 found a vehicle with an open door and bear prints on 7/15/2020 at about 11:00 p.m.

No further response as of now.

WL541 received a report from the RP that a large dark brown colored bear with a green ear tag in the left ear was in Tucker Gulch around 7:00pm.  It matched the description of the bear that had been hanging around Tucker Gulch and hitting trash cans within the neighborhood since last week.   
WL545, WL546 and WL541 responded to try to haze the bear.   The bear was followed around Golden and hazed with noise and lights until it crossed over Highway 58 and was lost in the vegetation surrounding Clear Creek.

CSP informed 442 that there were two bears in the yard of the RPs address but there was no RP contact info. 442 went to the address but no bears were present and there was no answer. 442 talked with the neighbors and learned that they also saw the bear earlier but it was just walking through the yards of the neighborhood. 442 talked with them about measures they could take to discourage the bear from being in the neighborhood

RP reported a smaller brown colored bear had got into his bird feeders and requested that it be trapped and moved.  Krall told RP that he needed to remove the feeders as a food source and set  a spray barrel.  Krall explained the policy for trapping and removing bears and that the situation did not warrant a trap.  The RP understood.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Hazed
Comments: RP called to report bear stuck in car. Said doors may have been unlocked but didn't think had left any food in car. WL 488 advised rp to let bear out if comfortable doing so, but was not. WL 488 arrived around 0630 to let bear out. Bear ran off immediately and WL 488 shot with one round of rubber buck. Interior of car was completely destroyed (see photos). WL 488 observed mints in front console and rp said she had sunscreen in the car. WL 488 educated rp on basic bear aware and to lock car doors. WL 488 advised WL 483 who had been having problems with bears breaking into cars in same area. WL 483 set trap at residence on 8/11.  Trap pulled on 8/24 without success. -JH

Bear got in to Mr. Longs house while he was sleeping in his bed room. Bear broke through the back door of the house. Got into the contents in the freezer/ fridge.  Long scared the bear out of the house.  While trying to get out of the house,  the bear broke out the two front windows.   The bear came back the same night and broke two windows out of his vehicle. The bear did not get a reword from the vehicle.  The bear continued to come  back to Longs house for the next nine nights, getting in and eating food from in side the house. Every time the bear was in the house, Long was also in the house. Long Continued to scare the bear out of the house. The bear broke out a back window of the house and that was the window it continued to use to access the house 
WL 186 was not notified of this activity until 7/14/2020.  WL186 immediately set a trap that evening.  WL 186 help Long board up the back window to prevent the bear from coming in again. Long had previously boarded up the front windows so the bear was unable to get through the front of the house.

WL 186 pulled the trap on 7/23/2020 the bear never retuned to Longs house . The bear was not trapped.
Gate combo: 4182#

Bear came in about a week ago and knocked some hive boxes over.  Owner of the hives is Richard McCollum and has bee hives in multiple locations. The hives did not have an apiary kit around them. Jake Schmalz is the property owner where these hives are located.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials , Pyrotechnics
Comments: Small Brown/black bear killed two goats. Trap set. RP said bear had previously gotten into trash. RP has bear resistant cans coming on Monday. RP is also electrifying their goat pen and chicken coop. Is keeping goats inside.  RP also has video of bear bluff charging towards one of their employees.
WL124: RP observed large black bear heading toward the direction of 216 Main St. Provided advice.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: On 10/04/2020 the RP called and left a message with Wildlife 275 stating that she had a bear get into her trash for two of the last three nights. WL 271 forwarded the message to WL 261. WL 261 contacted the RP on 10/04/2020. The RP stated that in-between the night of 09/30-10/04 the bear had got into her housing units dumpster twice and scattered the trash all over the yard. She stated that it was a large dumpster with a plastic lid and the trash service did not provide a dumpster with a bar to secure the lids the last time they switched out the dumpster. She stated that the bear had jumped on top of the plastic lids until they collapse and then the bear can enter the garbage. WL 261 informed her that the best deterrent would be to place an electric fence around the dumpster or to surround the dumpster with unwelcome mats in order to stop the bears from getting into the trash. WL 261 also informed the RP to make sure everyone at the housing unit put away all bear attractants at night. WL 261 dropped off bear educational fliers to all the parties at the housing development on 10/05/2020 as well as the flier on how to make unwelcome mats to the RP. The RP stated that she would have to talk to her land lord about getting these measures in place.

Rp had issues last year with a bear getting into cat food that is stored in an old station wagon. There is a broken window that WL 225 secured as best as possible and relocated a bear from this site. Another bear broke through the blockage and got more cat food. Rp secured window further and WL 225 set a pepper barrel on 7/25.

RP stated two young bears have been frequenting her yard and attempted to get into her house. She said they tore screen out of back door on porch. RP said there are no attractants around house and trash is kept in garage.  Dilley visited site and found bird seed from feeder on back deck.   Rp said she removed feeder earlier that day.  Dilley told RP to permanently remove feeder and suggested ammonia rags at door locations to deter activity.

Rp called saying small cinnamon collared bear was in dumpster. Based on description probably a yearling. Bear somehow opened exterior garage door enclosing dumpster or went through door on side. Advised rp on how to get bear out, and while talking to him bear left dumpster. Went to site and dumpster appears mostly bear proof and no scattered trash.

Bear was on a property adjacent to the playground.  There is an 8 foot fence around the playground and a large open field between the playground and the property where the bear was seen.  The bear was not a ting aggressive.  The school had the kids on lockdown.  The principal and I discussed if it was safe for the kids to go back outside.  I recommended that the kids only be allowed to play on the south end of the playground approximately 100 yds from the area where the bear was seen.  If the bear entered the campus the principal and duty teacher would have ample time to get the kids inside.  I gave the principal a can of Bear Spray to carry while the kids are outside.  I will Patrol the area regularly during school hours.  Asked the principal to call if the bear was seen on campus.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: Bear entered open garage door and fed on trash.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments: Bear broke a window and entered outbuilding. RP boarded up window and bear returned the next day and broke a glass sliding door. Bear got trash that was stored in building. Bear was trapped on 7/14/20. Bear had previous pit tag but ear tags are missing.

No further  response needed.

On October 8, 2020 Officer McKee was visiting Katherine’s neighbor in regards to bear  activity.  The neighbor McKee was visiting spoke of the birdfeeders at Webster‘s property.  Officer McKee observed hummingbird feeder’s as well as seed  feeders at Webster’s address.  
Officer McKee observed Katherine in the yard.  They spoke about the consequences of feeding birds when bears are active.  Katherine stated she is an advocate for Wildlife and understands that she is actually creating issues with bears by feeding birds when they are active.  Katherine stated that she was aware that there was high bear activity in her neighborhood and had seen pictures of the bear from neighbors.  They spoke of ways to create bird friendly gardens.  Officer Mckee offered her literature but she stated she was fine.  Katherine stated she would Remove all of her birdfeeders.
J McKee

RP called CSP to report that a neighbor three houses down was throwing food to a bear that frequents the area. WL283 responded. While en route, the RP called back stating that the bear was walking down the street. WL283 asked the RP to follow the bear so that it could be hazed. WL283 ended up hazing the bear in a culvert that runs under Silent Rain Drive between Julynn Road and Aspen Glenn Lane. 

WL283 then went to 7259 Rising Moon Drive to talk to the residents there about feeding the bear. WL283 talked with a Dana Ahmed at that address and asked about the food. Dana said that he dropped food that he was eating for dinner as he was going outside to see what was going on. Dana said that there were kids outside and he wanted to make sure they were away from the bear that was outside. Dana said that he picked up the food afterwards. Dana said that he did not intend to give the food to the bear and knew that it was illegal to feed wildlife. I talked to Dana’s neighbor and it sounded like the original RP was not very friendly about the whole issue and that he was harassing the bear. Basically, it was a neighbor dispute issue over the bear. WL283 gave a written warning to Dana.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Trap Set , Relocated , Educational Materials
Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials
Comments: PCBR: plz call/about 4 am this morning RP had a bear in the kitchen/ BEAR IS GONE NOW/ bear broke in through window / would like to follow up with an officer/ rp answered no to id protocol

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: RP has three gots in enclosure near his cabin. RP woke up to goats in distress at 2am 7/5 and observed bear in enclosure with goats. Bear did not kill any of the goats and RP yelled at bear and it climbed out of enclosure and left. RP advised to put up electric fence. One goat was injured and RP believes that goat hurt it’s leg  running around in enclosure when bear was present. 330 set trap morning of 7/5. Trap pulled morning of 7/7. No sign of bear activity since initial incident. RP in process of erecting electric wire on goat enclosure.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior

Comments:
RP killed bear after it returned to chicken coop for a third time (killed 5 chickens). Also found front door  of house open with bear paw and nose marks on door. No damage done in home.
325 responded, removed bear, and advised to electrify coop.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage
Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear came to house on 3 separate occasions. Reached through open garage window and grabbed bag of sunflower seeds. Tore at trim around sun room window where dog food and cat food is stored.  RP says the windows to sun room are kept closed.  Wildlife 225 set a trap on 7/10/2020. 225 instructed RP to pick up all bird feeders and keep all doors and windows locked and secured.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments: Bear got into house on 8/25/2020.  Rp was in the house tried to scare bear away, but returned.  Rp hid in bathroom.  Trap set on 8/26/2020, trap checked on 8/27/2020 at 7:30 am, no bear in trap.  Trap was checked again on 8/27/2020 around 17:30, bear in trap.  Bear was taken to canon city HE building.  Bear was euthanized.  Seal # 37785. Tooth taken, and hide put in freezer for auction.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: bear has entered two seasonal staff housing units at home ranch.  The second time,  the bear broke through a dog door and people inside confronted the bear in the kitchen. Jack Taylor is setting the trap.

Bear tipped over dumpster and broke door open. Bear got into camper on 6/14. DWMs made site inspection and educated campers and campground hosts. Bear came back morning of 6/15 and was sniffing around tents at approximately 5:30 AM. DWM set a trap morning of 6/15. Trap pulled 6/19. Did not catch bear.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: On 08/23/2020 Wildlife 261 was on pronghorn hunting patrol when The RP flagged him down. The RP stated that a bear had come to her house last night and tore up the panels on their garage door. When WL 261 asked if there were any attractants out the RP stated she forgot to take a bird feeder in that night and the bear got into the feeder. The RP stated that the bear did not get into the garage at all. The RP also stated that she had an open trash container that was right next to the garage door on the inside. WL 261 educated the RP on the importance of putting bear attractants away at night, and recommended covering the trash in the garage and moving it away from the garage doors which the RP thought was a good idea. The RP also mentioned that she would put that there was bear activity in the area on a local social media page that the housing development has and ask others to put away bear attractants at night. WL 261 also gave the RP a bag with bear educational fliers.

WL 281 called and told there was a bear attack at Rampart Rd. And FS314. 281 and 286 responded to the area with two deputies. Camp was located and a bear was on scene when deputies arrived. Bear ran off right away. 

Officers quickly learned there was no bear attack. Officers asked what the bear did. Campers said they were concerned that it was an abandoned cub. They showed the officers the video of the bear. It was a subadult cinnamon bear with a blond Mohawk. 

The bear tried to get some food and then was scared off by the deputies. 
Officers did some bear aware education, shot off several pyrotechnics and left the area. They drove further down 314 to make sure there was no other camp with any issues. There were no other camps. 

Camp had several attractants present. The campers claimed to have just showed up a few hours before but seemed like they were transients living in the forest.

Officers did confirm that they were the ones that called 911. It is no understood how there was a miscommunication in sighting vs attack. Bear was never aggressive.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting
Comments: While responding to a bear incident at a nearby property, 325 saw a yearling bear digging up a yellowjacket nest near a residence. This was very likely the same bear involved in the nearby incident. Bear was shot with rubber buckshot and ran off. 325 spoke with homeowner and another part-time RV resident on the adjacent property. They stated that the same bear has torn up the RV drainage hoses several times, chewed on insulation panels, and that a different larger bear has gotten into their trash bin several times in the past couple weeks. 325 advised to get a bear resistant trash bin asap and later placed unwelcome mat around RV drain hose. Encouraged negative reinforcement.

RP called Routt County dispatch.  Dilley called RP.  RP stated the same large dark brown bear has been to her residence 9 times since late May.  She told Dilley she had three children and a dog.  During the first incident, the bear was able to get trash from a twin enviro bear resistant can. During subsequent incidents, bear has continued to get trash out of same can. Lid has been repaired twice according to RP.   RPsaid landlord will not allow her to put trashcans in shed on property. Dilley inspected site and mentioned ed the BBQ grill on deck  RP said she had never used it. Dilley explained it may still serve as an attractant. Dilley advised RP to make sure her doors were latched and locked and to keep the windows closed.  According to incident appreciate, there have not been other reports in the i.mediate vicinity. RP told Dilley she has had police out on three occasions and they used bean bags and flashlights to haze bear. She said they used multiple bean bags on weekend of July 4, but bear did not want to leave. Dilley asked if she had called CPW about issue and she said this was the first time she had contact with CPW.  Dille called local DWM and they said they had not had calls in that area. Dilley called RP back and indicated there had not been other calls nearby and emphasized the precautions he advised her to take earlier.

RP spotted two bear cubs without a sow about three blocks north of the intersection of the call. RP followed of the bear cubs until it went up a tree keeping a distance. RP saw with the bear for about 45 minutes before officers arrived. Once officers arrive they assessed the cubs. It matched the description of the bear cub that officers tried to catch earlier off of I25 that was abandoned. Officers were on scene for about 3.5 hrs before leaving. A sow was never seen. The second cub was not located.

While in area for illegal traps, owner of mine said bear had come in there barn a couple weeks ago and spooked mini-horses. Bear wasn’t aggressive and left after attempted pepper spraying. Rp doesn’t mind bear being there just not in barn. Gave rubber buck and advised basic bear aware.

Bear was underneath the RP's deck on the west side of the house.  RP noted it had been there all morning and would occasionally huff or moan at the RP when the RP would come out to "check" on the bear.  RP described the bear's behavior as lifting its head and them putting it down.  Pam and I went around to check on the bear but the bear decided to come out from underneath the deck.  The bear moved off due North and then West to 210 Elm Street and climbed a tree approximately 20 feet up.  Bear traveled favoring its injured paw but was able to move deliberately and without stumbling.  The bear appears to be retaining body mass from when we saw it a week or so ago.  Spoke to a handyman working adjacent to the Elm property.  Notified WPPD about the bear's location.

Advised the RP to never approach the bear even to "check" on it.  Advised on the use of rattle cans and the importance of rattling the bear safely.  Asked RP to let us know of any sightings so we can keep tabs on the bear.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Relocated , Educational Materials
Comments: Released sow and one cub.
Roadkill

RP said that a bear was hit by a car and could not use its back legs. It was between Old Ranch RD and Springcrest. The RP didn’t know for sure where because it was dark. Per another conversation per CSP dispatch. The RP said that the bear was at Springcrest and dragged itself into a field off Springcrest. The RP could no longer see the bear and left. 

An EPSO deputy arrived on scene and could not locate the bear. WL 287 arrived and searched the area with a spotlight and UTL the bear.
Rp states bears (yearling pair) are approaching maintenance workers the last two days.  A worker this morning swung a shovel at one that was approaching him.
Bear in Area,  tore off screens.  RP removed all bird feeders.  Pepper spray barrel set.

RP is requesting a response. RP is wanting rubber buck shot,because he is out of rubber bullets that he has been shooting at the bears to haze them. He stated that he went to a Bear program in Ken Caryl and was told not to use pepper spray,  to use buckets of ammonia as well as the rubber bullets.  I inquired if he had any bird feeders or dog food on deck where the bear was last night. RP stated no only flower pots. When I suggested putting down bear unwelcome mats RP stated that he has a house of glass and large opening to his deck.  RP also stated that cell service is poor at his place to please text, leave a message or just stop by.  J.Campbell NERO
Officer Olson contacted the RP and visited the residence. There are no attractants on site, and they are doing everything they can to keep the Bears at a distance from their home. A recent incident where a bear tried to go up on their deck caused further reluctance for tolerating their presence and he wanted another means to haze the bears. We also spoke about using paintballs and other motion activated sound and light devices. Also discussed laws around protecting property and living responsibly in bear country. J Olson #088

Complaint Type: Non-Food Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior

Comments: Was in area to give sub lethals to neighbor and Officer Kay saw a cinnamon/brown yearling bear eating trash on a front porch. Tried to taser bear but couldn’t get close enough. Bear showed fear of humans when approached. Trash was clearly not secured and spread all over front porch. Spoke with person at house (Zach) who was boyfriend of owner. Verbally Warned him and gave him till this evening to clean up as multiple trash bears in the area.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Relocated
Comments:
RP talked to WL225 at a gas station on 7/5/2020. RP said he had bought the house recently and believes the previous owner had been feeding bears. WL225 offered rubber deterrent rounds but RP didn't have a 12 gauge shotgun. WL225 provided his phone number and asked for updates.  RP called multiple times over a 3 day period while WL225 was out of town. RP said that a bear was breaking into something every single night for the past week and that he was concerned for his safety. RP said bear also broke into his vehicle which wasn't locked.  RP said he was carrying a gun and wanted to know what would happen if he shot the bear.  WL 225 called RP back on 7/15/2020 and left him a message.  WL 225 visited the address on the afternoon of 7/15/2020 but RP wasn't home or didn't answer the door.  There was an unsecured shed in the back yard with trash strewn about.  WL 225 returned the night of 7/15/2020 and noticed the shed wasn't shut or locked and the vehicle window was down. WL 225 spoke to RP by phone on 7/16/2020 and made a plan to set a trap that day. WL 225 told RP to make sure sheds were locked and windows were closed.
Bear was trapped the night of 7/16/2020-7/17/2020. Dark brown in color with lighter blonde on back and shoulders.  Bear was relocated. 
WL225 again spoke with RP about making sure vehicle windows were rolled up and doors were locked.

Large brown colored bear napping 50 feet up in a tree in the middle of a condo complex. 325 and 328 responded. Talking with residents, this bear and two others (brown yearling that is also napping in a tree nearby, as well as a very large brown/cinnamon bear. 500lbs) have been frequenting the area. Educated numerous residents about bringing in bird feeders and securing doors and windows. Lots of bird feeders out. 325 will check on bears throughout the day but they will likely be in trees until dark.
Photo 1 is large brown boar. Photo 2 is brown yearling. Photo 3 is very large brown/cinnamon bear from a video doorbell in condo complex.

RP called to report 2 cubs trapped in dumpster and sow in tree beside dumpster and school. School buses pulled off before and held kids until wildlife officers arrived. 

Officers Nicholson and Woodward responded, were advised unknown deputy let bear cubs out of dumpster. One cub fled area, other cub climbed tree with Sow. Nicholson and Woodward consulted with principal and superintendent, agreed to stay on scene at tree with bears while students escorted into back access of school. Nicholson and Woodward set pepper barrel by dumpsters. RP advised bear tore hold in dumpster lid 2 weeks ago and trash company had not replaced. 

Nicholson called trash company and advised they must respond and replace trash lid. Trash company said they would replace lid and empty dumpster today. Nicholson recommended school superintendent change trash pickup to every week instead of biweekly, and request steel lids for dumpsters. Entered by Nicholson on 10/14/2020

Original RP Joel Siger 970-728-4929. Sow with Cubs eating acorns from oak brush near house. Dispatch noted that RP wanted bears relocated. WL382 called RP and discussed situation. WL382 and 381 did site visit to attempt to haze bears. No bears upon arrival. RP's wife stated that when RP started car and dogs started barking, bears ran away. Explained to RP's wife that with the natural food source around the house being the attractent, moving bears was not an option. Suggested RP get a shotgun for bear deterrent rounds and making noise to defend area around the house. Wife stated that she understood and would let me know if they could get shotgun. Lots of acorns in area.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments:
RP called WL321 and reported that a bear was near a spot they were spending the evening shooting 3D targets. The bear grabbed 2 of the 3D targets and damaged them and the RP hazed the bear. The bear circled them all evening and at one point got within 10 yards of the RP. The RP gave a warning shot from a 9mm pistol. The bear only went a few yards then stopped and sat down. The RP stated that there was multiple bags of trash at the campsite and the bear was seen going through it. 
WL321 went to the campsite and did a site inspection. There were bags of trash in the bushes and trash around the campfire ring. There was a tipi styled tent set up but no one was at the campsite. Food was observed in the tent. WL321 posted a bear warning poster in the campsite. WL321 went up the road and notified 1 more camp about the bear

Young bear getting into ratchet strapped garbage cans that have cracked corn in them. Bear has destroyed plastic and metal trash cans to get to corn. Advised RP to get 55 gallon drums with locking lids. RP was curious if he could shoot at bear with guns, offered rubber buck as an alternative.
WL124: Report of a bear walking through the hotel's property. Bear was unable to locate upon arrival.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Sighting , Aggressive Behavior
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Euthanized
Comments:
Bear killed several of RP's chickens a few nights prior. Keeps coming back and broke out windows of the chicken coop.  Showing little to no fear of people. Followed and bluff charged his neighbors.

WL 287 set a trap on 8/30/2020.

Trap was moved across the street on 9/ 4/2020. Bear was caught on 9/6/2020 and euthanized.
Black bear has killed and eaten 7 chickens will continue to come back to same location to kill all remaining chickens .  Landowner was informed  to euthanize bear if it enter chicken  coop.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage
Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: RP reported bear break in through unlocked, but “secured” door. Bear cane into mud room where door food is stored. Bear also tore down portions of a wood picket fence to gain access to the yard. Outdoor bear resistant trash can was locked, but thrown over. Neighbor had previously reported another sighting and trash conflict in the neighborhood. SO responded and bear was gone by the time sheriff deputy arrived.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Bear broke through a solid wood door I to a shed to get to one bag of trash.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set , Educational Materials
Comments: Colorado State Patrol contacted on call wildlife Officer M. Brown regarding a bear that broke into a home via a open window. Wildlife Officer M. Brown traveled to the residence and the bear left the inside of the home prior to his arrival. DWM Brown set a trap on that day and pulled the trap 5 days later after the bear was shot and had returned into the residence.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set
Comments: Rp texted 127 to report that a bear had broken into a cabin at the Boulder Watershed work station. Break in occurred overnight, bear went through entire kitchen. Doors are turn lever, and not locked. Rp cleaned up area and locked all doors. Rp called around 5:30 pm to report that the bear had returned, and broke through a window to try and enter cabin again. Rp was able to scare bear away and fire 1x hazing round, even though bear was outside of effective range. Large 200+ lb chocolate colored bear.

RP’s neighbors dog ran underneath the porch that has a bear underneath. The dog got trapped in the window well  that is under the porch, next to the bear. The bear was awake. The dog was continuously barking. WL 281 and 287  with RP, opened the window from the basement and grabbed the dog. 

The bear is missing a significant amount of hair from the face.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Aggressive Behavior

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Educational Materials
Comments: Sadie from SPIN preschool called and reported a bear getting into the dumpster at night.  The bear tips the boards off of the enclosure and goes in.  I did a site inspection and looked at the dumpster.  The dumpster is filled with fruit and food from snacks that the students don't eat during the day.  I recommended that they call Howard Disposal and have them bring a dumpster that has a lock bar on it.  I showed Sadie how to secure the lids with a ratchet strap in the meantime.  I recommended an electric fence around the enclosure that can be activated after the students leave for the day and deactivated before they arrive.  There is also evidence that raccoons are getting into the trash.  I explained that the electric fence would solve that issue as well.  I gave Sadie a "Living With Bears" pamphlet for further Bear Aware recommendations.  I will patrol the area at night and bean bag the bear if I see it.  Asked Sadie to call me if the bear came in during the day etc.

Complaint Type: Food Source Property Damage , Non-Food Property Damage

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Trap Set , Relocated , Educational Materials

Comments: RP said a small, black colored bear with a brown muzzle entered his home. When he chased the bear out it immediately ran into the open garage looking for food.  RP fired a round from a 9mm pistol which didn't seem to scare the bear at all.  Wildlife 225 set a trap and told RP he needed to remove the salt block behind his house.  In talking to other people in the area this bear has been very active, getting into garbage, tearing down bird feeders and looking into windows.  A non-target bear was trapped on 6/2/2020 and the trap was reset on 6/3/2020 since the bear was still reported in the area. Correct bear was caught about 2.5 hours later. Small sub adult Male. Euthanized per policy and 220.

Service Provided: Advice/Phone Call , Site Inspection , Trap Set

Fence next to dumpster that separates from carwash is smashed down and has brown bear hair on it. 325 contacted manager, Kevin Schuchart, and issued written warning. Multiple bears in the area targeting trash, Trap set. No bear activity on trail cam set at trap, pulled on 8/6. Schuchard got locking metal lids on dumpster on 8/7.

WL480 called and left msg with RP.  Went to address and did not see any damage.  Trash was un locked and some trash was on the ground.- JH

RP said a large black colored bear got into trash left in the bed of a truck.  RP said they have since remove the trash but were concerned about their pigs.  Advised RP to put electric around pigs.  Issued rubber slugs and gave RP Officer Zach Holder's contact info since incident occurred in his district.

RP said a bear had knocked his trash over and scattered it out.  RP was advised to secure his trash and take down his bird feeders.  RP also has rabbits and chickens and was advised that electric fence is recommended to protect those animals.

RP said they have had 3-4 bears hanging out on his property and they have been hanging out for the past week.  Started with just one and then yesterday it was 3 and today it was a different bear. WL 235 provided RP with deterrent rounds.

at 3am bear tore screen off window trying to get into house.   RP scared bear away.  RP would like a call back, but 520 405-5462 is a message phone, he has no phone himself.

Site visit by WL382 and 384. Advise given on prevention and harassment.
Young adult bear eating apples near residence on multiple occasions.  Homowner hazed bear with rubber buck shot. Blanck used additional rubber buck and slugs.

Roebuck contacted CSP who then contacted the Area 13 on-call officer, Kevin Madler.  Madler then contacted me and I then contacted Roebuck by phone.

Roebuck was upset because a bear broke limbs on his apple tree.  Went to Roebuck's residence with Wildlife Officer Kersey that same day and gave Roebuck rubber buckshot and rubber balls. 

We also recommended erecting an electric fence, or that he invest in electrified poultry netting to put around the trees.

Note-I did not ask Roebuck what time the bear was in the apple tree, or if he even saw the bear. The time of incident is unknown.

Please contact me for a complete incident report if needed.
Sow with 2 cubs "living" behind the RP's neighbors house. Getting into trash.
Bear pushed open the door of Mr. Younghans house.  Bear came into the kitchen.  RP was upstairs and heard the bear.  RP scared the bear out of the house. The bear never returned to the house.

Avon PD as RP via CSP. PD was asking for assistance with two bear cubs in an apartment dumpster. Dumpsters were insecure and trash enclosure doors were unable to close or lock. Dumpsters appeared to have no lids, trash was scattered throughout the immediate vicinity. In speaking with residents, they informed me that rarely were the enclosure doors closed and they’ve been unable to lock them for a period of years. Additionally, residents informed me that bears frequent the area on an annual basis. Unsure if this enclosure is largely responsible for the continued presence of bears. HOA was informed to fix and secure the dumpster enclosure. Plywood ramp was used to allow the cubs to exit the dumpster. I stayed on scene until the bears left, and used noise to haze them to a nearby creek that runs adjacent to the complex. Property management was also informed to remedy the problem in order to mitigate conflicts with bears, protect their residents and protect wildlife.

WL124: RP and his wife saw three sets of eyes near the Manor RV bathrooms that they believe to be bears and could hear them scratching metal. This occurred around the time and location of the bear that attacked a camper at site #80 ~5am.

RP stated has a small dog and she was taking her out last night and saw movement under a tree and a large bear got up and walked away.  This bear has a route between her and her neighbors. She pours ammonia on a towel and put on her cans nightly (3 bottles a week).  No bird-feeders.  We discussed putting ammonia in grease trap of her grill and building unwelcome mats to put by trash cans.  Bear spray also suggested.  She did ask if it could be relocated but I explained they are in bear country and he is being a bear and needs to be hazed.  Any smelly food is frozen until trash pickup.  Emailed and mailed bear packet.  T.Wallace NERO

Ken Caryl Rangers Notified Officer McKee that neighbors had picked up trash overnight that had been hit by a bear at 4 red Cedar.  Trash was hit originally on Sept 29th in the evening.  
Neighbors indicated that the trash is out every night before pick up.  Rangers placed a door hanger on the door with a note that trash could not be placed out the night before. Doorhanger was placed around Oct 2nd.  
Rangers received a call again on October 7 that the trash was once again placed out the night before.  
Officer Mckee visited on October 8.  The homeowner, Connie, Did receive the door hanger. She showed Officer McKee the door hanger and the note that she could not leave trash out overnight.  Yet, the trash went out again overnight.  Connie has current medical conditions and has a caretaker that has been taking her trash out the night before.  Officer McKee contacted her neighbor at number one red Cedar, and he stated he would help her with her trash on Wednesday mornings for pick up.  Connie was told she could not place trash out again and that she was putting her, her neighborhood, and the Bears at risk.
Connie was also told not to feed birds.  She had an empty hummingbird feeder on her porch which she asked Officer McKee to take down for her.  She stated she would not be putting the birdfeeder back out.
Connie received a written warning for failure to secure attractants.
JMckee

WL321 got a phone call from Dusty Veech, outfitter, and said that he was out setting cameras on a piece of leased land and came up on a bear. RP said that he started taking pictures and the bear came closer, he then yelled at the bear. The bear didn't seem to be afraid and came closer to him by a few yards. RP said that he gave the bear a warning shot from his .45acp pistol. Bear was not scared and advanced on RP. RP shot 2 more times in the ground. The bear moved to the side and advanced a couple more yards towards the RP. RP shot at the bear 4 times and says he hit it once. Bear turned and went up the hill. RP was out of ammo and went back the way he came. About 300 yards away from where the incident happened he called his wife and saw the bear come out of the trees towards him. RP said he was screaming at the bear and the bear would turn and walk a few steps into the trees and then turn and walk back towards him. The bear did this for a few minutes and then finally walked back into the trees. 
WL321 and WL327 went to the site and investigated. Found some brass and no blood.
Bear has gotten into more packages, trash left from first packages still on scene

Rp stated bear was in a newly constructed home and surprised her daughter when she went over to speak with the contractor.  The bear came out of the house towards her and then ran back into the house.  Rp states the bear had been seen getting into other garages and barns that day (493 later learned that all doors had been left open and the bear was not causing damage to enter).  493 arrived at the address and observed the house was in early stages of construction with no doors or garage doors hung.  Sheriff's deputies were on scene and said they had seen the bear but it ran away when they yelled at it, the bear later returned and ran away again after deputies yelled at it and had not been back since then.  493 attempted to locate the bear and was unsuccessful.  Deputies described the bear as cinnamon in color and fairly small, possibly a yearling.  493 examined the construction site and observed multiple fast food bags torn up within the house framing which the bear had discovered.  493 contacted the rp and informed her about what he had found and the rp said she would be speaking with the contractor about keeping the place clean and food attractants locked up or removed.
